reviews.text: Made a reservation for 7p, was there at 6:50 and we were informed that they are an hour behind with sitting people. What&#39;s the point of making the reservation? You should reevaluate tour system.

Me and my girlfriend went to this location and were served by Jessica. She had fantastic service and was very nice. She also recommended the Louisana Chicken Pasta which ended up being delicious. Very friendly and great service.

We came in for lunch. To say the least we were highly dissatisfied with the food. Our server and the service was great. The best thing we ate was the bread! The food was very cold and ruined the meal. I ordered the double bacon burger with fries. The fries were cold and tasted hard and old. My bf ordered a turkey club. He loves clubs but could barely finish his food bc the bread was so hard. We also ordered seared salmon with spinach. The salmon was so cold that when it came out the butter on the plate was already turning back into its sold form if you know what i mean. My other kids got the combo plate with shrimp scampi and steak Diane. Her steak was very good. Lukewarm but tasty. Needless to say we didnt take anything home. Still tipped on the 85$ bill. We didnt send anything back  bc we just dont like doing that. Idk if we will be back soon but i will give this location another try in the future. Hopefully they can redeem themselves!

Called for a reservation a half hour before my time. They took reservation but when I arrived they said I would need to wait... No apologies just said they were busy ( well then don&#39;t take the reservation) 25 minutes later we finally were sat. Now I know why I never come here.<br>The food was good and our waitress was awesome... but we really couldn&#39;t relax and enjoy since we had an appointment to get to and the delay put us behind.
Food was great as usual but the five stars are for the service by Sarah T!! She was so friendly welcoming and attentive. It&#39;s nice to see someone is doing a good job hiring at this location.

Had reservations, even arrived 10 minutes early, and after 55 minutes, and being made to wait outside in the cold because there were &#34;too many people in the foyer,&#34; we left.  I&#39;ve never had a bill under $100 here, but rest assured, they will never get another dime from me.   The manager also had a piss poor attitude along with the hostess at the front door.  Don&#39;t waste your time, go somewhere else.

Wow!  Wow!  Wow!  So many great things to share about our experience today at Cheesecake Factory!  We opted for curbside (our first time here for curbside) and we were so impressed!  <br><br>We called to make our order - easy as can be!  They start off with taking the order by asking your name, what kind of car/color of car, and your cell number.  Love the attention to detail!  <br><br>We ordered the Chicken Piccata (dinner size), grilled steak tacos, and the loaded potato tots.  The team member who took our order repeated our order back perfectly AND offered to add in the amazing bread and butter( complimentary).  We happily accepted!  She said it would be about 20 minutes.  No problem with that - we needed to do some shopping at a store right by there.  <br><br>When we initially drove over to pull into the curbside area by the front door of the restaurant, all of the curbside order parking spaces were taken.  Not a problem - we took a spot a little bit further down.  I then checked back and a spot became available shortly after.  <br><br>We saw a staff member helping another car when we pulled in so we waited until she was finished so we could ask if we needed to call someone to let them know we were here.  Side note - there is a phone number located on the curbside spot sign to call when you pull in and it just rings busy.  The staff member said that she would glad to help and asked our name on the order.  <br><br>We gave her all of the information and she was right back to our car with the food and to take our payment.  <br><br>The process was completely stress free and the order was spot on!<br><br>When we got home, all of the items were the perfect temperature and we noticed how perfectly packaged everything was.  They placed the toppings for the loaded potato tots in little containers so the tots would not be soggy.  The sauce for the chicken piccata was also in a small container so it did not get messy before reaching home.  <br><br>The portion sizes were generous!  What a fantastic value!  We will definitely be back to do it again soon!

I was feeling hungry after playing at The Rampart and on my way home decided to grab a bite and thought about The Cheesecake Factory.  It was around 4:50 p.m. and hoped it wouldn&#39;t be too busy because of the approaching rush hour.   Walked in and approached the Host stand and was greeted with a friendly, welcoming host whom you could tell had a beautiful smile behind her mask.  First time I&#39;ve ever been to a CF where there was zero wait time.  The gentleman host lead us graciously to our booth in the front room surrounded by windows.  Perused the menu and decided almost instantly on what to order.<br><br>Bernard approached the table and took our drink order.  I always have my go to drink, which is the Ultimate margarita.  Placed our order for the Caesar Salad, Calamari and the Baja Chicken Tacos.  He brought our drinks over rather quickly and was efficient and kind.  Because of the time I believe it was a shift change and therefore Bernard introduced us to two new servers.  Katrina and Hannah, whom were both lovely and friendly as can be.  If you show kindness and genuine regard towards me, then you will always, always be rewarded.  They truly made us feel well taken care of as if we were guests visiting in their own homes.  Thank you for that, it means the world.<br><br>The Food:  Caesar Salad had to be the most flavorful salad I&#39;ve tasted to date and I&#39;ve made plenty a Caesar&#39;s tableside in my years of serving.  The Calamari was cooked to perfection, light, crisp and not chewy.  The Baja Tacos were delicious, if you enjoy a smoky chipotle flavor.  For dessert had to have the World&#39;s best Hot Fudge Sundae!  Chocolate Caramelicious CK with Snickers to go.  Espresso and Baileys shot to top the meal off.<br><br>Best experience to date at this location, I usually sit at the bar when dining however because of the ordinance things are different for the time being.  I will definitely remember our phenomenal servers by name and ask for them upon my next visit.  I am still full after almost 12 hours of dining there.  HA it was that good!

Never been to a Cheesecake Factory before! I always taught and still do that good food is better prepared by mom &amp; pop than corporations.<br>This is a nice location, upscale and cozy. Service is friendly, regardless of several mishaps; our dishes were not served at the same time, food was &#34;auctioned&#34;, and you could tell it sat on the kitchen counter for a little while before it made it to our table. The server failed to give some basic information, leading to a surprise when food was served. So why a four stars rating? Well, the Carbonara was descent, and the pasta Campagna was pretty good (Campagna means bell shaped pasta, shame on us for not knowing that!). Their calories count is scary, but I give them credit for being transparent about it. Overall we left pleased with the experience.

Food delivered cold.$94 spent for family dinner and it was all cold cold. Plus this $9 beet and arugula salad is smaller than a regular side salad?!?! <br>Delivery person was on time, this is a restaurant issue and disappointed with overall quality.

Customer service was good. Server was attentative. This place definately carries that chain restaurant quality in their food. The price is absurd for the quality of food. Probably due to quantity as the dishes were big portioned. Our eggroll sampler was over friend and very greasy but i am glad i got to try every egg roll they have to offer. The chicken sandwich was ok as the chicken was pretty much absent in terms of flavor/seasoning. The pasta was very good. Broccoli perfectly cooked and seasoning very nice and spicy. Thr chicken in the pasta was also bland even with the seasonings used to put it all together. They probably left out the salt when cooking chicken. The oreo cheesecake was good.

Love this location. We come here frequently and always have great service. I love their extensive menu with a lot of vegan and vegetarian options. Make sure to make a reservation well in advance as this place is always popping.

12/19/2020 at 2:40pm, my wife and I went to get some cheesecake desserts at the rampart location.  My wife was next in line and all of a sudden the cashier let someone else cut in front of us.  Disregarding everyone that was in line, shouting out loud that they are just paying.  Also, disregarding social distancing and everyone&#39;s safety, including my wife.  It was really alarming the the type of service we received and carelessness of our safety.  Not to say the attitude of the cashier.  We left and went to the one by the outlet mall.  Customer service there is far superior than the one at rampart.  Very sad and unfortunate.  You need better people working at your location.  Unacceptable!

I order deliveries or pick up from the Cheesecake Factory fairly often. I usually repeat order the items that I have enjoyed in the past, but I decided to switch things up last week. DO NOT ORDER THE ROADSIDE SLIDERS. A picture is worth 1000 words, and after taking a bite, I opened the slider to find an end product that McDonald&#39;s would have bested. Check your Q.C., Cheesecake Factory. Very disappointed - if I were in the restaurant, I would&#39;ve sent it back. ....
Beautiful place great staff my salmon was just too bland but my spouse ordered chicken piccata and was great

This was our first time here at this location. We arrived shortly after they opened on a Saturday morning. On the weekends they have a brunch menu available. <br><br>Two of us ordered breakfast and the others shared a lunch sized Cobb salad. They also shared a monte cristo sandwich. All of our food was flavorful. <br><br>Our waitress was Mary. She was friendly and attentive. She kept my coffee filled. She also kept our water filled.

Ordered online for pickup last night. Estimated pickup time was off by ~10 minutes. You&#39;re supposed to wait for a text to pull up for your order. Service was friendly.<br><br>The food was mediocre at best. Significantly overpriced for the quality of food. <br><br>-Cheeseburger Spring Rolls ($7.95) - Just okay<br>-Cajun Jambalaya Pasta ($20.50) - Where was the &#34;Very Spicy Cajun Sauce?&#34; This was such a sad dish. There was something missing in the flavors, the shrimp was over cooked and the chicken was dry. There wasn&#39;t even enough sauce for one forkful of linguine<br>-Chicken Piccata ($18.50) - Not lemony, no capers. What a disappointment<br>-White Chocolate Raspberry Truffle Cheesecake (free with order) - Best part of the meal, same as I remember<br><br>For comparison, I&#39;ve only been to or ordered pickup from the Cheesecake Factories in Illinois, and they&#39;re always solid. I wonder why it&#39;s so different here. Won&#39;t be ordering from this location again.

They still have their tremendous menu and delicious food.  This was my first dinner out after being in the house for several months because of Covid-19 and I really enjoyed.  Our server Shawn was great.  I had the chicken marsala and mushrooms and it was delicious.  The portion was so big I took it home and had another dinner a few nights later.  My friend had a salad and avocado egg rolls.  I tasted an egg roll and it was really good.  This place never disappoints.

Let me premise by saying we have eaten at Cheesecake Factory for years at least once a month. Never has there ever been an issue. The food is always been stellar as well as the service. Last night, for our wedding anniversary we wanted to place an order for takeout. I called the restaurant and a &#34;team&#34; member said please hold........ after 35 minutes of awful phone distortion I hung up and called back to repeat the same hold pattern. I figured they were having issues so I decided to go online to place our order. The site could not accept our order no matter how many times I restated the site. It was everthingthing from card was not excepted, to items no longer available contrary to the website, to try ordering thru Doordash rather than pickup. After a total of 1.5 hours we decided to go elsewhere. Because we frequented the restaurant so much, I thought perhaps due to Pandemic they were experiencing some temporary issues. I felt I owed it to the restaurant to let the manager to be aware of these issues. After being placed on hold for 30 minutes the manager comes to the phone and says &#34;yeah?&#34; Because he answered in such a nonchalant manner, I asked if this was the manager in which he said &#34;yeah&#34;. I explained the time I had spent trying to place my order and time wasted on the phone, in which he replied, &#34;sorry about that&#34; He also said that location has bad phone lines and many times never rings, They have been trying to have it repaired for over 2 months but no one can figure out the problem. Again said &#34;sorry&#34; so I chalked it up to just bad management. My time is worth more than wasting it on trying to patronize a restaurant that obviously is satisfied with the max -50% capacity that they are permitted to serve dining in and shining off the pickup and delivery.<br>Just one word to say to the Cheesecake Factory Corporation....&#34;Sorry!&#34;
The Cheesecake Factory always provides a very tasty dinner whenever I go... this time is no exception. And of course, it&#39;s always great to finish off of the nice piece of cheesecake.

I did not want to leave a bad review before speaking with a manager; however, I&#39;ve called 8 times in the last 3 hours and the line has remained busy. I ordered takeout for Father&#39;s Day (my dad chose cheesecake factory) we&#39;ve always been very happy with the quality of food at this location. Today was the complete opposite. <br><br>My husband and I got to the takeout parking when they said our order would be ready at 4:08. After waiting 20 minutes still without receiving a text that our order was ready we waved down an employee to ask where our order was. He checked on it and said they had everything ready but we&#39;re waiting on the two flatbread pizzas. After almost another 30 minutes we received the text that our order was ready and it would be out. We waited another 25 minutes for our order to be brought out. That was OVER an hour with our car running in 108 degree weather.<br><br>I would of ignored the wait time if our food would have been excellent but this was far from the case. <br><br>My Carbonara pasta was cold and laying in a bed of oil. I could not eat without my hands getting covered in it, and had to keep walking to the sink to drain my bowl.<br><br>My moms chicken Romano pasta was cold as well. It had a tiny little piece of chicken (not like other times she&#39;s ordered with two good sized pieces). That piece was grizzly meat and she literally had to run to the trash can and spit it out. The crust on it was complete mush, and not crispy whatsoever. <br><br>Then on both flatbreads every pepperoni was charred black. I&#39;ve never in my life seen a pizza like that. I also don&#39;t appreciate my dad and husband eating cancer causing carcinogens. <br><br>Also ...There was something in my fathers salad that was unidentifiable... happy Father&#39;s Day to him. Lol<br><br>Sadly, your quality insurance person missed the mark today. It was a disappointing Father&#39;s Day dinner.

Generally I am a fan of The Cheesecake Factory, but clearly the bar has been lowered. Trying to pickup my online order today was a nightmare. I paid online and my food was ready to be picked up. Upon walking in the door the hostess immediately tells me to stand outside, doesn&#39;t ask my name or give any further instructions. Meanwhile other customers are walking in, I give it a few minutes then she tells me I need to get in line inside to pay. I paid online.... still no direction from the hostess on how I can get my order. I have to ask her if she needs my name, then I give it to her and continue to wait outside. More time goes by and other customers are getting their orders so I walk up to the hostess now for the third time, she completely forgot my name and I guess didn&#39;t bother to check in or just ask me. It took her 30 seconds to finally just bring me my bag that was sitting there ready for pick up before I had even arrived. At this point my cold food is warm and my hot food is cold. Overall a very difficult experience and not worth the money. Just look at my &#34;side of fruit&#34;. Would have been treated better at McDonalds.

Cheesecake Factory is always one of my go to&#39;s. I&#39;ve been there more times than I can count . The menu is huge and I have yet to try something that I am not a fan . The food is pricing is average , the staff is good , the restaurant is huge so the wait time is good , and the food is always great . Some of my favorites include :<br><br>For Starters:<br>Avocado egg rolls <br>Buffalo chicken blasts<br>Calamari <br><br>Entrees:<br>Steak Diane<br>Chipotle chicken pasta<br>Crab cake bites with a house salad <br>Jambalaya pasta<br><br>If you are looking for a great place that has something for everyone , this is your best bet .

Just your typical Cheesecake Factory. For some reason, this one is ALWAYS busy, especially during dinner. There&#39;s always a line out the door, which is crazy to me because there are so many better places to eat in Irvine. Don&#39;t get me wrong, I love Cheesecake Factory, but I&#39;m not willing to wait more than 5-10 minutes for a table.<br><br>Service is consistent, food is consistent, although sometimes the food comes out cold. There&#39;s not much more to say about these chain restaurants. They&#39;re pretty mediocre and you know what to expect. <br><br>The Oreo Cheesecake keeps me coming back though. 1,600 calories of deliciousness.

Have tried calling several times to order curbside pick up and no one answers the phone.  In fact I&#39;ve actually heard them pick up the phone then hang it right up.  I&#39;m not about to go in considering the current COVID spike, so I guess this chain won&#39;t get our business.

Placed my order online around 2-3 pm for a 5:45 pm pick up. Was on my way from across town when I get an email at 5:15 saying my order wasn&#39;t placed. I&#39;m pissed. I call 50times with no answer. I place my order all over again online and go to curbside pick up I&#39;m calling and calling and no answer. I&#39;m waiting in the pick up spot<br>And no one comes out! There are other cars everyone calling and waiting no answer. Finally after the longest time I just go in. There is a crowd of people at the entrance huge groups of people all blocking the entry way. It&#39;s COVID people! I have to yell excuse me just to get through and in. The hostess is not telling people where to stand or social distance or mitigate this huge crowd. I go in the pick up line to get my order. Another woman cuts in front of me and the cashier allows it. I finally get my order and there are no utensils no napkins again! I try to leave and the huge crowd is blocking the exit still! Terrible operation here. Phone lines down no one comes to check curbside people waiting. And no one is directing people<br>Where to wait or stand that isn&#39;t a corona virus germ threat! Avoid this location very poorly run!<br><br>Update: contacted them as per below and nothing no response or reply.

Rarely write reviews but this experience compelled me me to share this experience.. <br><br>We go for the variety of food they offer, something for every craving!<br><br>However, STAFF needs a serious attitude check and maybe a retraining on customer service.  <br><br>The Hostess on the phone: Dined tonight (10/30) to celebrate my nephew&#39;s promotion - this was his requested restaurant.  Made a reservation on yelp which was easy and convenient. After completing the reservation online we realized the promotion event was running longer so we needed to adjust the reservation time. Called the restaurant as the yelp app reservation told us to do so. Upon calling, we were told we needed to adjust the reservation on yelp instead.  After explaining Yelp instructed us to call the restaurant instead, hostess&#39;s tone changes to a condescending attitude.  Like she is the gate keeper of the restaurant (which I guess is kinda the case... which gives the restaurant a cold and unwelcoming vibe) how about an easy &#34;Let me help you with that reservation :) so glad you decided to dine with us! Thanks for letting us know you&#39;re running late and need to change times&#34; it&#39;s true when they say you can &#34;hear&#34; a smile through the phone - basics of customer service. <br><br>The icing on the &#34;cheesecake&#34; - the cashier at the to-go/cheesecake case area: Just wow! After we wrapped up dinner, decided last minute to get something to-go for my mom.  As I was looking at the selection in the glass case, my husband goes first to place his and literally hears the cashier (no name tag so I don&#39;t have name, but I do know she has long green pointed nails - I&#39;ll tell you why I know in a minute) say with attitude &#34;I guess I&#39;m not closed yet&#34;.  She was standing there for a minute but didn&#39;t bother asking my husband who was patiently waiting directly in front of the register if he needed help.  So he prompts the interaction instead with a &#34;hello, can I please place an order&#34;.  It felt like we were there bothering her and holding her back from clocking out, like how dare we as customers to need something from her!  If she had just said nicely that she was closed, we wouldn&#39;t have had a problem not placing an order.  The loudly taps on her register to punch in the order and gives my husband a check even before I finished placing my order.  I said nicely that I still wanted to add another on and oh lord, all hell breaks lose! Like we just ruined her night... she exasperatedly and irritatedly rubs her forehead, like a &#34;dear lawd, a customer I have to help&#34; moment... and so I ask her if there was any problem with the additional order... (see this is how I noticed the green pointed nails) I guess she realized that her rude and impatient attitude was getting checked, she simply answered her forehead itches... Maybe she&#39;s allergic from providing basic customer assistance. Just saying.

We ordered a $200 dinner, and they forgot our  appetizer, as well as put meat in my salad (I&#39;m a vegetarian) with spilled soup and cold food. I don&#39;t complain at all but they had promised to replace the order but decided to change their minds the next day, terrible service. So rude I use to love this place but definitely won&#39;t be coming back ;(

I feel weird writing a review about a chain restaurant. We come here after the gym once and a while and they are open until 11. Parking at that time is simple but it&#39;s a nightmare from 4-8 pm. They do offer an underground parking garage for the business complex if you don&#39;t mind a small walk. <br><br>The service is always friendly and the wait time is never awful. You can call ahead and put your name down as well. They also have a happy hour from 4-6pm. <br><br>The menu is big... like huge. They have chicken every and all ways. I don&#39;t eat chicken but my boyfriends favorite is the chicken parm. He also likes the blackened salmon... my go to is the vegan Cobb with the dressing on the side... it&#39;s probably the best salad you will ever eat in your life. When the artichoke is in season... we get that as well. Everything is reasonably priced and they offer a kids menu. There are numerous restaurants throughout the valley so give one a shot and get the vegan Cobb!! It&#39;s the perfect summer salad;)

This was absolutely the worst nightmare ever! We ordered $200 in food and I called the manager to explain to her that one of the appetizers was missing, my daughter is a vegetarian and they put bacon all over her salad and she actually took a bite of it and was sick for days! All of the food was cold, the French onion soup what&#39;s spilt all over the bag the blue cheese dressing was all over the cheesecake in the container and it actually opened so I mean if like blue cheese in your cheesecake I guess it&#39;s great! Called the manager she stated she would only replace the appetizer that was missing! Do not waste your money go to Maggiano&#39;s down the street that&#39;s our new go to place twice a a week! If I could give the Cheesecake Factory on Fort Apache no stars I would have!

I went to Cheesecake factory yesterday to celebrate my friend B-day...we had blast!!!...best cucumber Martini!!!...the waitress brought cheesecake for my friend with candle and sang Happy B-day song with us.

Very disappointed with their service.  I made reservations for two tables. They even got our name and phone number down.  But when it&#39;s times to go, they said they don&#39;t have; even after I confirmed with them.  Not going their anymore.
Regardless of what I write u need to taste this amazing food for yourselfThe food is delicious but their cheesecakes are even betterMy go-to is the Hazelnut crunch cheesecake w/NutellaGO GET SOME!!

Fiancée and I felt received nothing but stares as we walked in and waited in the lobby for our take-out order. Despite most--if not all--staff members glancing our way, none of them opted to greet or assist us. My fiancée and I were proudly wearing our MAGA hats. We both work in the food industry and never have given thought of providing the same treatment that we received to those who freely support their select politician with print shirts, hats, (now) masks, etc.<br><br>Very disappointed.

This place is amazing. The food is very delicious. The menu is very broad and offers many dishes for those with different taste. They have indoor and outdoor seat accommodations. I enjoyed the main course, dessert, and the drinks they offer. I would definitely recommend trying this place out if you haven&#39;t gone yet.

The server was great. The covid separation was perfect. The food took a while to come out of the kitchen. And the food internal temp was barely warm. Cost was on the high end side for a hamburger an a cocktail.<br>5 people in the party an 4 said food would have been really good if it was hot.

Another awesome dinner at our favorite Cheesecake Factory in Summerlin!!<br><br>But tonight, was extra special because... JIMMY, our server was super nice, attentive, friendly, hospitable and gave us an outstanding experience!!<br><br>We highly commend Jimmy!!!!

Placed a large takeout order and asked for no BBQ sauce on the pork belly sliders. Got home and found a spicy sauce (BBQ?) on the sliders. Not a fan of spicy foods so I threw them away.<br><br>After holding on the phone for over ten minutes, a manager explained that they put a chipotle sauce on the sliders. It&#39;s not listed in the ingredients on the website so why would it be on there? Never again...now I have to wait  5-7 business days for my  $12 credit.

Our Togo order didn&#39;t take too long considering they were very busy and it was Saturday night. The order was correct and everything was yummy, apart from the stuffed mushroom appetizer we had, it was a essentially a tiny bowl of a couple mushrooms and oil, for $9 that&#39;s a bit disappointing

Don&#39;t go to the summerlin location. They are so disorganized on how to pickup orders. Even though you place online you still have to wait in line for 30 minutes before you can get in the door then once inside you have to wait again to order, then pay, then wait again!! How crazy is that!! Mansgers get some direction and training on how to process food order lines...bad service!!!

Mikayla was my waitress. She is absolutely amazing and I thank you so much her excellent service. I usually take a bite of my food and done. I don&#39;t stay very long. She is exceptional waitress. The front desk was a little unpleasant but it&#39;s all good. As long as the service is good who cares about the desk. Thank you so much for Mikayla.
Excellent as always! Always enjoy the food here and the reasonable price for the huge portions! Loved the French salad- so refreshing! Lasagna Verde is also a classic favorite!

What a disgusting experience !!!! I decided to take my 13 year old Grandson and his friend for Sunday Brunch yesterday. First mistake. We spent the night before going over the menu and deciding what we wanted. On Sunday after a 30-minute drive we arrived and were promptly seated. Our waitress also was prompt in coming to the table for drinks and both boys ordered chocolate milk which she delivered without straws. With the Covid crisis they are a must-have. So we waited and waited for ANYONE to come by and I finally had to walk across the entire restaurant to the bar to get two straws and upon returning she was still nowhere to be seen. She finally reappeared to take our order and we were all excited to order chicken and waffles. She then stated they were out. So they were out of what we had driven 30 minutes for. We could have had bacon eggs and pancakes 5 minutes from the house !! Extremely disappointed the boys ordered just that with my Grandson ordering his eggs poached. They arrived in a puddle of water soft boiled not poached. We notified the waitress who now had more customers then she could handle and the second order came the exact same way. The kitchen needs to order some slotted spoons and teach the cook how to make eggs. I ordered the breakfast tacos that were supposed to be on a corn tortilla filled with chorizo eggs and cheese. When I attempted to pick one up it was total mush but I went ahead and took a bite and it was SO disgusting I literally spit it into the napkin. There was no soft taco no chorizo and the egg mixture was so disgusting I had an upset stomach for a couple of hours after leaving. While all of this was going on the table across from us also ordered chicken and waffles and of course were told the same thing we were. They then ordered sausage and eggs and were told they were out of sausage.<br>If the food was free I would never and will never step foot in that horrid place again. They are in desperate need of new management and a new kitchen staff !!

I recommend avoiding this location if at all possible. My wife ordered food, paid for it and I went to pick it up. I parked, called the number and the lady said my food wasn&#39;t ready and they would text me. I kept waiting and finally went in. I was given the runaround more until they found my food. It was an hour after the order was placed. Cecil, a manager, spoke to me and lied saying he was the general manager. Jason it the GM and was not helpful when I spoke to him on the phone. My time and money was wasted. I didn&#39;t have time for them to cook the food over and they still have my money. Terrible management.

$70 later and all I can say is ugh the food was unpleasant (me being polite). Thought I would give them another try after having horrible service in St Louis thought maybe Rampart would be better, unfortunately it&#39;s not. I got the steak and corn something really. Rice was crunchy had zero flavor. Steak was meh peppers over done and onions carmalized to a black state and the corn..... my first nite had me thinking I had gotten a mouth for of hair.... fortunately it was corn hair unfortunately it was corn hair.... so nasty. Rest of the family declined to comment but the displeased faces said it all.

Overall, a horrible experience. <br>Not recommend to come here if you&#39;re vegan. <br>It is located in such a nice area, but with terrible service.<br><br>Also when arriving they didn&#39;t inform us where to sit with the Covid regulations. Very disorganized! <br><br>And the hair on the plate was just the cherry on top. Poor hospitality service!<br><br>DETAILS: <br><br>I was in a party of 9 people on 08/18/20 for the 6 p.m. reservation.<br><br>We ordered the impossible burger, which came in with a piece of hair, the fried pita and hummus, and the vegan salad. <br><br>The server with short hair and pregnant, came and took the plate. A bald guy, who claimed to be the manager walked in I informed him the server took the plate and he also walked away without saying a word. Nor did he bothered to come back! <br><br>The next morning 08/19/20 at noon I called to inform them I woke up feeling sick with vomiting, and the manager on the phone told me that corporate from California will call me to verify if what I&#39;m saying is true. <br><br>AGAIN... Overall, a horrible experience. <br>Not recommend to come here if you&#39;re vegan. <br>It is located in such a nice area, but with terrible service. <br><br>Also when arriving they didn&#39;t inform us where to sit with the Covid regulations. Very disorganized! The manager never came back about the hair, poor hospitality service. I don&#39;t blame the server. She apologized and was also pregnant trying to serve a big party of nine people. The no show of a manager presence made it bad on this restaurant.

Called today to ask Manager to refund bacon as they forgot to put it in my cheeseburger, it&#39;s an add on.<br><br> Also asked refund for chicken taquitos as it was burnt, not sure why you would allow it to leave the kitchen burnt, I had to trash it.  Manager refused since I called today and my order was for yesterday. She offered an order of taquitos which I wasn&#39;t about to drive there just for that but no offer to refund the bacon. Makes no sense. Won&#39;t go there again. So many other restaurants to support during these hard times.
I am updating my rating to 3 stars as they have made strides to improve. I will continue to order from them and update rating further as warranted

As soon as I walked in I stood in front of the host counter, 3 hosts look at me and don&#39;t say anything then continue to talk to eachother and walk away. It would&#39;ve been way better if they simply just said, &#34;We will be with you in a minute.&#34; but no, they just locked eyes with me and talked amongst themselves then walked off. I stood in front of them confused and disrespected, then they finally acknowledged me after almost 5 minutes. <br><br>When we were finally seated it took almost 15 minutes for our waiter to bring us water. While there were many other waiters and waitresses around us serving at their tables. Not only that but our waiter had a slightly condescending tone towards us as if we were inferior to him. <br><br>I had the pasta carbonara and it just was not good, the entire dish was very bland and was not worth $22.50. I would not recommend the pastas my girlfriend had the fettuccini alfredo and she said it wasn&#39;t very good either. My bill came out to $70 and the only thing I really felt was worth it was the cheesecake. The overall experience just was not worth it. <br><br>The ultimate red velvet cake cheesecake was immaculate though.

Let&#39;s do this! My family and I are Regulars at &#34;the factory&#34; but this time I used Yelp reservations instead of walking up. The experience was easy. <br><br>Once my husband and I arrived I waited at the host stand while a young lady answered a few questions a guy had. Once she was done she looked at me and had such a Friendly hello. She caught me off guard because she called me by name and said our table was ready. Hmmm, awesome because I was really early for our reservations just Incase it was really busy. She was so nice with my confusion but we were seated right away. <br><br>Once we sat our server came by right away with our napkin setup and fresh plates. We ordered strawberry lemonade, It&#39;s always delicious. We have our favorite items that we can&#39;t go without. Appetizers: Buffalo Blasts, fried chicken sliders and small Caesar salad that we split. <br><br>While we ate and talked we decided my husband would stray from his usual Pasta Carbonara with shrimp and chicken. He finally decided on Pasta Napoletana. He had no expectations and didn&#39;t think twice about what he was having. I was ready for my Asian Chicken lettuce wrap tacos, Yum. I love the freshness of all the ingredients from the crunchy carrots, grilled chicken, bean sprouts, brined cucumbers, rice noodles and crisp butter lettuce wraps. They offer a spicy cashew sauce but I don&#39;t think I&#39;ve ever needed it. <br>My husband was raving over his Pasta pick. Oh man, he was so impressed with the flavors and I even tried it. It was wonderful! Italian sausage, pepperoni, homemade meatballs, mushrooms, bell peppers, bacon and onions over a bed of Parmesan pasta that was cooked PERFECT! He was so happy he was full and had lunch for the next day. <br><br>We finished up with four pieces of cheesecake Togo because we had movie night on the couch waiting. I grabbed two flavors we&#39;ve never tried and two of our favorites as a back up just Incase we didn&#39;t enjoy the others. That ultimately was the most well thought out plan ever because when we arrived home our daughter tried the pasta and loved it! ( she always gets what dad has) but we didn&#39;t tell her we liked it lol.  Then we had a bite of the new cheesecakes. Celebration cheesecake (not a fan at all) and mango key lime (nope). We wrapped those back up and left them for the boys for after lunch the next day. They loved them lol. We sat down on the couch for movie night with our Lemon Raspberry cheesecake and my husband&#39;s favorite fresh strawberry cheesecake with extra strawberries. Never have we been disappointed with these two flavors! <br><br>All in all another great experience, thank y&#39;all! I&#39;m gonna use the yelp reservation portion more often.

Food is always consistent and good. Kathy was our server whom we&#39;ve had before and was great once again. She was timely with check backs and with refills. We appreciate her sincere service to make our night enjoyable. <br><br>That said when we checked in to host stand they two hostesses were leaning on counter and did not engage us with a greet. Instead they waited for my wife to say hi and tell them how many in our party. These girls are your first impression and should learn to smile and be warm to guests when they come to the podium. She didn&#39;t even attempt to engage us in a conversation and when we sat down just threw the menus down and said &#34;enjoy&#34;. <br><br>She wore black pants and shirt, black hair and this was Thursday March 12th and we arrived at 430p. Even throughout the night she just looked unhappy to be here and the perception was she had a bad attitude. <br><br>We enjoy coming here but must say the weakest link is the Host Stand. Better training needed.
I Ordered takeout rice was very hard not happy. But what do you expect with all this covid shit going around.<br>Hopefully this location haven&#39;t lost Their touch. Please get it together thanks.

There&#39;s something about Cheesecake Factory you find a sense a comfort from. Maybe it&#39;s because you almost always know what you want when you go in or having plenty of options in their 40 some-odd-page menu. May not be the best of the best but still makes your tummy happy. Rib-eye I order was good. Decent amount of flavor and can&#39;t go wrong with mashed potatoes. The other dish is the New York steak...that I didn&#39;t order. Had one bite before it clicked in my mind, but still was tasty. Feel like the customer service for the mistake should have been better, since we had to eat our meals individually because of the way it came out. However they weren&#39;t rude about it and mistakes happen.

Made a reservation, checked in. And waited for a few minutes upon arriving (which is totally fine, given there was a few people waiting outside as well). Now about the food, we ordered the Tex Mex egg rolls for appetizer -- which is amazinnnggg! You have to try it! Then my husband ordered their Steak Diane, and I ordered the Louisiana Chicken pasta. They&#39;re both good, but in my opinion, I like the Steak Diane more! We also tried their Ultimate Red Velvet Cheesecake, and that is soooo DELISH! Overall, our experience is great! Will definitely come back!Staff and servers are friendly and helpful.

I ordered a whole 10 inches oreo cheesecake online for a family birthday, frozen to eat the next day. The order was curbside so everything could be done contactless. I paid for the Happy Birthday plaque advertised in the website. When I arrived they told me they run out of the plaque and only have the congratulations plaque. I agreed to get that one as I didnt want to get in to get a refund. When we opened the box at home, the surprise was that they had given us a cheesecake already cut with paper on it. We ordered it for a birthday and we got a cheesecake that wont work for it? We had to remove the parchment paper from between the pieces and make it work. What is the point of ordering online in advance if you are just going to get what they have on hand without even making sure you are giving the customer what they ask. Very unfortunate and bad experience!

It was my birthday so my sister and her family brought me here. The place is nice and clean..and have good ambiance. We sat outside on a beautifull afternoon/evening..i had the &#34;Thai chicken wrap&#34;. I loved it..and the peanut caramel snicker cheese cake was really good. The staffs sang happy birthday too. It was a really good experience.

Our server was so attentive! She made the visit so pleasant with her seamless service and was quick to assist. I had the miso salmon and it was so delicious! The salmon was sooo good, no dry flakes, no fishy taste- only moist deliciousness! <br><br>I&#39;m very health conscious so nutritional values are very important to me. It&#39;s important to note that much of the Cheesecake Factory menu is high in calories, so it&#39;s important to pay attention to the calories in the dishes if you are currently watching your weight! It&#39;s nice that each menu option has the calories posted beside each choice.

had a pleasant experience lunch dining at cheesecake factory. the salad is delightful and so is their chocolate hazelnut crunch cheesecake! called for 12 noon reservation and was given one the same day. it did get busy with a line forming when we left.

When I&#39;m hungry and don&#39;t have room to experiment on new food around town, my favorite go to place is Cheesecake Factory. Whether I&#39;m in Las Vegas, Los Angeles, Sacramento and Chicago, if I want my shrimp with pasta plate, Cheesecake Factory never disappoint. With their enormous menu, they offer all kinds of taste from Mexican to Italian, to Thai and back to American. Service is always great and food is freshly cooked each time. The honey oat wheat bread and butter is always a great start while waiting on the main dish. And if, only if, you still have room for dessert, a variety of super delicious cheesecake are always waiting for you to try on. This place always delivers. There&#39;s another spot by the strip but to me, every location serves their customers with standards. I&#39;m so glad that Cheesecake Factory exist. It&#39;s a place that I would trust when hungry.

I did Order online for birthday cake for my wife&#39;s birthday, when I pick up at rampart location, the cake it&#39;s not what I order, I spoked to manager on duty, her answer is I don&#39;t know. I told her I don&#39;t know is not an option, please find out why my order is totally different. I wait for 30 minutes to get answer, but still now answer. Also when I pick up order the staff didn&#39;t show me my cake looks like until I asked her to do it. They didn&#39;t take care of customer&#39;s complain, and made I have bad date for my wife&#39;s birthday, we have to delay our dinner 30mins with 10 pp because of this cake order. VERY BAD.<br>Per manager, she said some one will contact my email for follow up regarding my order, until now, no one contact me, only yelp has one BS reply form Cheesecake Factory.

I had brunch here with a friend a few weeks ago and really enjoyed myself and the service was good too! It was so nice to be out. Speaking of out, we sat on the patio because that&#39;s where we were most comfortable. It was hot as crap, even with being in the shade. I had about 6 ice waters, but we made it. We asked for the misters to be turned on, but their misters were that of a light rain, so we asked to turn them off. Food was great. I ordered the chicken and waffles and sweet potato fries as an appetizer. Both were too much and I took a lot of it to go for later. I noticed outside and inside every other table was available to create distancing and the menus had been cleaned before being given to guests. Every time I went inside to use the bathroom I put my mask on. Good experience, I&#39;ll be back! =)

My favorite meal at the Cheesecake Factory is the PAN SEARED BRANZINO WITH LEMON BUTTER 880 cal 21.95 A Mild, Delicate Sauteed White Fish Served with Fresh Vegetables and Lemon Sauce. I have ordered the same thing every time I&#39;ve dined here over the last 5 months, because I have been on a fairly strict weight loss program. I&#39;m sure that the most people who are on a diet absolutely avoid this restaurant because they think that there&#39;s no way they can make a healthy choice &amp; be satisfied. I, however, am proof positive that it&#39;s absolutely incorrect! I love this healthy meal. It is a bit more calories than I normally eat in my meal, but it is a splurge to go out &amp; eat. It is so yummy!!! I choose to skip the brown bread that I used to enjoy so much &amp; realized I can also do without the dessert. Just because the word cheesecake is in the title, does not mean that you have to eat it! I have lost over 30 pounds &amp; have eaten here at least once per month since July. Just a FYI
We had a great family dinner , they took social distancing serious and we can appreciate that. Staff was very friendly and food was amazing !!! We will be back for my birthday

We had a great experience!! We had some crab balls before the kids showed up and they were so delicate and good. That brown bread is to die for!! What is it...the Thai lettuce wraps come in such a mice presentation, and are really good. I had a skinnilicious chicken Caesars and it was so light. Less oil in the dressing I&#39;m told. The mac and cheese balls and pasta carbonara were also delish the kids said. The service was great, this was definitely a really good lunch.

The Cheesecake Factory just reminds me of the typical chain restaurant, but a little more pricey in my opinion and for whatever reason, they are ALWAYS busy! I had dinner with a bunch of friends on a Monday night and luckily my friend went early. He was there at 6:30 (possibly earlier) with a 45 minute wait. We didn&#39;t get seated until almost 8...on a Monday. <br><br>I had the fried calamari and spicy cajun jambalaya pasta (penne) with chicken, shrimp, tomatoes, bell peppers and onions. Upon getting my dish, the plate for starters, is unnecessarily big given the portion that they offer. While they definitely don&#39;t skimp on the chicken, I had to do some pasta pushing to find the shrimp and I only found about 3 pieces of shrimp. Keep in mind, this pasta dish is not going to contain a lot of &#34;sauce&#34;, like a regular jambalaya. In fact, it&#39;s as if the dish is only seasoned with Cajun seasoning, rather than an actual jambalaya recipe. That said, I did have to add some salt because there was a lack in flavor.  The calamari was also nothing noteworthy - although crisp to perfection, it was a bit over battered. Would this be my go-to restaurant? Not at all.
Always excellent service. <br>Great lunch specials. <br>Our server, Brandon, is AMAZING. So attentive and kind.

My son and i thoroughly enjoyed the Cheesecake Factory and our impeccable service from Narz our waiter. The salted caramel Cheesecake was delicious and my son was beside himself with every bite. Narz made us feel at ease and not rushed at all. Thank you Sir for a great dining experience...

2018 Yelp 100 Challenge - #97<br><br>I love the Cheesecake Factory and their amazing atmosphere. Shortly after being greeted by our server we were given yummy bread. The portions are huge so I recommend not filling up on their delicious bread. <br><br>Food<br>Everything on the menu is simply delicious. Everything that I have tried has been yum and there is plenty of food for leftovers. My favorite has to be the chicken taquitos as an appetizer, parmesan crusted chicken with mash potatoes and steamed spinach as an entree, and yummy cheesecake for dessert. They have a huge selection for any craving from burgers, pasta, steak, and fish.<br><br>Dessert<br>Of course they are famous for their delicious cheesecakes but they offer more than just cheesecake. If your are interested in their cheesecakes my husband love their Resse&#39;s Peanut Butter Cheesecake, and I love their red velvet cheesecake. The also offer a birthday cheesecake that I have yet to try, but have heard great things about it.

Although I had been here once before just to purchase holiday gift cards, on my first foray to this Cheesecake Factory for a late dinner on Veterans Day I was pleased with what I encountered.  <br><br>We didn&#39;t plan to go here at all.  Instead, while headed to its more elevated cousin, The Grand Lux Cafe at The Palazzo, we were diverted by traffic cones and police cars from entering or crossing the Las Vegas Strip.  Then we saw why, as several tagged runners passed us by.  We unwittingly wound up in the midst of the Rock &#39;n&#39; Roll Marathon!  After looping onto Sammy Davis Jr. Drive and finally emerging from &#34;the dungeon&#34; to reach Flamingo Road, we buzzed across town to Rampart, reaching this comfort food emporium at 9:55 p.m.  Luckily it was open to 11:00 p.m.<br><br>While Diane struggled to finish an app of tennis-ball-sized Mac &amp; Cheese Bites perched on a bed of Alfredo Sauce, I was presented with a gargantuan tray of Thai Chicken Lettuce Wraps that could easily accommodate four diners.  But, alas, there was only me to play with the thick strips of peanut-crusted chicken, ultra-fresh and cool thinly sliced cucumbers, carrots, delicate noodles, lettuce leaves, and trio of sauces: brown and smooth Peanut Sauce, orange and spicy Chili Oil, and green Cilantro Sauce.  Somehow I polished off everything but one large leaf of lettuce.<br><br>I also got to sample Chicken Artichoke Soup, the soup of the day, at the urging of our very thoughtful server, Katrina C., who also brought extra napkins to the table and Iced Tea refills on her own initiative.  The soup was creamy and delicious, punctuated by large Button Mushrooms.  But I wisely chose not to order a cup or bowl of it.  For, a Hibachi Steak entree seemed quite enough to round out the meal.  <br><br>The steak was thinly sliced, seared with a Hibachi Sauce that was a cross between Teriyaki Sauce and Soy Sauce, and quite tasty, except cooked more medium than medium rare as ordered.  Ample quantities of Mashed Potatoes and asparagus spears filled out the plate.  Although the menu called for Mashed Potatoes and succotash, I was actually pleased to be presented with asparagus instead of succotash.   <br><br>Diane liked her Penne Shrimp Alfredo but took half of it home to go along with half of her Mac &amp; Cheese Bites.  We both rolled out of the restaurant, fully stuffed, at around 11:15 p.m., the last customers to leave the premises.

Normally I&#39;d say this place great but the service tonight was HORRIBLE!  NO PLACE FOR A HANDICAPPED PERSON TO SIT WHILE WAITING FOR A TOGO ORDER. When I asked about a seat I was told &#34;We&#39;ll open those when the governor says its ok.  Really?  No HANDICAPPED seats?  &#34;Well I don&#39;t make the rules&#34; I was told

National Cheesecake Day at The Cheesecake Factory should be a nightmare right? Well one would think so because ordinarily it&#39;s pretty hectic on every other day of the year. But this year, a server named Jessica C was an Angel in disguise.<br>Knowing that they opened at 11 and cheesecake slices were 50% off today, we decided to meet up for an early lunch at 11:30. Surprisingly, we were seated immediately and warmly greeted by Jessica.  She brought out our water, Diet Coke, and raspberry lemonade promptly as well as their amazingly fresh bread.<br>My husband decided to order the Skinnylicious burger with a side salad. My son ordered the cheese flatbread off of the kid&#39;s menu. I always try something new and so I went with the lunch portion of Evelyn&#39;s Favorite Pasta.<br>Normally when we come to Cheesecake Factory, we wait so long that we fill up on drinks and bread. That&#39;s not always the server&#39;s fault, but oftentimes we get neglected and are sitting with watered down drinks or empty bread baskets for a while. Not today. Jessica was right there to top us off and refreshed our drinks.<br>When our food came out, I was pleasantly surprised. My son&#39;s flatbread pizza was ginormous! How is that possibly a kid&#39;s meal? What a deal! The flatbread was soft, fresh, and very tasty. My son kind of filled up on his bread and lemonade though and didn&#39;t eat much (also saving room for cheesecake of course).<br>My husband was very happy with his skinny version of a burger. The side salad was basically greens with a vinaigrette dressing (which he saved for me to take home since he was making room for bread and cheesecake). It was cooked medium just as asked and presented without any of the extras, just as he likes. One of his pet peeve&#39;s is asking for his burgers plain and they still decide to top everything on it. Not today!<br>I was surprised with the size of the LUNCH portion of Evelyn&#39;s Favorite Pasta. LUNCH!!!  I think it was $5-$6 cheaper than the full dinner sized. How much bigger could this have gotten? The penne pasta was perfectly cooked. It was drizzled with olive oil and the mixture of broccoli, roasted eggplant, roasted peppers, sun dried tomatoes, and artichoke hearts was a cacophony in my mouth. I was definitely content with this blend of flavors. I actually ate as much as I could (and took about 1/2 home).<br>Last but not least, you have to save room for the cheesecake which was the main reason we came here today. At 50% off per slice, how can you resist? Technically you had to dine-in in order to get the deal. We had a full meal and so we hoped we could take it to go. My husband decided on chocolate mousse, my son chose Hershey Chocolate Bar, and I tried the chocolate chip cookie dough cheesecake.<br>While we waited, Jessica happily refilled our drinks again and brought us take home containers and bags. When she brought out the cheesecakes, we noticed they were plated and not in containers. She said the cheesecake station were told not to put them directly in containers but that she would get us some. Of course we still ate a few bites before transferring them into their containers, but the fact that she didn&#39;t just tell us tough luck, was a miracle in itself.<br>This was the best experience I have ever had at Cheesecake Factory both in Las Vegas and in southern California. Jessica C, we truly hope you get the tip we happily left you for your amazing service. Until next year...or at least until the next cheesecake promotion!

Really really bad service.<br><br>Been sitting almost fifteen minutes and the server hasn&#39;t even come by to ask if we want water.<br><br>Finally, she came by, after serving the two tables next to us, who just sat down and have been there all of 60 seconds.<br><br>Funny thing is, she looked right at us, then the other tables and went to them.<br><br>Guess she is banking on a bigger tip from them then us, which is probably accurate cause not sure I&#39;m leaving one now.  You serve whose here first, not whatever table you think you&#39;re going to profit from more!

We love Cheesecake Factory. Great food and with the large amounts of choices, I don&#39;t think Ive had the same thing twice. Their portions are so big, that I never have room for cheesecake. Good thing that it&#39;s a nice take home treat.

My review is strictly for the awesome customer service I received 25 minutes ago from Justin! I placed an order online for pick up via door dash and when I got to the restaurant, I called to ask do I come in and get my order or will it come out to me? The woman on the phone told me to come in. I was unaware of where exactly to go and I stopped Justin. Even though we are all wearing masks, you could tell he was smiling under there when I stopped him right after helping another customer. He told me for door dash orders you had to follow the sidewalk around to the north side of the building and wait my turn to tell the pick up people who my order was for. I told him it was for me lol he said oh! Well let me go get it for you! He went and got it for me as well as making sure we had the drink for my daughters meal and a straw. It might seem small but his kindness and willingness to instead of saying &#34;oh ok, even if the order is for you, still go to the north side.&#34; He also explained that I could use their app next time for easier pick up options. <br><br>Again, thank you so much Justin! You truly never know what a simple act of kindness can do for a person. I had a terrible day and treating myself and my daughter to Cheesecake Factory was the first step to cheering us up and Justin was just awesome. <br><br>Oh yeah, the food was great too!! Lol

James was our server tonight, and he made everything more than a 5 star. He got our drink orders as soon as we sat down. Came back with our drinks, bread and butter.<br>When I mentioned I was allergic to lemon and lime, he went into the kitchen to double check and make sure that all the food being served didn&#39;t have any lemon or lime in it. Shortly after, the food was served.<br>He came around frequently and checked on us.<br><br>I love that the food maintained its quality and flavor, each time we come here.<br>The portions are generous and full of flavor. We never have complaints.<br><br>I really like their Tropical Iced Tea. It has a nice splash of refreshing fruit flavor, perfect for the summer.
Tanna was really nice and had great customer service. Food is always great I eat here all the time.
Great atmosphere. Been here twice within 2 months, not only the cheesecake but the food is delicious too! Try the avocado rolls and buffalo bites

Ordered food on a Wednesday.<br>Wednesday night family gets sick.<br><br>Thursday at 1pm call to speak to manager about my experience, who offered little care took my info and said it would be reported to Risk Management...but there was nothing that can be done at his level.<br>I asked for the phone number to call myself after being told RISK MANAGEMENT IS CLOSED UNTIL MONDAY at 8am.  <br>I when I called the  number no options given to further my info, no voicemail etThe line just rang and rang. <br><br>This makes no sense and I expected more care from this restaurant. <br>We will not be returning. <br><br>Edit: Received a call from another manager, very kind and was able to do more for my sick family. I appreciate it and changed my rating from 1 to 4. <br>The food was still tasty but getting sick is never great.
Server is awesome and friendly. Food is great and delicious. Chicken Bellagio is soooooo freakin&#39; delicious. So worth it.

It&#39;s a great place to spend time with friends and have a great meal.  They have such a varied menu that you can get whatever you want.  Pasta, burgers, Mexican, steak, chicken,seafood, salads, sandwiches, and a great bar and appetizers as well.  The deserts are of course spectacular.  I have tried many many things on the menu and only a couple haven&#39;t been very good.  It&#39;s also very consistent each time you go.  The only problem is that it&#39;s so good, there is often a long wait particularly on weekends.

Paid 36$ for two burgers just for the presentation of my protein style burger to be ridiculous, not to mention this old piece of lettuce. Definitely thought Cheesecake Factory had quality in terms of how they treated customers.

This is the 4th time at least that I&#39;ve received over cooked food from this location... it&#39;s like their management team is ok with sending out less than greatly prepared meals. This evening my 2 entrees, totally different we&#39;re both basically burnt and hard to eat or enjoy. I&#39;m tired of calling about the same issues. Stay away from this location!

I understand the issues revolving around Coronavirus, so, if you can&#39;t accommodate the order just inform me &amp; I&#39;ll pick something else. Instead, I got a remix/reduced version of dishes I usually select. Some of the ingredients are different, the sauce is not the same... taste gravy like. Disappointed in my whole order. The same for the Tex Mex egg rolls as well. <br><br>As of 4/24, Chesecake responded &amp; asked me to contact them via email and I never heard from them again... I guess it was to look good .

I really enjoy Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;ve been here a variety of times in the past, but recently came here with a friend Wednesday night to catch up.<br><br>The parking is spacious. It&#39;s a street over from Tivoli village in a complex next to REI and a few other restaurants/local businesses. <br><br>It can get really busy over the weekend. If you&#39;re looking to stop in for a bite to eat, I would highly recommend going during the week day either before 6:00 P.M or during the day.<br><br>My friend and I sat at the bar area. We were greeted by the waiter with a smile and offered drinks/drink menu. We passed and just ordered soda/water. We ordered a few different appetizers, the mozzarella sticks and the corn appetizer dish. I thought the corn appetizer dish was pretty spicy. The Mozzarella sticks tasted good, not too spicy, not over-done, and the marinara sauce on the side was delicious!<br><br>Unfortunately, we couldn&#39;t enjoy the appetizers too much as our main course came out 5 minutes after we had received our appetizers. My friend had ordered the chicken avocado club sandwich and I ordered my usual chicken pizza (which literally is chicken as the &#34;dough&#34; topped with cheese/sauce and a light pasta in the middle). Both of our meals were amazing and the portion size is large. My meal that I had in the evening was left overs for both lunch and dinner the next day.<br><br>We had ordered a desert. My friend ordered the normal &#34;classic&#34; cheesecake and I had the red velvet cheesecake. WOW! It was so sweet and perfect. The cheesecake was light and fluffy. I would order both again!<br><br>The reason why I am giving this a 4 stars out of 5 is I actually had a really bad stomach issue after all of the food. I was so sick the next day that I could barely function. I&#39;m not sure if the food was under-cooked or a ingredient was old, but I was really sick the next day.

I&#39;ve been here numerous times in the past, but recently, we did a takeout order for hubby&#39;s favorite cuban sandwich (it&#39;s big enough to share- the bread is always perfect, the pork is tasty, the pickles a nice compliment to the sandwich) and a slice of specialty cheesecake, but they don&#39;t have the everything one that hubby loved so much (so many different choices!). Convenient parking spots for pickup orders. Otherwise, the parking lot is pretty occupied.  <br><br>This is a very popular place (when we were waiting in the car, we spotted so many people coming and going). Funny story about this one. On our first date, we tried going to this one, but it was so jam-packed, so we went to the Caesar&#39;s Forum Shops location instead. This was in 2004. And that is what got the ball rolling. <br><br>Large menu- it&#39;s like sixteen to twenty pages long. The food is solid. It&#39;s yummy. I&#39;ve had lots of items here over the years. So has our son. We do love the complimentary bread starter. (When we used to live on the other side of town, we went to the newest location inside the outlet mall.) So, yes, we are very familiar with the food and restaurant. The service is very good. <br><br>A really good restaurant with great eats, great service, and so many choices of cheesecake (really lives up to its name).

Cheesecake Factory usually never disappoints...but my delivery order today for $82 was THE worst...I ordered Carbonara pasta with chicken...well I usually share my chicken with my little 7 pound chihuahua we each had 3 of the smallest bites, the poor little guy thought I was holding out and kept sitting up and begging for more...that was very sad...my husband had a factory burrito that was giant around 12 inches of packed flour tortilla of RICE...DURING this time of tight money I WILL be making better choices for my food delivery...I hope my cheesecake slice has a small redemption...although $82 is a lot to pay for a cheesecake fix.

Went with a party of 4 others on a Tuesday evening in early June 2020.  I had called Tuesday late afternoon to see if we could make a reservation and was told that reservations could only be made via Yelp so I got on Yelp right away and as of about 4:30 PM we could not make a reservation at all, however at one point it seemed like it started to make the reservation but then it somehow redirected to the yelp page for a café on the Las Vegas strip!   Very annoying and in my opinion very stupid that you have to make a reservation through Yelp.  However the cheesecake factory webpage did suggest that they prefer walk in customers and they hold very few table reservations so we figured we would go there anyways and try our luck.  Arriving at 6:30, the parking lot for this trendy shopping center in Summerlin was already quite full. I immediately went into the cheesecake factory to see if we could either get a table for six or make a reservation for a table and was told there would be a 45 - 60 minute wait. Due to the extensive wait and other nice restaurants in the immediate area I opted not get on their wait list until I at least spoke with the other 4 people in my group. We decided to try a nearby Mexican place instead however we found out the hard way that it wasn&#39;t even open on Tuesdays.  To make a long story short I am mediately went back to the cheesecake factory and got us on the waiting list at 6:45 PM. We were told the weight should be approximately an hour so we are wandered off and despite being very hungry hung out for an hour waiting to receive that text message saying that our table was ready after an hour and 20 minutes I walked back inside to ask the hostess with the status was, And we were informed that there was a large group of people occupying several tables that had finished their meals had already paid but we&#39;re sitting around gabbing and as soon as those people left one of the tables would be prepared for us.  After waiting an hour and 35 minutes which was 35 minutes beyond the estimated wait time our table was finally ready.<br><br>The above is something to keep in mind these days while places practice 50% occupancy.  Popular places especially if they are located in popular shopping centers like this particular cheesecake factory is are going to have long weights and as we found out the hard way sometimes longer than the predicted wait time...    <br><br>Our group consisted of three carnivores, one vegan &amp; one vegetarian, And the cheesecake factory menu had ample options for all of us.  Despite the 50% occupancy our waitress was for some reason running very slow. And it took about 10 minutes for us just to get our drinks during which time everyone but me used their cell phones to look up the menu online because our waitress had failed to give us menus or to give us a barcode we could use to pull the menu up on our phones it was now going on two hours since we first arrived at the cheesecake factory and we were pretty hungry so we wanted to be able to order the food as soon as our wayward waitress showed up with our drinks.<br><br>I ordered an iced tea, avocado egg rolls, and the Impossible Burger which came with either fries or a side salad.   <br><br>The food was excellent and everyone was pretty happy with the portion sizes, the waitress was pretty good at checking our glasses and refilling them promptly, Perhaps because by now it was after their 9 PM closing time and they were not allowing anyone not already on a waiting list to be seated, so she had less customers to deal with.<br><br>Unfortunately though the cheesecake factory seems to be one of those places where you can order just a couple items like I did -- a drink and an appetizer and then an entree  &amp; have a rough idea in your mind what the cost should be but then when you get the actual bill and add in a little bit of a tip, somehow the total amount is about 25% more than what you expected it to be.   My total of three simple items - drink l, appetizer and entrée with a little bit of a tip came out to $44.  I remember the impossible burger being overpriced at $17 and the avocado eggrolls being overpriced at around $13 and then you figure a couple of dollars for the iced tea but I have no idea how that can then I&#39;ll add up to something well over $40.<br><br>Overall, between the lengthy wait and price of the food, this Cheesecake Factory is NOT WORTH IT!!!   I fully expect it will be several years before I wind up back at another cheesecake factory with friends.   It is certainly not on my top 20 list of places to go, even though there is some thing for everyone on the menu.
Great clean place - server was super nice and very attentive. Big portions and wiffie had Prosecco Mimosas with kids enjoying milk shakes...

When you have an insatiable need for authentic cheesecake, there is no other place for a plethora of choices!! Served fast by the bartender. Who was joyful and attentive. It wasn&#39;t standing room only, which was perfect. We walked right in and to the bar area. <br> The location is excellent, next to alot of shops and stores.

How can you go to Cheesecake Factory and not try a cheesecake?  Normally I&#39;m so full from the main dish there is no room for dessert, but that wasn&#39;t the case tonight.   <br><br>Free bread, lots of options for food, and a case full of various cheesecakes for you to try.   What&#39;s not to like ?

Amazing food per usual!!! The service provided by Jennifer or &#39;Jenn&#39; as she introduced herself was outstanding!!! She was very friendly and attentive. She did not hover or over assist but was perfectly timed and helpful asking if we wanted to tweak or keep the order as stated on the menu. Informing us of option, and making sure drinks were always topped off. I watched her interaction with another guest near us she must have known her or was a regular. She was very kind and understanding! Top quality server!!!
We went for my sons birthday, they did a good job with the social distancing and the food was delicious.

here now for lunch, sept. 10th, 2020 at 12:15pm. WOW! the music is so loud. is this a nightclub, or a restaurant? food good, as always. but, PLEASE, turn the volume down on the music. people in our party having trouble hearing normal lunchtime conversation...perhaps management does not know the volume goes way up when they are not around......?

I dine pretty often at this location, and sometimes it runs smooth and other times not very much. The last 2 times I&#39;ve gone they don&#39;t really greet in a welcoming way, and my waiters have not been the best at being attentive. I also got the wrong cheesecake to go and the bread was hard the last time. I love the food here which is why I still go but the service could be better. Upset that the last 2 times it hasn&#39;t been very pleasant because I like dining here.

I&#39;ve been there 4 times for curbside pick-up since the Covid-19 pandemic started, and each time the food has been absolutely horrible.  The Factory Meatloaf from my last trip was burnt and charred but they served the burnt side down so you wouldn&#39;t know it until you got home and bit into a piece. The time after that inedible experience with the meatloaf, I ordered the jambalaya.  The portion was so small, it should have been sold as a Small Plate at half the price. Tonight,  I ordered thr Carbonara pasta and it was not only tasteless but it was swimming in butter.  All it needed was a diving board and a small cocktail umbrella. I had to drain the butter in order to (try to) eat it.   My wife&#39;s salad was merely a plastic container of lettuce and nothing more.  We are done with this location.  Management truly needs to focus on quality and consistency. We are so disappointed.

We placed an order tonight, and both meals were wrong. We paid $45 for this meal (+tip) and the manager (Bobby) didn&#39;t want to make it right...he had a huge attitude. He finally offered to help us by telling us we could drive all the way back there which adds yet another hour of driving (2hours total if you include the first time we drive there) AND we needed to return the partially eaten meals lol !!  And he only offered that after I berated him for not wanting to make it right. Extremely unprofessional.....this is NOT how you take care of your customers, especially customers who tipped well for take out!

It&#39;s a sad day when a restaurant you loved now serves your favorite meal with only a semblance of what it once was. Long gone are the two hearty pieces of chicken, in their Chicken and Biscuits, which had once been reduced to a nice sized piece, and now small medallion sized pieces chicken, reminding me of non breaded chicken tenders, pepper the plate. I&#39;m wondering if I even had a quarter cup of carrots and peas. The biscuits were so hard I wasn&#39;t able to cut into them nor pull them apart,  and had to request new biscuits, which honestly weren&#39;t much better, and the gravy, well, at best it was room temperature. I knew better then to send my food back<br><br>After what seemed like a struggle for my child&#39;s appetizers, which arrived somewhat tepid, I just requested new biscuits and realized that maybe I should have listened to my father and went out another day besides Mother&#39;s Day to celebrate and dine.<br><br> Although I will say I believe we dodged a bullet. <br><br>While the table next to us received their salads I was STEAMING MAD. They weren&#39;t even sat when I ordered an appetizer, that we were still waiting for, for the baby. <br>However, when their meal was supposed to be served the waitress informed them that she&#39;d forgotten to place their order, and it would be just a few more minutes...almost forty minutes later they were still waiting and we left with them only having received their salads and nothing else. Mind you management had already came to the table, apologized and let them know that their meal would be on the house. <br><br>It seemed as though Jasmine has been serving for some time, she didn&#39;t appear to be a novice. I&#39;m not one to piggyback on complaining and I was trying to be patient due to the fact that they were busy with a forty five minute to an hour wait time. <br>It doesn&#39;t make it better and I&#39;ll think twice before I dine with them again.

We came into this restaurant with high hopes. We were seated within the first 3 minutes we arrived. One menu had a little left over mayonnaise in the middle of it, but we were willing to look past that. Our server came over to take our drink orders, and he even gave us another menu and apologized for the mess. As we sat there waiting for our drinks, another server came over and asked us if we had been helped yet....that should have been a red flag.<br><br>Our server arrived with our drinks, took our order and went to help other tables. I asked for a straw for my drink and the server was very apologetic for forgetting it and running behind.<br><br>I sat there waiting for the straw, the server brought over bread and still no straw. The server seemed to be a bit busy and overwhelmed. Not feeling very comfortable we decided to ask to pay for our drinks and leave.<br>The manager was very apologetic and told us he would take care of the drinks.

I get chicken parmigiana couple weeks ago,my boyfriend and I had breakfast at home and I had the Parmesan for lunch (he didn&#39;t eat) we had salad for dinner and it was the only thing I eat during the day and my boyfriend didn&#39;t eat it because he don&#39;t like chicken Parmesantook me to hospital and made me sick and scared the s**t of me that what&#39;s wrong with me,cost me almost $7000 hospital emergency room because I was throwing up till 4 AM and it was %100 chicken Parmesan,DR said I got stomach flu and because whatever I had during last 24 hrs, I even tested for cove_19 and was waiting all these days to see maybe I was positive and it wasn&#39;t chicken Parmesan but Tnx god I&#39;m tested negative and sending this review now because I&#39;m %100 sure it was my food<br>I won&#39;t recommenced this place to nobody ,is just too bad now in this situation get sick and lose $$$$$$ <br>I&#39;m super mad and don&#39;t know what to do with this new bill

We went to dinner for my husband&#39;s birthday, he was craving Steak Diane. We are SO pleased we chose The Cheesecake Factory. When seated we asked for a table to sit side by side &amp; we were immediately accommodated. Our server Shawn, was amazing. He knew the menu well and had great suggestions. Our drinks were always full and he was attentive, but not bothersome during our meal. Our pretzel nuggets were a great appetizer to curb our hunger while waiting for our food. We were given bread &amp; butter too, it was fresh &amp; hot. His Steak Diane was perfect, he ate every bite. My chicken costoletta was so delicious as well, I&#39;m glad I tried something new. We had to go big for hubby&#39;s birthday so we each ordered a slice of cheesecake. If you&#39;ve been here, you know the desserts are huge but so worth it. Shawn &amp; 3 other employees sang happy birthday &amp; even said hubby&#39;s name. His plate was beautifully decorated with a chocolate Happy Birthday written around the plate &amp; a single candle. It was an epic, memorable meal to celebrate my husband. 5 stars all the way!

I don&#39;t think you could ever go wrong with Cheesecake Factory. Absolutely love the wheat bread and butter and the fried macaroni and cheese is just so good! I ordered the Cajun Chicken pasta with shrimp and of course it did not disappoint. If you want somewhere family friendly and good practices with social distancing, Cheesecake Factory is a definite go to!

Had a late night craving for cheesecake and was able to show up about 7 minutes before closing. They graciously accommodated my order of 2 slices of original cheesecake, 1 slice of lemoncello cake, 1 slice of banana cream cheesecake, 1 slice of lemon meringue cheesecake, and 1 slice of caramel apple cheesecake. All were just what I needed. Perfectly made and packaged with all things needed to enjoy on the ride home. (I didn&#39;t eat them all alone though lol). The slices are big and rich enough to cut in half and share, and still be satisfied.
