I just had the most disappointing experience with leftovers of my life. So Cheesecake Factory is normally just a safe place where everyone can find something to eat. We go there pretty often, either at this one or the one near Green Valley Ranch. The most recent trip was disappointing. We had a super nice server, but our spot had glass on it and then a server offered to package my meal for me. I just went to cook my leftovers to find out that I had saved half my meal for nothing. All that&#39;s in my box is a sad piece of chicken medeira. They threw out my sauce, asparagus, mushrooms, and saddest of all, a huge mound of mashed potatoes. I purposefully left so much food behind so I could have a really good lunch later, and I trusted them to package it because it&#39;s been done before. <br><br>For the record, this is now the second time this has happened. Last time it was with a pasta entree, which was really sad. They left me like a single piece of chicken on top of dry noodles instead of packaging the whole thing. Why on earth would a person want only part of their leftovers? It&#39;s just a bummer, as I&#39;ve been really sick and can&#39;t prepare meals for myself right now. I thought I&#39;d have enough, and now I need to get dressed and buy or order more food.

We celebrated our parents&#39; birthdays here last Saturday. Though it was busy the hostess was able to sit us after 5 mins I think. Our server was also efficient but unfortunately I forgot his name. We wanted them to sing our folks&#39; a birthday song and he got the message when I only handed him a tissue with their names on it. <br>Our orders came and everybody enjoyed the food. I only give it 4 stars because the white rice that came with my Carne Asada Steak was dry and hard with a lump of burnt rice included. The steak was soft, medium rare but it was ruined when I had my rice. It was like eating a left over rice. Hopefully they dont serve that again next time.

Terrible. What&#39;s the point of a review if you&#39;re table won&#39;t even be ready when it says to be ready this is the second time this has happened. The lady then puts her hand in my face after I ask in confusion. Hate it here

HORRIBLE!!! HORRIBLE!! HORRIBLE!!<br>Not only was I using a gift card from last years horrible experience this one literally takes the cakes of worst time ever!! First I couldn&#39;t get a hold of anyone when I put down on my order I didn&#39;t want to pick up for an hour but emails said would be ready in 20 minutes. I head out to the location because the phones would either say all lines busy, hang up or just ring. When showed up I was greeted in the parking lot by a disgruntled angry employee telling me if I didn&#39;t get a text go away and find a place till I get a text. Okay that&#39;s fine.. after over an hour of waiting 1 1/2 hours after my order was supposed to be ready and zero text message I send my friend to check on the order while I wait in my car in the wonderful desert heat. 10 minutes later I see him walking out with the bags and he exclaims that same pleasurable gentleman in the parking lot through down his clip board angry because he already told us if we didn&#39;t get a text and how short staffed and all the issues they are having on the busiest day of the year. As if it&#39;s the customers problem for the poorly staffed location. Few minutes later wait staff comes with his order he said and despite the anger he even gave him a generous tip. As we are driving my curiosity peaked on is that order even warm or do you think it&#39;s been sitting there for over an hour... sure enough cold pretzel rolls and cold beans that feel like they have been there for a full day... once we get to my parents home which is supposed to be a nice Mother&#39;s Day meal with my mother and father to find out our order isn&#39;t even in the bag! Thanks Cheesecake Factory for not only having us have a cold order but only the appetizers and the deserts only there.. well now comes the fun of trying to call ha ha ha!! Nope off to the restaurant my friend went to go make sure our order isn&#39;t just fixed again but hot this time! What a waste of time for an order that was supposed to be ready 2 hours ago. Now I work in customer service and I know there are ways a restaurant can handle days like this which include shutting down orders after a limit or only allowing cheesecake orders for pick up or making sure your system to text messaging is working because I still have not gotten my text my order is ready that was cold... so there isn&#39;t just something wrong with the flow of your system but also your phone lines which isn&#39;t being addressed which is easily fixed with a notice on the website.., trust me there are better ways to handle this. I&#39;d be more than happy to offer my expertise in this management situation. Working for Aramark and other large venues in management this is failure on the manager and poor system put into place. Here&#39;s to hopefully being able to eat soon for my diabetic father waiting on his meal and my mother with als. Lou-gherigs luckily since this is the 3rd failure with this place and it was our last shot we prepared for the worst case and had other meal plans just in case you failed us again!!! I just wanted to use up the gift card I haven&#39;t used because of the horrible service.

Mother&#39;s Day disaster! We ordered at 1:00 to pick up food at 4:30 and they tell us they are running an hour behind. We come back at 530 and tell us it will be an hour to two hours even longer of a wait. They didn&#39;t plan at all. The guy at the front wouldn&#39;t even check to make sure my ticket was in even printed despite asking. I&#39;m super frustrated with their lack of service and I don&#39;t think we will even go to Cheesecake Factory again.<br><br>Update: they aren&#39;t answering the phone so we can cancel the order and it is 6:30 and we still haven&#39;t gotten a text saying it was ready. Had we not left we still would be there 2 hours after our order was supposed to be ready<br>2nd update: We never got a text that our food was ready. We could have been waiting for hours and then never had any food for Mother&#39;s Day. Good thing we left. It was so disorganized and lack of service was extremely frustrating. It really put a damper on Mother&#39;s Day.

This review is exclusively for Shawn! We love cheesecake and is always our top choice for our diet cheating day! We always visit the strip location and this time we decided to try this location for the 1st time &amp; Shawn gave us the best experience, his presence and attitude made every more delicious and joyful. His eyes smiled the whole time he was talking to us and helping us with our food choices. Informative and polite. Thanks for having us again!
Long wait time , but food is good. Heard they do delivery which can avoid waiting at the restaurant

I am a huge Cheesecake Factory fan I go here so often and try so much of the menu everyone knows this is my favorite place. <br>The ultimate red velvet cheesecake is my favorite and the slices are a great size ! The Mac and cheese balls are my favorite or has only been one occasion with less/ thin red sauce. The original cheesecake and the vanilla bean cheesecake are very creamy and that&#39;s why I personally add hot fudge for my chocolate craving. The avocado egg rolls are great I&#39;m just personally not a fan of the sauce and wish there was a lighter spicy mayo or soy sauce sort of option. I love to ask for the chocolate cakes to be warmed up because I don&#39;t like cold chocolate cake and I like to add the ice cream just so I&#39;m not in chocolate overload. I used to love the crab dip but the last few times I&#39;ve order anything with crab in it at Cheesecake Factory it has made my stomach upset so I stick to the spinach and cheese dip now. <br>The service is always good but if they are busy just have patience and ask for more bread! I&#39;ll be back soon
The food and service are always amazing here! And I appreciate their Gluten-Free menu options.
Great service from Nicole and food special adjustments to Dishes were awesome! I wanted angel hair on<br>My jambalaya, no problem.
This is always my go to! Service is great! Food is great! And they have such a variety of healthy and non-healthy food selections that will satisfy every taste! Recommended for every occassion!

Busy all the time, been here a few times and seems to be the place to be for dinner. I had a BBQ chicken ranch salad with extra crispy onions. It was very satisfying and fresh. Trying to eat lighter, although they got me good with the bread basket. There was some kind of event going on, or last day promo, so it was crazy bananas, but knowing that, we were patient and all the servers were smiling and kind and got everything right. Good job CF! Oh and I absolutely love the Raspberry Lemon Cheesecake that I took home. Divine!
Very expensive. Nothing really special. The good thing is that it&#39;ll satisfy the cheesecake lovers.

The cheesecake is five out of five, best cheesecake ever! The lemon meringue being my favorite. Although personally I feel like the food isn&#39;t that great. But the staff is always nice, and I wouldn&#39;t go anywhere else for cheesecake!

Omg! SUPER RACIST company structure, ex-military waitresses with little brain activity to crap mouth the one whos paying !!! &#34;huh!&#34; Rude management &#34;ceasar Madueno&#34; to tell a customer tbere wrong, not even pack my leftovers than push me out the doors... Consequences will be addressed

I don&#39;t know what was worse, the rudeness of [who I can only assume was] the manager when I went to go pick up my food, or the fact that I ordered two things and they were both missing main ingredients. <br>Also the items I requested to not be in our food were found in the food. <br>I&#39;d also recommend to NEVER add shrimp on a salad, because it&#39;s an extra $7 for 3 baby shrimps, when the last 2 times I ordered this same salad, I got 6 or 7 large chargrilled shrimps (which is reasonable). Go gamble at casinos, not on quality and quantity of add-ons to your food here.<br>I&#39;m easy to please, I promise; but the service and quality of two entrees were garbage. <br>It&#39;s unfortunate that the quality and freshness of the ingredients happened to decline within the matter of two weeks, so hopefully it was just an off day for Cheesecake Factory...

CF may be a chain restaurant but they&#39;re always busy especially this location... Primarily because food is always good and service is excellent! Always great for happy hour from 4-6 PM except weekends (I think). How can you go wrong with $6.50 cocktails?  We ordered the sweet corn tamales cakes for appetizer and they&#39;re just delish!

Had a great server who promptly attended our table, filling drinks, and filling us in on the progress of our order. My food also came out not correct, and he apologized promptly for it and offered to have it fixed. As for the covid procedures, they seemed to be unclear as when we entered the restaurant they were fine with my party all waiting indoors but then we were asked to wait outside when the other day we attempted to eat here and left due to the wait and no one was waiting outside. But still, they were just doing they&#39;re jobs.

Went here last night for my mother&#39;s birthday. we had 8 people total. while waiting for my party to arrive i went inside to make sure our table was ready. on my way to the lobby i stopped with my 7 yr old to make a quick call &amp; the manager interrupted me &amp; kept asking me questions .. then eventually told me i had to wait outside in a very condescending way. when we were all seated we weren&#39;t given menus. it wasn&#39;t until after we ordered drinks when our server handed us a tiny square paper to use the QR code to bring up the menu. my food was cold and i asked 2 other servers to grab my server. it wasn&#39;t until 20 mins later he came to the table. everyone is done eating and he offers me new food ? no thanks. cheesecake factory isn&#39;t my fav what&#39;s so ever &amp; this topped it for me .
my grandkids enjoyed the food here lots of vegetarian options, cheesecake is great, love the upside down pineapple cheesecake

Took my kids for lunch today.  Food was great.  Service was great.  They were very busy but we waited only maybe 15 minutes.  Son in law had the Spicy Cesar Salad and Cajun Jambalaya Pasta.  It was great- had a little kick.  Daughter had the Crusted Chicken Romano with white sauce vs. marinara.  I had the Grilled Steak Tacos.  The food was fabulous.<br><br>My vegan daughter was worried about what she could eat but was happily surprised to find that they have the Impossible Burger.  This is the only reason I give 4 stars instead of 5.  They serve a burger that is meant for vegetarian or vegan customers, but the bun is not vegan.  She had it like a lettuce wrap so not a huge deal but something to consider for your vegan customers.  <br><br>The cheesecake- well what to say?  5 stars!

First time visiting Cheesecake Factory.  We decided to bring E&#39;s mom here after hitting up bingo at RR.  There was only a small wait of maybe 5 minutes when we arrived.  Very dark in this place.  Like really dim.  Going for romance maybe?!?! lol.<br>The food was delicious!  Service was fast and we will definitely go back.  I recommend going before 5 on the weekends.  As we were leaving HOLY COW was the wait long and so many people!

This place is an absolute joke. I ordered for pick up for 4:30pm and my food was not brought out until 5:40pm. When I talked to the manager all he did was lie to me about why it took so long and then did not even offer anything for my inconvenience of waiting over an hour. Could have at least offered a free slice of cheesecake or a discount next visit, but absolutely nothing was offered to me. To top it off, when I got home a special order item was not even attempted and ended up being a waste. I will never return to this place due to the incompetence and poor customer service.

Ordered on DoorDash for pickup, got there 5 minutes before the pickup time, was sent to the side of the building with a large line of people waiting to pick up, an hour later found out they sent me to the door dash driver pick up spot, waited so freaking long and for what???? Cold food??? Make sure you know who is who picking up what like for real

We came to celebrate our friend&#39;s birthday this evening, a party of six. Our server was Daniel O. who greeted us with a very friendly and warm smile. He took our drink order right away and throughout our dinner our drinks were refilled in a very timely manner! He was amazing, friendly and very funny and you could tell he loved his job. I highly recommend the thanksgiving turkey sandwich first time having it and omg so delicious. Our next trip back we will request Daniel! We usually visit this location every 6/7 weeks.

Well the food was amazing and the service was great the booth was really dirty. There were noodles, bread parts, a MASK, etc. they could&#39;ve cleaned it but they didn&#39;t. I&#39;m this time of day with COVID I expect it to be clean.

Cheesecake Factory located on Rampart in Las Vegas NV has definitely improved their game. Finally!!<br><br>Restaurant was clean. :)<br><br>Hosts were friendly. :)<br><br>Matt our server was OUTSTANDING!! :)<br><br>Food was cooked perfectly and my Cobb salad was delicious!!! :)<br><br>Chefs are doing a wonderful job preparing and plating food. EXCELLENT! :)<br><br>Looks like Cheesecake Factory is definitely back to a restaurant worth recommending! Enjoy! :)

We love the fried Mac and cheese and our new favorite dinner is the Shrimp and Chicken Gumbo! Oh my god!!! It is the best thing I have had in a long time!!! I normally get the Chicken Riesling  and that is also amazing. A hidden secret from this place is the breakfast pancakes! It&#39;s huge but it is the best pancake I&#39;ve had by far! The only thing is their syrup is like a weird buttery sauce and I wasn&#39;t feeling it. Next time we come for breakfast I&#39;m making sure I bring my own syrup because that pancake is so buttery and fluffy! <br><br>As for the cheese cake we love the lemonchello torte, chocolate s&#39;mores and the birthday cake.

Our service started off with the waiter telling our table he would get us the yummy bread &#34;eventually&#34;. He then waited for at least 20 minutes before he came to take our order. Our waters and bread were both empty and we asked after for him to refill them. He said he would but seemed to forget. He yelled across the restaurant at other customers while one of us ordered, left and and then came back 5 minutes later cause he forgot another order. The food (the cauliflower!!!) may be fantastic, but could not redeem the poor service. <br><br>For future customers, I would recommend not visiting this Cheesecake, I&#39;m a local and rather drive farther away than repeat this experience.

I&#39;ve loved the many Cheesecake Factory locations in California and assumed the quality would be the same.  The restaurant exterior looks fancy but the inside is dark and weird.  My favorite Steak Diane and Chicken Madeira combo lacked flavor and seasoning.  Korean cauliflower was spicy and tasty.  The Mai Tai cocktail was not mixed well and the bottom half was straight up alcohol that left a bitter taste towards the end of the meal.
Been coming for years. Fantastic food and service. Yelp wants me to write more so I&#39;m adding an extra sentence.
Great service, not to bad of a wait with COVID guidelines in place. Our server was great and food was delicious as usual.
Leah was an amazing server. We didn&#39;t have to ask for a thing. She was quick and friendly. Thank you!

Had a reservation for 4 people and was told that I had only reserved for 2 people. I had to show them my confirmation. How dare they treat a guest this way? After they finally seated us, the server (who had no personality at all), had trouble understanding our orders. We did not get any bread for many minutes and she NEVER came back to check on us in TWO hours. I will say our food was good and therein was the reason for 2 stars. But they have got to deal with the service at this restaurant. WOW.

Incompetent, management is a 000, making wait people more than 30 minutes when there is more than 20 tables available because they are so cheap that they under staff, it&#39;s bad, shame on them. And I don&#39;t talk about dogs ( NOT SERVICE DOG AS WE DID ASK THE OWNER ) that pee on the floor. What&#39;s that?? Just stay away of this location!

Reviewing a chain can be a little difficult. While the delicious food may be the same at each location, the service can be vastly different at each location. <br><br>In my experience, the service in Las Vegas can be hit or miss. Sometimes the service can be great like the last time my boyfriend and I were there. Our server was extremely personable and attentive. I never once asked him to refill my water and he came to check on us the perfect amount of times to see if we needed anything. Sometimes the service is terrible. Once our server came to get our drink orders after sitting for 10 minutes. I&#39;m guessing he was new or was never told he had a new table. My boyfriend&#39;s water had a weird residue at the bottom of the glass and it took another 10 minute wait to get our waiter to come back. We finally had to get another waiter passing by to get us new water. We were also both extremely hungry that day but weren&#39;t given bread because according to our server, &#34;there&#39;d wasn&#39;t any bread ready.&#34; How is that possible? I suspect this was a lie and he just forgot to give us bread. <br><br>Overall, if you have time to wait and are willing to gamble of the service, you should come to Cheesecake Factory. The food is always good and the portions are huge.

Went last night service was okay. Usually when I come here our service is always good but last nights our server forgot our bread. We had to ask for bread. The food was so good! I highly recommend parm herb crusted chicken! It was soo good, I was loving every second! Price range is reasonable to me because portions are big. This location seems less busy than the other ones.

Waited over 10 minutes and no one came by to even give us water or acknowledge our presence, while the table next to us just sat down and were waited on promptly. We were looked at several times by numerous servers but no one ever came to our table. We ended up leaving and going somewhere else that cares about their customers and actually takes care of them. Needless to say we will never return to this poorly run establishment
Our dinners and service was spectacular at the Summerlin location . Dan O. our server was exceptional. He was courteous, efficient and very professional. The food was yummy as always.
Always a good place to visit. Clam chowder soup is always the best. Very covid prepared. Menu is a QR code that you scan on your phone.

I can&#39;t say enough about this spot! Service is excellent the food is great, the atmosphere is friendly and inviting. It was really busy for lunch but the hostess staff handled everything really quick! <br>For lunch I enjoyed the Chicken Madeira one of my favorite dishes here next to the jambalaya if you like spicy. Our waitress samantha was very attentive and friendly definitely a must go spot
So so disappointed this is what I got when I ordered extra chicken for the Thai Lettuce Wraps!!! <br><br>Burnt crisp little tiny wimpy nasty chicken!  how could you Cheesecake Factory!!!

I have been a huge fan of the Green Valley location, but have relocated to the Northwest area and I just had to make a visit to see how this location compares. I was not disappointed and even through covid 19 restrictions, this location has proven that Cheesecake Factory as a whole, is top notch. I utilized curbside service twice, while dine in options were unavailable and twice to dine in, in the last few months. Each time, I was very pleased with the comfortable atmosphere, cleanliness of the restaurant (inside and out), timeliness of service and especially, the friendliness of the employees. I will definitely keep patronizing this restaurant and I look forward to visiting other locations too.

i love cheesecake factory! Food is so yummy specially my fave Ahi Tartare and the fire - roasted fresh artichoke. They also have a Valet parking for the convinience of the customers. Very friendly staff and alert. And you can&#39;t say No to their yummy desserts!

Came here for a late holiday gathering with friends over the past weekend. Service wasn&#39;t bad for a large party of 11 people and they were very accommodating. Deducted a star since we were served burned bread and some of our pasta dishes had burnt ingredients mixed in. I ordered the Louisiana Pasta and it was surprisingly good, although the spicy flavor was lacking (a lot spicier the next day, after soaking in the sauce), but the chicken was made to perfection! I usually hate ordering anything with chicken since it gets over cooked and dries out, but this breaded chicken was still moist and lightly breaded to my liking. My SO mentioned my chicken tasted kind of burnt, but I didn&#39;t think so (just looked a tad darker than it should have). My new favorite at Cheesecake Factory which I haven&#39;t found in awhile. I hope they don&#39;t get rid of it. One of my friends ordered the same entree and he drowned his pasta in chili flakes and tabasco sauce lol. I also ordered the cucumber lemonade, one of the best flavors, the others are on the sweeter side. Don&#39;t forget it&#39;s free refills! <br><br>As I mentioned, service wasn&#39;t bad for our large party and on a Saturday evening around 7pm, we occasionally had to ask for refills, but our server did come check up on us from time to time.

In an effort to support cheese cake factory during time of need I was disappointed in quality of food.  Our office ordered take out only to find out when food was delivered was told two orders was missing without a substitution.  Secondly ordered chicken carbonara only to not have one piece of chicken just peas and pieces of bacon and to top it off no taste.  Third medallion steak was all fatty with hard mashed potatoes.

Restaurant management sucks, you have doordashers coming to deliver food for your restaurant and the directions are park by the dumpster, and someone will come out.. waited for 15 minutes still no one  comes  out, my order is now late and then they tell me to stand outside in the cold instead of in the restaurant. Fuck this place

I normally don&#39;t leave bad reviews but I&#39;ve had it. Do not go to or order from this location if you have any sort of dietary restrictions or allergies. Every time I have ordered a low carb slice of cheesecake they have given me original, especially over delivery. Thankfully DoorDash made it right this time but I cannot eat the slice I received without becoming ill.
Yes! Im back!! This time i brought my family and we had lunch here after church. Always  great customer service and friendly wait staff. Love cheesecake factory!!

The Cheesecake Factory is my favorite restaurant! I love their flavors and portion sizes (especially portion sizes for their salads). Their cheesecakes are to die for, but the calorie count is beyond belief and just might kill you (as is the case for most items on their menu).<br><br>I love the brown bread they bring to the table when you arrive and their passion fruit iced tea is the bomb! Of course, the avocado eggrolls are exquisite, but I seldom order them. Instead, I found a recipe that tastes exactly the same so make it at home. Making the recipe, though, shows why their food is so good--they use unique and quality ingredients and their dressings and sauces include many, many ingredients (many of which are hard to find).<br><br>I usually order a dinner salad, eat half of it, and take the rest home (asking for a little extra dressing in my take-home bag). With the remainder, I can make two more meals simply by adding extra lettuce. <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is not cheap so is truly a special treat. They offer take-out so are a great option when traveling and don&#39;t feel like going out to eat or ordering room service.

i had a dinner at this location bad customer service very dis respectful when i asked for water tast should give me the better option did asked my nationality ben told we live in desert mean in las vegas we don&#39;t have pure water!!!<br>very rude if i get sick who would be responsible ?!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

We come here ALL the time, for every occasion and we usually have the best service. Yesterday however was unpleasant. The receptionist WAS SO RUDE and for the life on me cannot even think why! We checked in for 2 people and she said it would be a 20 min wait. Great, no problem and we sit. 40 mins go by and we noticed people who came after us were getting seated. I glance over at the receptionist, and I think she realizes we have been waiting a while so she approaches us and says a table inside should be ready in a few more minutes. No worries. We wait another 15 minutes and when I look up at the receptionist, she is talking to a cook and they are glaring at us! No idea why. I feel funny about it, but I approached her ready to ask and she barks &#34;Look, there isn&#39;t a table ready anymore inside for you and if you want to sit outside, it&#39;ll be another 40 minutes.&#34; So rude! I knew something was wrong so we walk to another receptionist who GLADLY seats us within 5 minutes! We were so puzzled. <br><br>Our waitress was as kind as ever and we were served. However, in the middle of our meal, we are approached by that rude receptionist who yelled at us &#34;You stole someone&#39;s table and you weren&#39;t supposed to be seated!&#34; I was in complete disbelief. We were like &#34;We are in the middle of eating, what would you like us to do?&#34; And she just huffed and left us. Unbelievable! We finished our food, left our waitress a nice tip, and left. Definitely left us feeling funny. We wish we knew why this happened but I&#39;m glad we just kept calmed and tipped well. I do hope that receptionist was just having a bad day, but we don&#39;t feel like we will dine in for quite a while.

Cheesecake Factory is always good and they have the biggest selection of food than any other restaurant I&#39;ve ever been too. You can always go hear and everyone in the family will always be satisfied because they have every type of food. My favorites the the lasagna verde, sweetcorn tamale cakes, avocado egg rolls, greta burgers, awesome Cuban sandwich, ice tea is awesome,  great Mexican dishes, and more. Take your family here and they will all enjoy it.

Time for an update, let&#39;s go with 4.5 stars this time.  The menu is varied, so leave some time to go through it.  The spicy Caesar salad was great, as were the buffalo blasts, pork sliders, Nashville hot chicken nuggets, chicken taquitos and eggroll sampler (we like apps).  The Korean cauliflower was ok. I had the combo with Steak Diane and herb crusted salmon, it was outstanding, although the mashed potatoes were a little strange.  Don&#39;t expect actual mashed potatoes, more like baked potato put in a blender for 10 seconds, very lumpy, but ok.  The highlight was our very nice waitress who put up with 6 adults and a toddler, she was great.  The margarita was a bit small for the price.  Overall; great place to eat lunch.

The service here is the best I&#39;ve experienced in 2020. When we got there on a Friday night we were seated expeditiously. Ryan our waiter was prompt, efficient, friendly and thorough! It was my friends and my pleasure to have met him. One of the shift managers even stopped by our table to check on us. We&#39;ll definitely be back. The food is admirably priced and delicious!

Just came down to get a piece of chocolate cake for Mother&#39;s Day for my wife and they said they were not doing any to go orders. They were busy but they could have at least gotten a piece of cake to go. I&#39;ll never be back
Management contacted me and rectified the problem. I do plan on giving them another chance.
You can never go wrong with Cheesecake Factory. Always get a cheesecake for dessert and then one to take home. Big portions and great service like always. All at VERY affordable prices.

Do you get bread?  We didn&#39;t get bread.  Other people got bread (lol).<br><br>I didn&#39;t notice it until after we received our main entrees but other guests received bread prior to their main courses.  Nevertheless, the food was still good but the Hostess sucked!  You have to be personable and outgoing for that position.  Remember, you&#39;re technically the first face that guests are greeted by.
Daniel O. was our server for tonight, and he was more than amazing! He was jolly and checked up on us very often. He made our dinner very pleasant. Cheesecake is very lucky to have him!

I&#39;m a regular cheesecake. Love it there&#39;s so many options that she don&#39;t need to have the same food twice. Have a chicken lettuce wraps Which were delicious. Of course since I&#39;m watching my carbs I had to get the low-carb cheesecake. Excellent.

So this is my 4th time eating here this week. I love Cheesecake Factory food clearly. <br><br>I would just like you guys to improve in a few ways. <br><br>The service is mediocre at best. And I think it&#39;s because you guys might be a little understaffed for how busy you are during dinner. <br><br>They may also all have a little bit of a pride issue. Because I&#39;ve had two waiters make mistakes not bringing my drink or forgetting about our dessert, and then getting really defensive about it when I ask again for the missing item. <br>I&#39;ve worked in a restaurant before and it reminds me a lot of very experienced servers or lifetime servers. Sometimes they just feel like they&#39;ve been there so long that they can do no wrong.<br><br>I spoke to a manager once before and even she seemed overwhelmed. <br><br>This leads me to the conclusion that the employees and managers are understaffed and a little stressed out.<br><br>I would really appreciate it if you would schedule and hire more ppl to work here bc I will be coming 2-3 times a week and would like better service. <br><br>Thank you.
Great service we had last night good food and good times on my 22nd wedding anniversary thank you
I love Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;m actually kinda shocked that they have a low star rating. I think their service is fast, and the food always comes out tasting good.

Argh what happened to Cheesecake Factory? I used to like it-today lunch was not good at all. Our waitress &#34;Kim&#34; was nice but my My booth had food crumbs all over it and a from on the ground under the seat. Let&#39;s clean up before guests arrive please-  First impressions are everything! Bellagio Chicken was soggy and it used to be crispy, the basil spaghetti noodles were beyond  Al Dente they were inedible. Ugh. There was way to much cream sauce making the chicken even more soggy. I was starving &amp; hadn&#39;t eaten all day. Very disappointed bc I just moved here &amp; was excited there was a location nearby. My guests fried chicken buffalo sandwich was very dry so he barely ate it. Just overall sad bc we used to like this place in Other states. Oh well. Guess I will have to keep searching for good places near me now.
Mike mac is amazing. 5 stars every time. A stellar attitude and he always goes above and beyond to make sure our service is excellent;&#34; love him!!

My sister took me here for a birthday brunch, the food was amazing &amp; service was excellent. Kim was our server &amp; she was superb, always checked on us &amp; made sure everything was perfect. I definitely recommend the Champagna pasta, not sure if I spelt it correctly but super bomb !

Tuna tartare was bomb.<br>Ordered tex mex egg rolls because they were out of my favorite &#34;avocado eggrolls&#34; it was crispy, crunch, and tasty. And our last plate called &#34;bang bang chicken&#34; it was terrible. I dont really understand this was on the popular plate list on Yelp. Portion is huge I guess it&#39;s because it&#39;s almost $20, it&#39;s like fusion thai and American plate. Unbalanced, dry, and flavorless. Wasn&#39;t good at all. And their service was really nice<br> And fast. Hope they get egg rolls next time!

We come to Cheesecake Factory occasionally as it&#39;s a really good restaurant and always has tasty food.  But somethings changed from 8 or 9 months ago.  The food portions have really shrunk.   I ordered the Diane steak and herb salmon.  My wife got a tiny square of salmon.  The portions were Quite tiny.   I remember cheesecake being good and I always brought home leftovers.  This time my wife and I both finished our plates clean.  The taste is still good though, but just the potions have shrunk.  Blame it on the economy, maybe, or maybe just blame corporate greed and the bottom dollar.  That&#39;s how these franchises like outback, red lobster, apple bees, sizzlers go downhill.  They start reducing quantities, cut costs, stop innovating, and pretty soon they just go by the wayside.  Seems like that&#39;s what&#39;s happening here.

This was the first time we have eaten out since the quarantine started and my family was so looking forward to enjoying a special treat. I ordered online and was given a pick up time. When we arrived, we had to wait about 20 minutes past the quoted time on the website, however I never mind waiting IF the food and service is worth it. We ended up extremely disappointed with our entire order. Our appetizers and entrees were cold, the pasta was undercooked and hard - food was mediocre at best. Considering the price, the food was absolutely not worth it. They had a promotion of a free slice of cheesecake for a $30.00 order and the slices were about half of the normal size. Initially they forgot part of our order but we were able to catch it before leaving. Normally in a restaurant setting if there is a problem, you can speak with your server and address your concerns, but given our current situation we don&#39;t have the luxury of being able to do that. Knowing customers are taking meals home, extra care should be taken to ensure the food is properly prepared, neatly packaged and everything is in the bag. We will not be ordering again.

It&#39;s been a while since we have been to a Cheesecake Factory, the opportunity came up after our original plans fell thru. Here are my thoughts regarding our experience...<br><br>First, I want to point out I felt the management team and wait staff were excellent. It was a busy night, there was a mix up with one of the meals and the management team was very pro active in taking care of it. The wait staff from start to finish was very attentive and exceeded my expectations. <br><br>So why 3 stars? Well two reasons, first I ordered fish and chips and honestly, the fish had no flavor or taste to it. The fries were cold and over salted, I kind felt like this offering is a after thought and there is an opportunity to relook at how this simple dish is prepped. With that said, the party I was with did state that their steak and chicken dishes came out well, therefore thinking next time I try one of those<br><br>The second issue, the music was loud and I felt like it was hard to hold a conversation. I almost felt like they were trying to be a little trendy with their music choices. The party sitting next to us made a comment about the music level as well. <br><br>In conclusion, I want to give this place another shot as the service was truly 5 star, but would just try a different dish.

Everything was literally perfect! My husband and I weren&#39;t able to celebrate Christmas because of his work schedule so last night was finally our Christmas date. lol. We haven&#39;t been to this place in forever. Samantha was our server and she was amazing!! My husband is a manager in the industry and I used to be. I wanted to try some of their new items... but I was craving their avocado egg rolls w/ that delicious dipping sauce! I tried lemon merengue cheesecake also, first time, and loved how the top was part melted marshmallow and browned with a torch, kinda like they do with creme brulee. Hubby had his favorite dish- the Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp. Cooked in a flavorful creamy sauce and large portion. And lets not forget the amazing complimentary bread and butter they serve! Timing and service were perfect.  Thank you to the staff for making our &#34;Christmas&#34; great! :)

Beautiful place with great employees and delicious food. What more can one say.  My friend and I had lunch here today and everything was fantastic. She had the chicken and waffles and enjoyed it very much. I had the Pasta Di Vinci and really liked it.  The service was top notch. Parking may have been a problem if we had gotten there later and hadn&#39;t  found a spot.  It was not my first time here but this is my first review. Keep up the great work.

Always a fav, I order a banana split today, and even thou they didn&#39;t have it in the menu, the bakery said they will be happy to make it! <br>Service is always good. Or favorite pie is the banana cream pie!
Had dinner last night with in laws and kids! Family enjoyed the patio and service. Thank you.
I was contacted via email by the restaurant manager in 06/14/2019. I did reach out to call her, but after being on hold for 11 minutes, I hung up.

This is a late review. Went here a month ago for my nephews 30th birthday celebration. There was 12 in our party. We ordered appetizers, drinks, and entrees. Our appetizers came out at a decent time. One of our appetizers which was the calamari tasted spoiled and didn&#39;t smell good so we sent it back and they made up a new batch for us. All of us got our entrees except the birthday guy. He ordered the combo chicken with filet mignon. They said they forgot to fire up his order. It wasn&#39;t the waiters fault because he put in the order. They said they were backed up in the kitchen. We were practically almost all done with all of our entrees and the birthday guy still hasn&#39;t received his entree. The manager came out and said it will be out soon and that they are not charging us and that our table can get up to 5 free cheesecakes and the birthday guy can get a free cheesecake on the house. So finally the birthday guy got his order when we were all done eating except his 2 cousins waited for him to get his food to eat with him which was nice of them. But he wanted steak medium rare so it wasn&#39;t to his liking because it was more well done. All of our entrees were cooked to the way we liked. The waiter and manager was very accommodating and gave us great service despite the mix up and that&#39;s why I gave them a 4 star otherwise I would&#39;ve rated them a 3 star. Cheesecake Factory has always been a place to go for drinks and desserts and food and we&#39;ve never really had a problem till now.

Getting seated on a Wednesday afternoon was only about a ten minute wait...our server found us five minutes later and took our order...we were served warm bread before getting our beverages..and then waited nearly 30 minutes for the fish n chips to arrive. <br>Three stars because the food was very good but the service was slow and seemed unorganized; several servers were visiting with people exiting ...perhaps off duty employees...while we waited for our order. <br>Once was a special place to go...not so special this day.

Been to one, been to them all (for the most part). This tends to be my go-to location, been coming here for years. Service is typically great and food comes out quickly. <br><br>This location can be very busy during lunchtime on the weekdays and on the weekends. So if you&#39;re coming during those times, be prepared for a wait. Typically the wait time goes by quickly, some nights it can be 20mins plus. Last I checked you couldn&#39;t call ahead to reserve a table...but maybe they changed that? <br><br>The lunch specials are a great deal and perfect portion size. Dinner portions are rather large, I feel like two people could easily share. And, as always, the menu is huge with something for everyone. Desserts are the same, something for everyone. If I&#39;m not craving cheesecake, I enjoy the strawberry shortcake. It&#39;s not too much, but delicious. Most of the cheesecakes are too indulgent for me.

I&#39;m addicted. My favorite thing is the honey truffle chicken. I swear when I was pregnant I ate here at least 2-3 times a week. Was such a craving. The wait staff is always so pleasant. One of our favorite places to eat

If you dine in, the food is amazing. Most of the time, takeout is great too! Last time was horrible, that&#39;s the main reason for removing the star. <br><br>I love the menu! It&#39;s creative and has unique options. Even their take on original dishes is different! I go with the California Cheesesteak most times. For appetizers, the mushrooms and spinach dip are always great. <br><br>I mentioned the takeout being horrible last time. If my experience was based on this ONE time, it would be a one star review. However, after going many times (before and after) it would be unfair. It&#39;s justified to take a star, though, because the experience is not consistent. <br><br>Also, it is a little expensive. Two dishes, one shared desert and one shared appetizer ran us $70 after tip. It was disappointing paying $15 for a sandwich that was inedible (again, only the one time for takeout). <br><br>The deserts are phenomenal, obviously!! It is the Cheesecake Factory after all. My favorites are the hazelnut crunch and the tuxedo! My girlfriend favors the cookie dough. <br><br>A little hidden gem is the cold brew coffee. I am a coffee connoisseur, so I know a good cold brew when I taste a good cold brew!

Not good. This is not medium and my parents tacos are cold. Seemed like it was a pain in the ass the correct the order.<br><br>My parents cannot afford to go out and eat on their fixed budget,  not to mention my dad has Alzheimer&#39;s disease and this was supposed to be a great outing. <br><br>Instead,  the waitress disappeared after dropping off the food, took forever to get toppings for my burger and when we complained about the COLD CHICKEN TACOS, she said that&#39;s the way they come. REALLY?<br><br>Broke my heart to see my dad frown and then say he didn&#39;t like it.  I took a bite to discover the chicken had a hint of warmth. <br><br>By the time the waitress reappeared I was almost done, my parents were picking at the tacos and she reluctantly offered to remake the tacos.<br><br>At that point our time with my dad&#39;s patience ran out do to his Alzheimer&#39;s. <br><br>What a sad memory. <br><br>Shame on you guys, shame.

The service here is exceptional. Theres something on the menu for everyone. Dont even get us started on the cheesecakes. Your going to want to try them all! The last ones we tried were the oreo and pineapple upside down cheese cakes!!!

Great food &amp; Awesome Service.  Dorothy was an amazing waitress. My husband does not like onions. She suggested a dish and to make sure it did not have onions chef Luis made it from scratch.  Our food was wonderful. Everything was very clean and we felt very comfortable. We will be back.

I love Cheesecake Factory; although expensive the atmosphere is cheerful.  <br><br>The service is always awesome when we go to any of these establishments.  <br><br>Today we met some friends for lunch. When we arrived and walked in I let them know we had a party of six and I asked the girl If there was a wait and she said &#34;no there isn&#39;t a wait&#34; I said great. She takes my name and says it will be about five minutes. I was like what, you just said there wasn&#39;t a wait?????? I wasn&#39;t upset that there was gonna be a wait but for the fact she said there wasn&#39;t going to be one was kind of annoying.  I thought okay maybe they have to get a table to fit us. That wasn&#39;t the issue because after waiting about ten minutes they walked us over to a booth which was sitting next to a handful of other empty booths.  Again I wasn&#39;t mad about waiting but just annoying that she lied, bizarre right??<br><br>Anyway, the host gives us our menus and about five minutes goes by before our super,  sweet and nice waitress arrives to get our drink orders. She goes to retrieve our drinks, drops them off and I realize we don&#39;t have straws for our drinks; only a straw for my sons (which they put in). I actually prefer to do this ourselves. Again just annoying.  We wait for about five minutes before anyone walks by before we scored straws.  <br><br>Next, we finally get our food orders in and our meals finally arrived about 25 minutes; after giving our orders.  <br><br>The food was good and I do like that they have added the calories of their meals to menus,  as well as new items. <br><br>When it was time to pay getting our bill took forever; once she dropped the bills off it took another ten minutes before she came back to retrieve them. It was annoying again.  <br><br>My last complaint was that the booth was filthy. There was dust on one of the napkins, corn dog sticks between the wall and seat as well as on the on the floor. There were crumbs all over the seats and the floors were dirty. The place really needs a deep clean. If the dining area is filthy that makes me assume that the kitchen must be pretty dirty. <br><br>I can promise you this; I&#39;m finding a different Cheesecake Factory to eat at and never visit this establishment again

Yes, I know there&#39;s plenty of reviews already but I came here on my birthday got the usual Steak Diane. Worst Steak Diane ever. I guess it&#39;s a hit a miss depending on your cook for today. <br><br>Leah, our server was the sweetest EVER. Despite having a bad dinner on my birthday she made our night just by simply being so kind.
My favorite place to come for late breakfast. Absolutely love their iced teas and endless selection of good chow. My only wish is that they opened an hr earlier.

Not the worst but isn&#39;t the greatest. I came here on Mother&#39;s Day and got my usual pasta. The pasta was super dry, the chef for got the sauce. but my waitress saved the day. She came out with sauce on the side, after we told her what had happen. But How do you forget the sauce? <br><br>Meal portion was extra light compared to the size I get on a regular day. Maybe because it was mother day and the need to send out meals quick was urgent? Not sure , but I rather go to the cheese cake factory located at the out door mall.

We have been coming here since they opened. They have gone through a lot of changes in staff and menus. We were just there the other day and sat out on the patio and every single chair had bird poop on it. The waitress that sat us down even searched for a chair with none on it and could not find one. I don&#39;t think people realize how filthy and sickening it can make you. I lost a friend to pigeon poop and she didn&#39;t even know it was in her system until it was too late. They need to clean those wicker chairs  everyday, not to mention the tables as the birds walk all over them! Just saying! Otherwise eat inside.... food is usually consistent.

We came for my husbands birthday and everything we order was delicious ! I saw some stuff they had here on yelp but not on menu at the location and the server offered to make it for me even if it wasn&#39;t on menu anymore ! I was surprised that this item wasn&#39;t on menu anymore as it&#39;s the most delicious  I had ever tasted since coming to cheese cake factory ! I hope that next time they can still make it ! Because I would go back just for that ! Although all the food is amazing

I tend to stay away from large chain restaurants, especially ones with 400 things on their menu.  Driving by, you can see that the lobby is packed and a number of groups are waiting outside. Typically for me that is strike three, however, we had a sizable gift card that we needed to spend, so we braved the crowd.  To my surprise, we were seated in about 35 minutes, and this was a Saturday night for a party of four. The waiter was very attentive and accommodating, and could speak intelligently about various menu items.  He was great. They start you off with bread, which I always tend to eat way too much of, and the main dishes arrived a short while later. I ordered the chicken Madiera and it was excellent. The wife ordered a burger, which was also very good. I will definitely return again.

So happy, we finally had our Mother&#39;s Day dinner, albeit at home. We enjoyed a fantastically delicious meal picked up in a very timely manner from Cheesecake Factory at Rampart.  Wow, everything from the &#34;big&#34; Small Side Salad with all kinds of wonderful greens to the Chicken Piccata to the Cheesy Flatbread to the Chicken da Vinci-all terrific.  Thanks CF for making us believers again.

Wow, just had staff literally yell at my little girl because I&#39;d forgotten to bring our face masks in from the car, and ~with staff permission~ she was waiting in the corner just inside the door and at least 15 feet away from where anyone else would be (to be out of the 110 degree heat while I went to get our masks)... This is a tough time for all, but there is no need to yell at a young girl like that, telling her &#34;You have to get out now!&#34; Beware of the lack of compassion from staff at this location!

[Cheesecake Coma]<br><br>Who doesn&#39;t love an exaggerated size slice of cheesecake? My girls and I stopped by last night around 10ish. It&#39;s was pretty empty. The service was delayed the entire visit. We had to continuously ask to order beverages dessert food and the bill. I get it it&#39;s late but they&#39;re open until midnight and guest should expect the same level of service until the restaurant closes. <br><br>The food and desert quality did not disappoint. Each dish ordered was exceptional and served promptly! <br><br>A few of the many items ordered were Tuna Tartare (so good omg), dynamite shrimp and various desserts!<br> $100 later we are satisfied until next time!

Arrghhh, I hit a key accidentally and my almost-complete review disappeared!  To re-create:<br><br>It was senile dementia that brought us to the Cheesecake Factory.  Let me explain: Friends were visiting from CA, and after we sat around drinking wine and munching on cheese and crackers, we turned to the serious problem of where to go for dinner.  The couple has been to Vegas often, but mostly in the SW valley, where their son lives.  Herb came up with the brilliant suggestion to go to Mixx, and I readily agreed, thinking it would be something different for them.<br><br>We were presented with menus and water, and as I was explaining the bowl concept to them, I suddenly had a Duh! moment, and realized that the very next night we were going to meet a group of neighbors for Happy Hour in this very restaurant.  We had already decided that at HH we&#39;d order two Fresh Market big bowls instead of the HH apps, so that we could take home leftovers, my favorite meal.  But we didn&#39;t remember any of that when we set out for Mixx.  We certainly weren&#39;t going to do that two nights in a row.  So, completely chagrined, we told the waitress we&#39;d see her tomorrow night.  Cheesecake Factory, being right next door, was the obvious substitute, since we didn&#39;t want to start thinking all over again.<br><br>All four of us ordered from the Skinnylicious menu, probably in atonement for the excesses of Thanksgiving, Christmas and New Year&#39;s.  Our friend had the Flatbread with Pear and Blue Cheese, and loved it.  His wife had the Lettuce Wraps, picking the Asian &#34;tacos.&#34;  The dish looked beautiful, and she enjoyed it.<br><br>My husband ordered a Turkey and Avocado sandwich, which came on a bun with a bowl of salad, and he liked his, too.<br><br>And then there was me, deciding on the skinny version of the Turkey Burger. Wanting a change from buns, I chose the wheat baguette. And ranch on the side for my salad.  As soon as my fork touched the burger, it fell apart, but it tasted okay.  But that wheat baguette was no wheat baguette.  It was more like pumpernickel, and it was SWEET!  So were the caramelized onions - adding sugar is a sloppy shortcut for the slow cooking that renders them naturally sweet.  My salad didn&#39;t come with the ranch dressing I asked for.  Instead, it had the house dressing already on it.  Lots of it.  When the waiter brought a new salad and the ranch, that dressing turned out to be strangely sweet, too.  Sweet ranch??? Yuk, and yuk also for the salad, which was a sizable portion, but completely different from the one my husband got.  Not my kind of mix.<br><br>Service was impersonally okay, but just average.  Three of us four liked what we ordered.  I&#39;m the outlier, but I&#39;m the one writing the review, so I get to give it three stars.  And I&#39;m being generous.

I like eating here. I&#39;ve had burgers, salads, chicken, and meatloaf. I&#39;m a big fan of the bread. The restaurant has a cool decoration to it. I always feel comfortable when I&#39;m eating here.
Our go to place if we really want a good American food. Never leave this place without getting a slice of Cheesecake. Yummy!

This is my first time coming to cheese cake factory with my honey and we can honestly say it was such a great experience! Our server Katrina C was truly amazing ! She&#39;s is the sweetest and always kept checking up on us, we will definitely come back and dine in !

A very good friend  treat me  a dinner here. <br>The place is beautiful and clean.The staff are quick and friendly. <br>Its pretty cool to dine outside the porch,kinda sweet  and relaxing.lol.(we can  count the cars and  people passing by)<br> My first impression with the waitress,shes seems unhappy..lol but I was wrong.. she&#39;s cool and amazing, she can ride on my jokes..lol..<br>We had miso salmon with brown rice , so far, it taste good...yummy....<br>The place is full, therefore   people love to dine here..try it for yourself.

OMG, so I called on Friday to get a jump on the Mother&#39;s Day rush, spoke to some dude, gave my order, I was told to call on Sunday around 1:10 to see if the order was going  so I started at 1:00 and called 12 times, busy, no answer, go to pick up the order at 1:30, told they are slammed give them 30 minutes, 45 minutes later no record of order and not one dam person gave a shit, incompetent, it will be a cold day in hell that I step foot, and like they say bad reviews go a long way! FU Cheesecake Factory!!!!

Cheesecake is one of my favorite spots to have lunch on this side of town.<br><br>As with every experience there, the service was wonderful and our waitress had a great personality.<br><br>It&#39;s easy to get overwhelmed with the choices on the menu. Luckily, I stick with the smaller Skinnylicious menu. <br><br>My favorite is the Mexican Tortilla Salad, which is always yummy, which has less than 590 calories.<br><br>Even though I wanted something sweet at the end of the meal, my waistline screamed at me to hold off, since it&#39;s now pool season in Vegas.<br><br>Overall, this experience at Cheesecake Factory was great! I highly recommend coming here for lunch.

Had a very lovely and memorable dinner with the rock of my life. Definitely one of our Go 2&#39;s for a nice relaxing dining experience. Meals are always prepared delightfully with lots of love and attention to detail. Always experienced a very hospitable atmosphere. Lights are dim candles burn low and the tastes and quality of our dishes absolutely always meet our standards for the occasions. Chipotle Chicken Pasta &amp; Filet Mignon are stupendously appetizing. Avocado egg rolls are always a pleasant choice for a appetizer. Lemon Drop Martinis accommodates the romance in the air. I highly recommend The Cheesecake Factory in Boca Park if you&#39;re looking for a low key but slightly romantic and relaxing evening. Definitely always a win.

I always get good food here.  Really no matter what I get.  Servers are always nice.  Place get packed but it&#39;s worth the wait. The atmosphere is pretty chill. Great place for a date, with family or a group of friends.

The service/experience was ok, not great. Took bit of an effort/wait to get napkins, silverware, and bread plates. Meanwhile our hot bread was cooling off. Otherwise, the food was what you would expect, pretty good. I had the skinnylicious Lemon garlic shrimp for the first time and it was delicious.

We love the Sweet Corn Tamales appetizer. <br>For dinner the Chicken Bellagio is what we come her for. <br>Clean restaurant great service even during peak times.  <br>How can I review them without talking about desert. Mmmmm. Chocolate Mousse Cheesecake is our favorite. The others look great also but we focus on certain things at each restaurant.  <br><br>This is our order every time and they are very consistent.  <br>If you have never dined at a Cheesecake Factory. <br>Do yourself a favor. <br>You can spend more and get less. <br>Great value and good for family dining also.

Straight Trash.<br>Called. They said 20 min wait.<br>We get there. <br>Check in<br>25 mins go by.<br>We ask. &#34; hey how much longer?&#34;<br>They say &#34;like 5-10 mins&#34;<br>20 more mins go by.<br>Yo!!! What is taking so long?<br>The lady looks and has the NERVE to say &#34; oh, we must of called your name/buzzed you and was written off as a no show&#34;......<br>&#34;Yo. Lady. I&#39;m literally standing right the fuck here. I have 2 very hungry kids.. Sit me down right now or y&#39;all gonna feel my wrath&#34;. <br>You guys SUCK. Management. Step up your game and hire competent people. <br>Won&#39;t be going back to your location.

So on April 26 my daughters boyfriend and I ordered some food for her birthday we got three appetizers which were two mac &amp; cheese balls one avocado egg roll one Americana burger with fries and two orange chickens and then we got three cheesecakes and a wheat baguette. And all I can say is basically we&#39;ve got a bunch of crap! $140 for cold nasty food and I was not impressed! The avocado eggrolls were so soggy and cold that when you pick them up they fell apart now the mac &amp; cheese balls those were perfect. My daughters boyfriend said his burger was OK but his fries had so much salt on them he couldn&#39;t eat them. My daughter and I both ordered the orange chicken which neither one of them had any sauce  the chicken was so dry it basically tasted like A cheaper version of sweet-and-sour chicken that you would get from the Chinese restaurant. So basically we threw away over half of our meal! A terrible experience but at least the Mac &amp; cheese balls in the wheat baguette or hot.

Check it out:<br><br>I was picking up take out on Valentine&#39;s Day for me and my gorgeous dime piece of a woman, because I love her and she deserves it. We like to eat at home on V-Day, in case a romantic mood strikes and we need to handle our valentine&#39;s Day extracurricular activities right there on the spot. <br>Pretty much every pasta dish here is so bomb, it makes my spirit soar and my body react in a borderline sexual manner, so naturally, Cheesecake Factory take out was our decision this fine evening. <br><br>Now listen, I&#39;m not exaggerating when I say there was a line of 5-10 cars waiting for take out and the manager Sara was running around the parking lot, directing traffic, fighting crime, carrying 5 bags at a time, and heroically getting people&#39;s food to them in the cold. She was like Wonder Woman. At one point, I think she actually flew but I can&#39;t say for certain. She was dodging cars, slinging that delicious cheesecake left and right, just being a straight take-out savage, as we all stood by like PEASANTS in the presence of a higher power. Impressed by her service, I tried to tip her and she wouldn&#39;t let me (which is my only real complaint) <br><br>If Sara doesn&#39;t have a raise/promotion the next time I come back here, I will be taking her, my top notch review and my business to a more deserving restaurant.<br><br>Long live Sara the Great.
I enjoy coming to this location because they&#39;re on point with the service and food. With there being so much to choose from on the menu, you can always find something you&#39;ll like!

While waiting for a table we decided to go to the bar and grab a drink. Our bartenders were Edwin and Rosie, these bartenders were awesome!!! They were fast, efficient, and made delicious drinks!! I stepped away from usual &#34;old fashioned&#34; cocktail and decided to try something out of my comfort zone.. the chocolate martini.. Edwin fixed up a legit one for me.. which was delicious and beyond what I expected, he also fixed a my cousin his first old fashioned! Which he enjoyed. Thank you Edwin!!! As for Rosie she was also a rockstar she fixed my auntie a cosmopolitan which looked amazing and &#34;tasted as a cosmopolitan should!&#34; my aunt happily announced. Thanks you TWO you guys rock!!!!
Service is good. Bread is the reason I go the wheat and butter is the best. Their selection is a bit overwhelming with all the different types of food, but good food.

I always enjoy a trip to this restaurant. During this time of &#34;stay at home&#34; this restaurant has gotten their pick up service down to a science. I ordered my food online and as soon as I received the text that said it was ready I headed to their curbside for pickup. One person asked my name and then I drove up another 10 feet where someone handed me my order. I never had to get out of my car. I was on my way in about 30 seconds. It was a smooth operation and my order was perfect.  During times like these it&#39;s nice to know that something works without any hassle. Great job, guys!!

Not my first time at this location: service is always very knowledgeable (their menu is a novel) <br><br>The server was very busy when we got there so he created us and said he would be right back.<br><br>Got our drinks and then let us decide. <br>We ordered the artichoke crab dip (came out hot) but it wAs a tad too fishy. <br><br>I definitely think the wine prices are WAY too high for the name brand they are selling. We spent $50 in drinks and only had two a piece.<br><br>We both ordered the ribeye and was cooked perfect!! I always get their grilled asparagus (fantastic) instead of green beans.  UP charge btw<br><br>The bread basket they give u is also fresh and warm. <br><br>So full at the end I had to take cake home. We will be back but not soon. Just so pricey for two.
So A amazing restaurant i love it !<br>I will came again I have the burrito is for two people service
Quick and efficient service, always come to only this location and each time it hasn&#39;t done me wrong, always yummy. I tried the Carmel macadamia nut cheesecake, by far my favorite of all flavors!

All the food is great and decently priced. The fried macaroni and cheese is the best! One problem we had was they brought six meals out over the course of 25 minutes. The service was mediocre but in their defense the place was packed

Expected much better service. Our waiter was not rude and the food wasn&#39;t bad so that helps, but with them either being to busy or distracted they felled to bring out our appetizer and our main course for a party of four took nearly an hour for us to obtain. We found what look like a finger now and one of our alcoholic beverages. Could have been something else but mixed with the other issues was unpleasant. The pricing wasn&#39;t bad so maybe one day I&#39;ll try to give it another chance butt definitely not on the top list of restaurants with so much competition out here.

I remember the day this restaurant opened. Long lines and craziness. Fair food. Today no lines, same food same disappointment for expensive food that&#39;s fair at best. Examples, crab cakes that are fishy. Only offer one soup for lunch   I must say the French fries were awesome.

What a great, cozy place! Had a party of about 15 people and our server Jasmine did a great job of taking care of us. she was so  attentive and sweet. Everyone was so satisfied with dinner and  we can&#39;t forget about the cheesecake too.

Eaten here many times and have encountered bad service, food prepared incorrectly, long waits for a table and longer waits for food. We&#39;ve also had some great service, quick seating and food served quick and correctly. We do love the cheesecake and a few menu items, so we tolerate the hit and miss of a big chain restaurant from time to time. But after eating half my salad I found a black bug in my next bite and now I have to draw a line. Obviously these things can happen with produce, I&#39;ve found bugs in my lettuce from my grocery store. I didn&#39;t make a big scene and the manager did come and apologize and offered me something else. I declined and they took it off our bill. While I can be gracious and understanding that it&#39;s (hopefully) not anyone&#39;s intention to serve me salad with a bug in it, I will not eat here ever again. Quality control can sink you when not done correctly.

This restaurant has so much variety!! From breakfast foods for brunch to pastas, pizzas, Mexican food, seafood etc they have so many options! This is a great place to go if no one in the family can agree on what to eat.<br><br>We started off with some cheese sticks and a Greek salad for an appetizer. The sticks were not greasy and the cheese was melted to perfection. I like how the cucumbers were cut differently in my salad, it made it extraordinarily refreshing. Perfect amount of dressing too! Oh and free bread with butter.. everyone loves that!<br><br>The portions were HUGE. Thanks to our server, she gave us a heads up on lunch sizes vs dinner plates. The lunch portion of the chicken fettuccini Alfredo was a full plate.. I can&#39;t imagine what the dinner portion looked like! I still had some to take home!<br><br>You can&#39;t leave this place without ordering a slice of cheesecake (Stuffed? Of course you are! Just ask for it to go.) I had the BEST flavor.. the lemon raspberry cheesecake with lady fingers. They have a full page on their menu of different options to choose from.<br><br>They have great customer service too. You will leave here with a fully satisfied belly.<br><br>PS. It really is nice that they post pictures of the food on their website. Almost every selection had a picture. It&#39;s helpful when you really don&#39;t know what you want to eat and don&#39;t eat here often. (In case you want to look before you go)

Always supported Cheesecake loved it and definitely had a thing for the Calamari, however TODAY I am beyond disappointed, Veterans Day! YOU are offering NOTHING to those that are serving those that served and still healing years after. Shame on you again! Prime example of American Greed!

I used to really like Cheesecake Factory, but now not so much. I&#39;m not sure if they have changed things up as they became a huge chain or my tastes have shifted, but the quality seems to have taken a hit. It&#39;s still good, but not something I would normally spring for. <br><br>The cheesecakes are the best thing here of course, and the other cake slices are pretty damn good too. I would give them 4 stars if I was just judging desserts.<br><br>The menu is enormous, so they have something for everyone. For a big party of all ages and sizes, it makes for an easy pick that everyone can be okay with.

my lunch was from 9pm-10pm. i even told them i work next door so i put in an order at 9:10. they told me it would be ready within 20-25 minutes. i call at 9:40 because nobody has called or texted me with an update. they give me an update at 9:47 saying they just sold they&#39;re last batch of fried macaroni. i had 10 minutes left to eat on my lunch why even take the order from me and tell me yes it will be ready by such and such time if you were going to run out. now i have to work til midnight on an empty stomach because you guys are &#34;sold out&#34;. the best they said they can do was give me a different appetizer? what so now i have to wait another 30 minutes for a different order when i will be on the clock?! are you fucking kidding me!!!!!!

About 2 weeks ago 8 of us came here at 11am for brunch. Usually at other restaurants will charge you the gratuity automaticly for party of 6 or more but this cheesecake factory didn&#39;t charge.<br>Great service &amp; good food. Everybody were really nice there, the host (RYAN &amp; VADA), our server ( I forgot his name roberto or ricardo)<br>They have a lot of food selections &amp; specialty under 500 calories also a lot of cheesecake to choose from  Their lunch special from 11am-5pm.<br><br>Each of us order different food. Maybe you think a little bit pricey but you get a lot of food. We were not even eat half of our food, too much food so We all have left over to take it with us . We all love with our ordered<br>We had a strawberry cheesecake (their original cheesecake top with a big piece of strawberry &amp; a little bit strawberry sauce) &amp; fries to share. Their fries is what  fries should be, I wish other places that sell fries do what like this place do. It is hard to explain but We love it<br><br>I ordered chicken bellagio $16.59 - 2 pcs crispy coated chicken breast over basil pasta &amp; parmesan cream sauce top with prosciutto &amp; urugula salad. REALLY REALLY GOOD I also ordered a slice of chocolate hazelnut crunch cheesecake to go but I prefer their original.<br><br>We will definitely come back

My family and I came here for my birthday dinner at 5pm on Saturday 9/2/17. It was busy inside but we only had to wait about ten minutes to be seated. Our server brought waters and bread right away and everything was off to a good start. The menu here is massive and I never know what to order. They have over 200 items, how can you decide?!? I finally chose the bacon-bacon cheeseburger with fries, mainly because I am obsessed with the ranch here and wanted to dip something in it. Yeah, I am a ranch freak. Side note, you can buy the ranch and all of their dressings to-go. <br><br>So we all order and then wait for our food. I expected there to be a long wait but it was pretty quick. Everyone gets their food but my grandma. Also, I realized I got the wrong burger. When our server comes back, he apologizes and says he will get those out right away. 20 minutes later, me and grandma still have no food. Everyone else is pretty much done eating at this point. Finally our food shows up, and by this time my appetite is gone so I take everything to go. We also ordered cheesecake, because duh. I ordered the pumpkin, (seasonal) and since it was my birthday, they brought it out singing. I love being embarrassed on my birthday, said no one ever. Our server was able to get the manager to comp some of our meal, which was much appreciated. We probably won&#39;t be eating here again anytime soon, but I will be back to get some cheesecake.

&#34;Why you gotta fight with me at Cheesecake?<br>You know I love to go there<br>Say I&#39;m actin&#39; lightskin, I can&#39;t take you nowhere<br>This a place for families that drive Camrys and go to Disney&#34; - Drake<br><br>My roomie likes two things: Drake and Cheesecake Factory. And she had gotten a particular Drake song in her head and asked if I could take her to Cheesecake Factort. It was her birthday after all. <br><br>This Cheesecake Factory is located in the Boca Park shopping center in Summerlin. Not hard to find as it is probably one of their anchor stores for that shopping center.<br><br>Maybe it&#39;s the location [you are in Summerlin afterall] but this location seems more elegant and dressed up than your average Cheesecake Factory. Parking can be a hassle but there are valets outside.<br><br>Anyways, on to why this is a 4 star rating.<br><br>My girlfriend and I took my roommate to dinner for her birthday yesterday. As soon as we entered the girlie and I took a seat while my roomie gave the group&#39;s name to the hostess. We had sat down and were called almost immediately! Talk about service. <br><br>Our server was a very nice woman named Cathy B. who was very attentive. I&#39;m HUGE on customer service and recognize it whenever I see stellar service. She was a sweet, kept our drinks filled, took our plates away as soon as we were done eating and we were even able to get her and the rests of the servers to come over and sing &#39;happy birthday&#39; to the B-day girl. <br><br>The total experience was excellent and left an impression on me. And that&#39;s a big plus because I&#39;m generally not a fan of chain restaurants like C.F. or Olive Garden.<br><br>Now on to the food.<br><br>For an appetizer I had an order of buffalo chicken wings. They were yummy and had the right amount of zing to them. The best thing I had that night!<br><br>For dinner I ordered the Bacon Bacon Cheeseburger. It was cooked to order and even had pork belly in it. It wasn&#39;t great but it wasn&#39;t bad. Pretty average. And the only reason I can&#39;t give my visit a perfect rating. <br><br>I did have a bite of the Oreo Dream Extreme Cheesecake and it was good. I don&#39;t have much in terms of a sweet tooth so I can&#39;t say that the cheesecake wow&#39;ed me but it did was plated very beautifully. Nice job on the presentation.

We&#39;ve been at this location many times but lastnight was just extraordinary. The service was excellent. We were sitted at the patio. Ambience was great. Food was very good with generous servings as usual. Acknowledging a guest&#39;s bday was a treat and much appreciated!

Cheesecake factory is great for their extensive menu and delicious cheesecakes. I rated a 4 star because it&#39;s difficult for me to ever give a chain restaurant a 5 star strictly because I like authenticity. On the expensive side, the food and cocktails are delicious. <br><br>I do really appreciate that they do NOT use Styrofoam for their to-go boxes.

Recommend going inside and sitting down to eat rather than Take out. We placed a large order for 6 people to pick up, and the portions were half the size compared to if we had ate in the restaurant! Two of us ordered the angel hair pasta with shrimp and both dishes were half tomatoes! The other meals ordered were not very good either. And they gave us Only one serving of bread for 6 people... Also, when we picked up the To Go order the young lady who rang us up was very rude. Overall just another bad experience. Super disappointing. Won&#39;t be going back.
Ruben M was our server and he was great! Very friendly, attentive, quick on refills an more. Food was delicious, tried the shrimp scampi it was tasty and I highly recommend.

Who doesn&#39;t love Cheesecake Factory. Came here to meet up with old friends. We definitely over extended our stay just a tad bit. I had the jambalaya great flavor and very filling. I had also ordered their calamari, tasty! Friends had some other foods as well can&#39;t recall it all but it all tasted amazing. Great place to hangout and chit chat have a couple of drinks. All 5 of us kinda celebrated our birthday&#39;s there as well we were all born in July. How amazing is that?!

I&#39;ll start off by saying that I realize The Cheesecake Factory is a chain and there may be varying experiences, but I&#39;ll describe my latest visit at this location.<br><br>There was a 20 minute wait on the night we went which was to be expected for a weekend. No big deal as we browsed the variety of cheesecakes available near the entrance.<br><br>After being seated, the service just seemed slow even on a busy night. It took a while for the bread to come out. It took a while for the food to come out. When the food finally did come out, the portions were huge and the food was good. We did have a minor issue with how the pasta was cooked. It was not cooked wrong per se, but we prefer it to be cooked a little longer. Our waitress offered to correct the dish so no big deal.<br><br>Overall, the experience was ok. It&#39;s what I have come to expect from The Cheesecake Factory. Food is usually pretty spot on with big portions. Service is hit or miss.

Some people might scoff at me for liking Cheesecake factory. Whatever floats your boat. There&#39;s only two items on the menu that keeps me coming back here. BUFFALO BLAAAAAAASTS. What is that? What was in there? Buffalo marinated chicken with cheese inside of fried wonton wrappers. Do not underestimate these fried wonton wrappers...sounds strange, but you won&#39;t even know that they&#39;re wonton wrappers while you&#39;re eating them. The blue cheese sauce and buffalo sauce on the side is AWESOOOOOOOOOME. <br><br>My other fave item is their Godiva brownie sundae. This will be sure to hit the spot if you&#39;re craving major sweets. <br><br>Let&#39;s not forget the complimentary brown and sourdough bread. ME LOOOOOVES!!! <br><br>Service was on point. Location is nice, but interior is much smaller than other Cheesecakes I&#39;ve gone to. <br><br>I&#34;ll be back to stuff my face with some more buffalo blasts...after I manage to get a workout aka walk 1 mile.

Every bite of the tamale cakes was delicious. The ribeye steaks and Greek salad were also extremely good. The pineapple upside down cheesecake was just sweet enough. The topper, however, was our waitress, Aurelia. She was the best.

Literally NEW BEST FRIEND!! Jessica is amazing!
