She is such a sweetheart We have been to this establishment several times and every time the food was amazing but the service unfortunately was sub par. This time, my friends and I experienced an experience worth yelling about! We ordered several appetizer options off of the &#34;skinny menu&#34; which had specialty items such as the Cobb Salad, Mac N Cheese, and Pasta items! This experience provided by Jessica and the kitchen staff was just splendid. We are so honored to have been served by her and we can&#39;t wait to come back! Xoxo
My favorite is shrimp scampi and dynamite shrimp and Thai lettuce wraps! All their cheesecake is good but the best for me is Godiva and Tiramisu cheesecake!

My husband and I came to The Cheesecake Factory for our 1st wedding anniversary and boy was it a disappointment. This was our first time coming in and I don&#39;t think I will be going back. We sat down and the waitress asked for our drink order. My husband first got a passion fruit margarita and then the classic lime margarita. For an appetizer, We ordered the variety egg rolls and they came out pretty fast. 1/2 of them were lukewarm, But we hadn&#39;t eaten all day and just ate them without saying anything because we were starving. For our main course I had the chicken Madeira and the steak Diane and my husband has the shrimp scampi and steak diane. It took a while to come out, so the waitress gave us bread. But she had forgotten plates to accompany it... so we are it without plates. Once the food arrived the plates were EXTREMELY hot but the food was COLD!! My husband was too shy to say anything so he ate his, but I asked for it to be warm. I don&#39;t expect to pay $24 for cold food!!! Anyways the manager came over and said he will remake it. I agreed, I waited 19 mins for the food to come out! By the time it came out my husband had already finished his meal. I asked for it to be put in a box since I didn&#39;t feel like eating anymore. The waitress told us that the meal was going to be taken of the tab. She then brought us the dessert menu and we declined l, but she said she would not charge us for it so she recommended we try the tuxedo cheesecake. When we finally received the bill we were charged for my meal.... I was furious becuase she had preciously told us that it would be taken off. I asked why it wasn&#39;t and the waitress replied saying she took the meal that was cold that the manager &#34;offered&#34; to remake..... WTF! So basically I would have been paying for 2 meals for myself if I didn&#39;t have it sent back!! Overall we ended up paying a $100 tab with no remorse for the bad service or my screwed up meal. This really was a disappointment especially since it&#39;s the first time we have eaten out since the shut down and it was our anniversary.  This experience has left me really disappointed especially since I was so excited to celebrate my first wedding anniversary  at the Cheesecake Factory. Thanks for ruining my anniversary dinner Cheesecake Factory... :(
Food was very very good. I was disappointed with the time it took to get everything. We were there for 2 hours!!! The Tiramisu cheesecake is AMAZING.

I&#39;ve never had any bad experience dinning in any Cheesecake Factory Restaurants so far. Its been yrs since ive step foot into one. Decided to come here since we had giftcards and my BF hasn&#39;t been to one. Nice location in Summerlin Boca park shopping center, pretty much stuff your face and walk it off after or a nice light meal either way you get your money worth. We say pretty pricey but yea so we ordered-<br>Bread was really hard. <br>Jambalaya was perfect the spices and all that colorful goods for mixed in perfectly.<br> Spaghetti was boring, noodles cooked well but the traditional sauce was not to tasty and tasted watered down.<br>Celebration cheesecake was amazing, we were very skeptical to order this being that it looked very sweet but it wasnt that sweet at all, smooth light taste.    <br>Caesars salad was just okay, not worth the price for sure.<br>Calamari was good, prefer marinara sauce but they use cocktail sauce instead.<br>Other than that our waitress was great, forgot her name but she did her job well!
My husband and I just came in for appetizers this afternoon and our waiter, Brandon, was such a sweet heart. The food was delicious. We will be coming back soon because our waiter was so wonderful !!

CHEESECAKE. Cheeeeeeesecake. Who doesn&#39;t like cheesecake?! &amp; when you add a restaurant where the servers applaud you for eating dessert before dinner, why would you NOT go? <br><br>It wasn&#39;t my first time at this location, but it seemed like a LARGER location than the others around town. The wait was approximately 20 minutes, so my friends &amp; I bought and ate a mango lime cheesecake first. It was tart, the ingredients perfectly blended, perfect for my sweeeet tooth. <br><br>For dinner, we skipped the appetizers and went straight to the entres. I could use a lot of words to describe each dish, but pictures are worth more. <br><br>Great service! Amazing food! Tons of options!

Great food and love the bread. The customer service is pretty good here. And they do have really big portions which for the price is good. I definitely would go back for special occasions and also would recommend the cheesecake.

Manager Katie did not take care of our problem and needs to go back to customer service training classes.  They had made a mistake on my order and it was barely eaten and she would not offer anything to make us happy except getting me a new dinner. By that time, my husband was already finished and I wasn&#39;t going to wait for a new dinner and eat it myself while he waited. The waiter admitted it did not come out as ordered and did nothing to try to fix it and then when we asked to speak with the manager, it took awhile for her to come and she also admitted it was incorrect but did nothing.  She just wanted to keep justifying herself and arguing with us.  As a manager of a big and busy restaurant, that we dine at atleast twice a month, she is not an example of a good manager. Never let the customer leave unhappy for a mistake that was made by your restaurant.

Customer service is equal parts communication and genuine attention to your diners. Mike, the manager @ Boca Cheesecake Factory clearly gets this.  When we were seated at 12:24 and became antsy when our food hadn&#39;t arrived forty minutes later we asked for a manager. Manager, Mike came over a few minutes later but, by then our food had arrived. He came over with a very upbeat and approachable attitude.  He wanted to ensure the food was fresh and hot and was very apologetic about our wait time. When guests visit your restaurant, you want them to feel welcome. When you treat them with care and respect while providing an excellent meal, they&#39;ll come back to your restaurant again and again. So, thanks to you manager Mike we will be back. Thanks for your attention to our concern.  We hope to seek you on our next visit to the Boca Cheesecake Factory. Much success with your leadership at the restaurant. Curtis and Tyra

Had lunch with my husband. The crispy crab bites are so freaking good. Need to add a couple more bites. Seems kinda pricy to have only 6 small balls. Service is good pretty much always. I work for doordash so I do a lot of pick-ups for them. Problem is, they take so long to get the food ready that I&#39;m always late delivering the food. My rating drops because of it. So I hate doing deliveries for them. Other than that, everything is good.

Cheesecake used to be my favorite restaurant until my last visit. I was with my girlfriend and we ordered an appetizer and two entrées I had ordered the steak Diane which comes with mashed potatoes + mushrooms + onions and a Demi glaze. When I received my food the mashed potatoes smelt very rotten. I had told my waiter that the mashed potatoes smelled bad and she offered me to keep  some of the small pieces of steak and gave me the smallest plate to eat it out. This was the worst service. The waiter had taken my whole plate with everything. I had to complain to the manager (short male with glasses, maybe Hispanic) and nothing was done. The manager tried to blame the problem on me. This is horrible service from whole staff especially waitress and manager. I regularly eat out at restaurants and this was a horrible experience. I don&#39;t recommend this Cheesecake Factory to anyone.

I had the most wonderful experience tonight. I needed a special evening with my girl at the Cheesecake Factory. I called them up and tried to make a reservation and they advised me to do it through Yelp. It was the easiest thing to do. It was Friday night at 6:30 PM, very busy  and when we arrived the foyer area must&#39;ve had about 20 or more people waiting to get their names in line to be seated. I made my way up to the counter and told the young lady I had a reservation for 630. She called out my name and said we will seat you right now, come this way. Using Yelp to make my reservations at the Cheesecake Factory was a wonderful and pleasant experience.

This was my second trip to the cheesecake factory in about six months. First time I went I had a burger couldn&#39;t believe how good it was. Cooked perfectly delicious taste etc. etc. Much different on the second trip. Sat at the bar and had a beer while I waited for my food. Bartender was nice but lousy at her job. She saw my burger was overcooked and didn&#39;t say a word. Took two bites of it put it back on the plate. How hard is it to cook a burger? Will not be back ever. Cheesecake factory fail.

I ordered steak diane medium, the meat came well done and super dry, hard as an rock. It&#39;ll chock you without drinking water. Talked to the waitress, she offered more sauce to go with it. I can&#39;t believe this is the same cheesecake factory. Will never go to this place ever.

I have to give this place 5 stars! I dropped by a week before my visit to make sure I could use some really old gift certificates. The manager was very helpful, and said he would honor them, and gave me his card to make sure I could use them if he wasn&#39;t around. It&#39;s a shame that I didn&#39;t write down his name. <br><br>I decided to eat there yesterday, with a friend, but it was more crowded than I expected for a Wednesday. I was told it was about a 25 minute wait, but it was really only about 15 minutes. The hosts and staff were very friendly, even though there was a crowd of customers waiting around. We were seated in a booth close to the kitchen, and if I have to think of any negative, it&#39;s that those booths were very dark, so it was hard to read the menu. That isn&#39;t enough to remove a star, though. Our server, Shawn was just awesome! He was the perfect combination of friendly and professional. I would recommend you sit at his table! I ordered the Chicken Madeira/Steak Diane combo, which was very good, and exceeded my expectations by a mile. My plate was so clean, you would have thought I licked it that way. I had the Lemon Meringue Cheesecake for dessert which was also very good. I would expect nothing less from a restaurant with cheesecake in their name. I only have a picture of my dessert, since I forgot to take one of my actual meal. <br><br>I&#39;m sure I will be back, even without gift certificates...haha.

What can you say bad about Cheesecake Factory? Absolutely nothing. The service in each restaurant of course is different, but the one in Bocha Park has had great service! <br><br>This is one of my&#34;Go To&#34; places to eat when I don&#39;t know what I&#39;m hungry for. Since the variety of food is pretty big I usually end up finding what I want to eat. If not, my fallback favorite there is their Jumbalaya!!
Love this restaurant (Boca Park Las Vegas location).  Great service and well prepared food, all throughout the menu!

The food here is almost always good. Hot and fresh and tasty and prices are good<br><br>Blacked grilled salmon is yummy and cooked properly.<br>Margarita flat bread is great.<br>Salad is great.<br><br>Recommend the skinnylicious menu!!  Much better portions..

Cheesecake Factory has always been one of my favorite places to dine at. They always meet these expectations; High quality, good tasting food, excellent beverages, very good service, and a classy ambiance. You normally have to wait at least 30 minutes to be seated. There&#39;s a very good reason why people wait that long to be seated. <br><br>Based on my experience from yesterday, I had to give them four, instead of five stars. We were told there was a 40 minute wait, which seemed to be pretty accurate. I noticed that they wasted a lot of time, and energy on trying to find 4 or 5 parties who had obviously left. On several occasions they walked through the bar, waiting area, and exterior of the restaurant calling these people&#39;s names. A more efficient way of handling it would be to activate the buzzer, walk through once or twice calling their names, then move on. I felt our server wasn&#39;t very friendly, and a bit slow. The food was very good. I would highly recommend the crab bites, and the Steak Diane With Salmon Combination. The fried zucchini was okay... They were good, just not excellent. I was impressed at how clean the bathroom was, based on how busy they were. <br><br>I would definitely return to this Cheesecake Factory again. I would also recommend people eat there as well.

Ate here 1/27.  Arrived at 11:30 a.m.  it was not particularly busy.  Both  ordered skinny burgers.  Took 40 minutes to get food.  Order was wrong.  My burger was warm, not hot and my fries were cold.  Wont send back food for fear of spit on my meat. Server was nice but not very good. We eat here fairly regularly. Have only one waiter we request NOT to have.  Food is usually good.  This time not so much.  Will give CCF another try. Mess up next time, will not be back. Hope this is a one time,  less than stellar lunch.

It&#39;s been years since I&#39;ve had Cheesecake Factory! Location is great and food is always amazing. I would have gave it 5 stars but the host in the front was a little confused and rude. We were called up and she specifically said my cousin&#39;s name. My cousin went up there and said that&#39;s me. She pretty much looked at her and ignored her then looked at another group. My cousin repeated to her and said &#34;that&#39;s me&#34; then the host asked the other group &#34;are you....&#34; and they said no. She didn&#39;t even say sorry! Haha but I mean, the food and the server made up for everything. We ordered the fried calamari, Nashville hot chicken nuggets, chicken &amp; biscuits and miso salmon. Oh my gosh! I forgot hot delicious the bread was and the food. I was so excited and starving. The food came out SO FAST! I was literally surprised because it was busy. Your entree coming out before your appetizers? LOL I will take that any day! Great portion size and so flavorful. We also ordered a side of ice cream with two slices of fudge cake. I know.. I know!! We didn&#39;t get cheese cake but that&#39;s the beauty of this place.. you can have your favorite cakes if you don&#39;t want the cheese cake :) I can&#39;t wait to go back! I want more of that biscuit. So delicious! Honey, creamy and just everything I want in every bite. Cheers!!
My grandkids and my family all love this place very friendly service and great food. But you have to wait long time . It&#39;s always busy and

We recieved excellent customer service from our server Jasmine. She was always tentative and hospitable during our time at the Cheesecake Factory. The cheesecakes were awesome as always along with my wife&#39;s spaghetti and my California cheesesteak sandwich. The coffee was fresh as well. All in all, it was a pleasant brunch with my wife and Jasmine made it even better

Great waitress Jasmine is very welcoming, knowledgeable,and exceptional in her guest service standards. She is an asset to the company. Great work Jasmine  and the food was amazing as always. Thank you

Last visit here I had the Flying Gorilla at the bar while waiting for a table, Flying Gorilla is a chocolate banana liquor shake.  This drink could be too rich for most people but I like it.  At the bar, I ordered the wasabi ahi.  And I&#39;m so glad it was raw red in the center, the last tuna I had was cooked all the way.<br><br>Other than that, the cheesecakes are stillll good.  I fancy all their cheesecakes and I seriously do not know how you can choose a favorite but if I had to, I&#39;d go with the peanut butter cup fudge cheesecake.  I don&#39;t care about breaking out and getting pimples from eating it but come&#39;onnnn, cheesecake with reeses pb cup and butterfingers!
Look at the forks they gave us! Really?? YUCK. Make sure your utensils are clean before you use them.

I was very disappointed with this location. It used to be my favorite but after using a gift card there it has completely turned me off.<br>It is not the closest location to me but I enjoy this area so I placed an order online for pickup.<br>I used a gift card that I had and everything seemed to be fine. <br>The wait was pretty long but since it was around 6 pm on a Friday that was to be expected.<br>When I finally got to the counter they repeated my order to me correctly. I know I should have checked but when they repeated it to me exactly as I ordered I assumed it was correct.<br>When I got home I found that my entire order was wrong. I figured I would just pick around what I didn&#39;t like. However, the entire thing was inedible. I decided to call back to see if I could get a discount at least. When I spoke to a manger he was very friendly and insisted that he would refund the entire meal. I told him that was unnecessary because I wasn&#39;t going to go back. I was just hoping for a discount. He said that no he would refund the whole thing if I would email pictures. I did. And then never heard back from him again.<br>I emailed 2 more times and instead of honoring the manager&#39;s word I was asked to call another manager and talk about this situation.<br>I will never recommend this location to anyone and would never believe what any of the managers say.
Server, Heather L. Is the kind of server you want. Friendly, knowledgeable, courteous and attentive. She checked on us frequently without hovering. Most satisfied visit to this location!

This Cheesecake Factory has better service than most. As far as food goes, you always know what to expect with Cheesecake Factory. Huge portions, salty, comfort food heaven. Great desserts, I love the carrot cake cheesecake personally. <br><br>The cocktails are a bit lackluster, but that can be expected for a chain. They don&#39;t taste bad, they&#39;re just all very sweet and don&#39;t seem too strong. I generally stick to wine when I come in. <br><br>Favorite dish is the miso salmon!!

Normal rush hour you&#39;d think you are going to wait. .Got seated very quickly. The server was very attentive to drink refills, questions, and suggestions. Was very impressed with the food. The lunch prices reasonable. Made for a great day.

Ordered dinner yesterday from the Boca Park location in Las Vegas, using curbside pickup. The link didn&#39;t work as I tried to enter &#34;FREESLICE&#34;. The young girl that brought out my food went to let the mgr know the link didn&#39;t work, he sent her out saying we needed to spend $30 or more (she came back outside, I showed her, she went and told him I did, then the mgr sent her BACK outside and said it had to be WITHOUT tax (which I spent more than $30 without tax), she went back and told him, then he sent her BACK out and said that special expired...I sent her BACK with a screenshot saying it was extended until July 17.  Then then he came out and wanted me to PROVE to him that the link was t working...and act like I was placing ANOTHER order (a fake order so he could see it wasn&#39;t working). After going back and forth I FINALLY got my free cheesecake and a cold meal by the time I got home. I WILL NEVER order from this place again! HORRIBLE customer service!

Came in for a quick lunch. Interior is very spacious, lots of booths and seats, along with a bar. Also has a restroom too! Chris was our server and he was very friendly and funny. Overall, awesome food and service! I got the Renee Lunch Special (Chicken Almond Salad Sandwhich + House Salad + Mexican Chili Soup) and it was a pretty big portion! Very satisfied, will be back soon!

Husband and I went to happy hour st the Cheesecake Factory In Summerlin. Happy Hour is from 4 to 6. We had taquitos, samosas and crab dip. All were very good but I loved the samosas best. Our waiter was very friendly.

It has been years since my husband and I had dined at a Cheesecake Factory. My brother is a restaurant manager for North Italia. Our family has always had strong bloodlines when it comes to the restaurant business and hospitality, going back to our grandparents owning and operating their own restaurant successfully for more than 30 years. With the current ownership of North Italia switching over to Cheesecake Factory, and the praise from my brother on Cheesecake factory&#39;s standard for hospitality we thought it was a great time for us to go back again after all these years. We were celebrating our 4 year anniversary and I really wanted to make it special for my Husband. I made the reservation a week in advance and put in the reservation notes that we were celebrating our anniversary and I would love to do something special for my husband. We arrived to the restaurant 10 min early for our reservation. The host asked us to wait because our reservation was for 5:00. No problem. Four parties walked in after we had checked in and were all seated fairly quickly, almost instantly. So I rechecked in with the host asking how it was going for our table, and her response was they were waiting for the 5:00 server to come on so we could have a quieter table. No problem. I reminded the host that it was our anniversary and I wanted to try and do something special for my husband. She said no problem she would let the server know. We were sat not to long after and honestly had a great dinning experience and great service from our server, until it came to the end of the experience. I tried to remind the server, without giving it away, that I wanted to do something special for our anniversary, something as simple as a candle or two so I could tell my husband happy anniversary and that i loved him. No acknowledgement, no awareness to what I was trying to inform him, deserts hit the table normally, no candles, nothing special. We enjoyed our deserts completely before the server came back to ask how they were. At this point I was a little heart broken and had told my husband my original plan. After knowing everything, he himself was heart broken for me and felt he should inform the server about it. The server said he was sorry he didn&#39;t know that I was our anniversary and then lit his lighter and said happy anniversary to us... Still not feeling they understand how much they let us down we decided to just let the manager know about the poor experience. After explaining everything to her she simply responded I&#39;m sorry that happened and went on with her night, no real sorrow, no sort of recovery, no accountability. I&#39;m not one to drop names as I feel dinning experiences come from the whole restaurant team from front to back of house. We were not looking for any compensation when it came to the bill, but to explain to multiple people about how the experience went, and to have to pay $130 tab for the two of us just kind of added to the disappointment. We are not foodies, we don&#39;t not personally work in the food and beverage industry, but growing up with my brother and his passion for hospitality and making experiences for his guests when they come into his restaurant, this was a definite let down.

Im definitely not a regular of the cheesecake factory, but this was an occasion with my girlfriend&#39;s parents. The food was ok, i ordered a well done burger and it was very pink, which is ok and why i ordered it well done, but if i was expecting well done i would have been upset. <br>Heather (our waitress) was great! She is the only reason i put 4 stars instead of 3. Very communicative and knowledgeable about the menu. We had a special needs adult at the table and she wasnt fazed and handled him and his order perfectly.

Awesome food which is expected from any location of this restaurant. I come here often for special occasions to get pasta and my favorite cheesecake, if you don&#39;t mind horrible service then it&#39;s ok!<br>Every visit I have here is unpleasant but if the food wasn&#39;t so good then I wouldn&#39;t come back. Staff is on their phones. Servers are very slow and unattentive. Hosts don&#39;t greet or seem friendly even on busy weekend evenings. For a higher up restaurant in a nice location you would expect more. But on the plus side the bread, food, and cheesecake = heaven!

Thank you Jessica and Latrice for taking care of me and my entire squad of 25. You both are super amazing! We will definitely be back to see you ladies again. I am going to let all my colleagues know when they are up in the neighborhood to go see you ladies. Much love from the Diaz Family #IslandStyle.
Thank you Marie for taking care of us for Dianes Birthday Dinner! All of us including Grandkids had a

I like cheesecake so this place is perfect for me although the last time I went there and I got food for takeout it was not the same consistency as my dining in experience which Agitated me a little bit and that&#39;s why gave him three stars because I believe if you&#39;re going to turn out a phenomenal product it shouldn&#39;t be any less just because it&#39;s going through takeout

Usually don&#39;t bother leaving bad reviews but I was so frustrated with this place that I had to vent...today it was my wife&#39;s birthday and Father&#39;s Day so we thought about about just ordering food and enjoy the day without having to cook. I knew it was going to be busy so placed my order online at 2:00pm for a 6:00pm pick up. Just a couple of entrees, kids meal,a couple of cheesecakes...nothing big. I live in Centennial Hills so I leave my house around 5:30pm to be on time, get there a little before 6 and I can see a line of people outside all the way around the building. Cars parked everywhere as well so I had to park at the parking structure East of the restaurant. I waited for the text from them as indicated on the pick up instructions but after waiting for 25 minutes I decided to go inside and inquire about my order. The girl taking reservations at the entrance tells me that I have to get in line to pick up my order. I took me another 35 minutes to finally reach the desk so I&#39;ve been there almost an hour by now. Once I talk to the girl about my order she tells me that it&#39;s going to take another hour to an hour and forty five minutes!! I was dumbfounded.... i ask to speak to a manager and after waiting for him for another 10 minutes he tells me that unfortunately it&#39;s a very busy day. My choices are to just go home and they will credit my paid order or wait for an hour and 45 minutes for my order....I decided to just leave empty handed and frustrated like never before. Cheesecake Factory is not a new restaurant, I&#39;m sure they are very good at dealing with big crowds since every time that we go there it&#39;s busy how they don&#39;t prepare for a day like Father&#39;s Day?? The part that I&#39;m most frustrated about is the nonchalant attitude of the management....they told me pretty much I&#39;m s#%&amp; out of luck. What do I have to do next time ( it won&#39;t be one) but for someone else placing and order online they have to specify a time 2 hours before the time they want the order just so it will be actually on time??? Never seen that before. Anyway, I&#39;m back at my house 2 hours later with nothing but a sorry better luck next time. There won&#39;t be one.

This has been me and my best friends spot to go every year for our Christmas exchange. During holidays and dinner you can almost guarantee you&#39;ll be waiting for a little bit. <br><br>The service is okay. Sometimes it&#39;s great and other times your server is no where to be found ,but with the high amount of traffic and the numerous times I&#39;ve been back it&#39;s safe to say it&#39;s good enough service to keep people coming back. <br><br>I usually get the chicken crusted Romano, but have tried numerous things on their menu from the miso salmon to their many cheesecakes. The portions are pretty big because every time I dine here I always have to ask for a to go box.
No complaints with their cheesecakes but i dont know why the food always disappoints me no matter what  I order from different locations...

Very slow service which I understand when their busy but they&#39;re at half capacity and it&#39;s not busy. We did not receive bread for our table until after drinks were given and we had to ask for it. Waitress seemed like she didn&#39;t care about service, she gave recommendations that were okay. It took at least 25 minutes for the food to come out and it was super cold like it had been sitting on a tray in open air. Also, We requested medium rare for the steak and got a well-done steak which was cold as well, probably from resting so long... we told our waitress and she took the plate saying they will make us a new one. Another 25 minutes goes by and they bring out another plate so we decide to have it boxed to go home.(when we got home we noticed it was the same meat because the steak pieces had a bite out of it that we had already taken) Waitress agreed to take it off the bill but never did and wasn&#39;t helpful along with the manager who seemed to walk around doing nothing. Not even stopping to ask tables if everything is ok with their meals, it&#39;s sad. Poor management, poor staff, and poor service first and last time at cheese cake factory.
Go to Henderson location if you want a pleasant dining Everyone is much friendlier and more efficient.

Delicious late meal (7pm) &amp; thankfully there was no waiting line. Not the most convenient location in Las Vegas, but it was the only one on the way home from the airport (Caesar Palace requires you to pay for parking, so that was out of the question)

Who can say no to Cheesecake Factory? Their food is always good.<br><br>I haven&#39;t dine at this location for a good 2 to 3 years, and they now need a major update of the venue. The tables were showing their age, the booths have cracks in them. I hope the management sees this review and put it into consideration to remodel the venue.<br><br>Food wise, it&#39;s the good ol&#39; Cheesecake Factory, can it ever go wrong?

Great meal and nice location.<br>We ordered the following; Calamari, Thai chicken wraps, Sheila&#39;s salad, and we both had the Shepherds Pie. All of the food was on point in flavor.<br>Very large portions so lots of leftovers for lunch for the next couple days.<br><br>A large party of 25 people was seated next to us so service went downhill and no dessert menu was offered. It was my birthday celebration and we couldn&#39;t wait anymore as our waiter was busy taking dinner orders so we packed up the leftovers and just left.

Made a yelp account just to tell you guys how amazing my server Jaimee was ! She checked on me constantly to make sure everything was good, my friend and I had a great date night because of her ! Request her as a server and you will not regret it !
Jamiee was my server tonight, and she did a phenomenal job! She was very attentive and made sure I was having an absolute great dining experience! Definitely going to request her next time !!

So disappointed service was bad food was horrible didn&#39;t even have items on the menu  the waitress left us sitting at the table for over 20 mins before she even came to the table after this experience I will never give this place another dollar

I always have a great experience here. Every server is unique in h/er own way, yet they all deliver great service.<br><br>I love coming here for salads, as they&#39;re &#34;healthy&#34; enough, yet portioned enough not to leave hungry.<br><br>Our server was great and very accommodating. Even once we got the check, he brought us refills to-go.

The Cheesecake Factory has an awesome happy hour. The menu is limited which is usually the case for happy hour but the choices are really good. Oh and the drinks....Really good. There were three of us so we decided we&#39;d order three appetizers between us. We got cheeseburger sliders, nachos, and Vietnamese shrimp spring rolls. Everything was delicious and our waitress also brought us out the signature bread and butter. So good. For drinks we had mojitos and Long Island ice teas. Both delicious. Atmosphere is great. I love your happy hour Cheesecake Factory. Thanks for a great experience.

Food is always pretty good and obviously nothing beats the cheesecakes. What always ruins it for us is the dirty tables, booths, super filthy utensils, oily plates. Not to mention the service almost always lags, even when it&#39;s quiet in the restaurant. We always have to ask for water refills and ask numerous times for condiments.

What a wonderful dining experience  here and our server was great. Unfortunately my meal was just subpar. I had ordered fish &amp; chips and the fish was soggy wish they were crunchier... my birthday cheesecake was AWESOME!!

This place amazes me, they are usually so busy, timing is very important, you come at just the right time and they get you in and taken care of! <br><br>Usually we can wait less than 10-15 minutes for a table, by the time we leave it&#39;s a mad house. Waiting times up to 45 minutes. We learned to come just before the rush or come late, after the crowds, either way, service is still good!<br><br>We never feel rushed, our service is always great and the food is consistent. Love the +30 cheesecakes to choose from. Be it a holiday, weekend, or weekday, they really make you feel satisfied.<br><br>My favorite new dish this time was the soy glazed edamame! It&#39;s spicy, it&#39;s slighty sweet, it&#39;s warm and very good!
Worst Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve ever been to. Used to be a great place to eat. We waited 45 minutes after ordering for our food to come. And then the food was not good. Sorry we waited.

We had a really nice, quiet dinner after a night out with friends. It was around 1130/12. Our server was Jessica, super sweet. <br>When leaving we were really thrown off at the new lounge next door, &#34;the mixx&#34;.  It was super loud, tons of people outside yelling and singing. Not a good look for boca park.
You can&#39;t really mess up wine &amp; bartenders friendly, but we kept getting a whiff of a dirty sink smell that made our visit shorter.  Love the location.
Food was good. But our waiter overcharged our card and gave himself a bigger tip plus took the rest of our gift card

I would give 5 stars if you didn&#39;t have to wait so long to get a waiter or to even order more things. Other than that I can&#39;t complain this location has a beautiful outdoor patio view and of course amazing food.

Upon arrival, I informed the hostess that we were celebrating our 10 year anniversary. I picked out a cheesecake and the hostess said that they would decorate the plate and send it out with a candle at the end of our meal. She said she would pass the message along to the server. I saw her write everything down.<br><br>The server was friendly and greeted us in a timely manner. He went over the soup of the day as well as daily specials. We ordered the Eggroll sampler, all the egg rolls were greasy and dripping with oil. The chicken madeira was excellent as usual. And the herb crusted salmon was okay. <br><br>When we were full, the server was kind enough to pack our food for us, but he failed to crumb the table and left our dirty silverware and small plates in the middle of the table. I even moved everything to the middle of the table so it would be easy for him to pick up because I knew he would be bringing our cheesecake out and I wanted to take photos. At the end of lunch, the server handed us dessert menus, I gave him the eye. He said &#39;I got it&#39;... and brought a cheap birthday sundae with pure whip cream. He put it right in the middle of all the dirty dishes. That really ruined it for me. The Cheesecake Factory is my FAVORITE RESTAURANT.. or should I say WAS. To be honest, the service 15 years ago was significantly better than the service I&#39;ve received within these past few years.. especially at the Summerlin location. How can you drop dessert on a table with dirty plates and food crumbs everywhere?? I&#39;d like to add that it was not even busy. And where was the cheesecake I preordered that the hostess said they were going to decorate for our special occasion?<br><br>I have over 20 years of restaurant/hospitality experience, so yes! I am a restaurant/service snob! So maybe my service expectations are too high.. but I wouldn&#39;t expect anything else from the Cheesecake Factory. I am truly disappointed in my recent experiences with your establishment. A few years ago a  server refilled my water with another water cup saying she couldn&#39;t find any water pitchers anywhere... only at the Summerlin location I get this kind of service!

Terrible service! Ordered pickup, parked called curb side 3 times to ask for them to bring out my order as per advertised after waiting 15 mins no one ever came out so I decided to go inside to pick up the order which was sitting right there ready to go! Don&#39;t advertise a service you can&#39;t uphold to.
I love eggplant parmigiana sandwiches... it&#39;s not on the menu but you can ask them to make it. I&#39;ve had it twice here. The bread is delicious and sandwich is put together very nicely.

Horrible Management! I ordered curbside delivery at 3:58pm for a 5:45pm pick up on 5/10/2020. I arrived at 5:46pm and was told to wait in the parking lot. After waiting for an hour I asked if they forgot me. I was told it was a 2 hour delay. I asked them why are they just telling me this now. Poor management. I knew it was mothers day, but that wasn&#39;t my complaint. My complaint was why they couldn&#39;t they tell me this before I drove there or at least when I arrived. They have a text system and they easily could have text or called everyone telling them they are 4 hours behind. After waiting over an hour I cancelled my order. Mothers day ruined as it was a gift for my mom. Today I have no credit back on my gift card and my credit card was charged. UPDATE: It&#39;s May 13, 2020. Still no response from Cheesecake Factory about my refund. UPDATE: May 14, 2020 still no refund. Spent an hour on phone this morning calling restaurant. No answer or picks up and hangs up. Finally got corporate customer service who gave me a gift card credit. Really don&#39;t want gift cards but I don&#39;t have weeks of my time to chase them around for a simple refund.
Busy and chaotic. Food is always good here but service and state of order of this place makes me not wanna eat here.
Love the variety. If you are with a group of people who are unsure what they are in the mood for, go here. Their menu pretty much has something for everyone.

One of my favorite places to eat at. I&#39;ve never had a bad experience at The Cheesecake Factory. Even though they have a vast selection to choose from in the enormous menu, everything is always delicious. My favorite plate is the jambalaya cajun pasta and for dessert, the turtle cheesecake along with the raspberry lemonade. <br><br>Whether you&#39;re just having brunch or celebrating a special occasion, they&#39;re perfect for anytime. Their service is always spot on.

Ladies and Gents,<br><br>The Cheesecake Factory has fallen to a very low point! This is one of my favorite places and sharing this story is disappointing but necessary. <br><br>A friend and I had lunch there Super Bowl Sunday and were excited to enjoy the game. She ordered a salad and I ordered the Pasta Napoletana....BIG MISTAKE! I enjoyed the meal only to get home and suffer a night of hell!! The undercooked pork sent me to the bathroom where I remained for hours, throwing up and ultimately becoming completely dehydrated.<br><br>In an effort to make management aware, I called the Rampart location and spoke to the manager. Right away, I knew this was a very young and inexperienced person, he was defensive and said that I was the only person to complain. This child concluded the conversation by stating that the Corporate Office would contact me. That was days ago..... I&#39;m not holding my breath.<br><br>The most frustrating part is that my call to the restaurant WAS NOT to complain, but to give management a heads up so that they could check their ingredients and mention this incident to staff in the hopes of preventing a reoccurrence. They basically blew me off, so they clearly don&#39;t give a damn about your health either. Word to the wise..... you&#39;ve been warned.

Sad to give this place such low rating especially when this was our go to restaurant to celebrate birthdays, special occasions, or just wanted to have a great meal. Our server, Michael Mayes was horrible. Like beyond, BEYOND horrible. Everything was horrible about him. I don&#39;t have anything positive to say. From the very beginning we had to ask him for bread... and that seemed like a battle when asking him, no refills on our drinks, forgot the kids milk, our food order came out wrong because he didn&#39;t take note of our modifications with 2 entrees, never came back to see if the food had been fixed correctly (it was NOT, but again ... didn&#39;t want to put up a battle with Michael) plus he never came back. We had to flag a few guys to &#34;GRAB OUR SERVER&#34; and when he finally came he says &#34;something going on&#34; ... ummmmm yes WE NEED THE CHECK!!!!!  Never mind the refills and nevermind the tip from us. This guy is extremely unhappy here and needs to be let go asap! When I talked to the manager after we had gotten up, she said that he&#39;s had complaints before and it wasn&#39;t the first. What a shame. The only fixing Cheesecake factory can do is to let him go. His attitude and service ruined a birthday!

Called to make a reservation. Got put on hold for 5 minutes, only to have someone pick up the phone again and when I asked to make a reservation they said they do not do reservations. Why put me on hold when you do not even do reservations in the first place?
Two words: Shrimp Scampi. It is amazing! It was not what I was expecting. The sauce was awesome and the shrimp were nicely sized. Their menu is huge, so save some time and order the scampi.

This place is overrated, giving two star for good service but the food are horrible. The restaurant looks so fancy, but come on make atleast the food taste better. I&#39;m not sure if I&#39;m going to that place again.

Pecan pumpkin cheesecake is good but I prefer the regular pumpkin cheesecake! The chicken Bellagio is amazing but big enough for 3-4 meals. Seriously my new fav! We ordered the sangria and the cucumber mojito, the bartender was off his game tonight. Our drinks were so sloppy and soaked on the bottom of the glass.

I called to place an order for pick up. A person named Hanna answer the phone  and as soon as I said I&#39;d like to please place an order to be picked up she nimmediately put me on hold. I was on hold for over five minutes and called back to tell her that I have been put on hold for over five minutes and no one let me know anything. She was very unprofessional and rude, so we decided not to eat there tonight and I thought it be a good idea to write a review.It&#39;s  not OK to treat a wonderful customer like they are an inconvenience . It&#39;s sad because we&#39;ve eaten at this Cheesecake a lot and we&#39;ve always had great service, however,  whoever is hiring people need to maybe hire a different person other than Hannah because it&#39;s not a nice experience for customers who pay good money to be customers to be treated poorly when calling to make a pick up order.
Good restaurant ! Clean and employees very professional.<br>Just I would taste the whipped cream with my dessert but I think she has forgotten lol

My favorite go to restaurant when my husband and I were just dating. Ambience is okay, staff and service were not a problem during our visits. Their menu is tremendous, 100+ items  to choose from. From salads to burgers, pastas, and more. There is something for everyone vegan or not! I have probably tried almost every cheesecake on their menu except the key lime, not a fan! Carrot cake is perfect, not too sweet and just enough flavor and ingredients. The white chocolate rasberry cheesecake is our fave. Oreo like crust and curled white chocolate pieces on the sides with a hint of swirled in rasberry puree. Fried calamari is an appetizer to order. Lightly battered, perfectly seasoned and crisp! It&#39;s served with a garlic aioli like sauce and cocktail sauce. <br><br>List of our favorites...<br>Chicken Bellagio- crispy coated chicken breasts over basil pasta and parmesan cream sauce topped with arugula and prosciutto. <br><br>Steak diane and Shrimp scampi- We enjoy our steak medium well. Very amazing flavor of marinated steak and shrimp. Mash potatoes were creamy and perfectly paired with grilled asparagus. Perfect all the time, won&#39;t disappoint!<br><br>Avocado egg rolls appetizer- The dipping sauce for this egg roll is what makes this soo tasty. It has a taste of honey, soy sauce and ginger.

Normally I don&#39;t review chain eateries but I&#39;m feeling inspired after tonight&#39;s takeaway dinner.<br><br>It&#39;s all too easy for National chains to slip into mediocrity (my fave eatery phrase). Many start with ideals of quality, sourcing, and customer care, and get shoddy over the years. Not so for the Cheesecake Factory. Year after year, ingredient quality, service and food prep stay at a superb level.<br><br>Tonight: Sheila&#39;s chicken and avocado salad. The greens were super-fresh and included chicory, arugula, and baby spinach. Crispy won-tons (I removed mine), cashews, moist breast slices, perfectly ripe avo&#39;s, and a few other items rounded things off. As a carb-conscious diner with a healthy appetite, this dish was most satisfying.<br><br>In the past, I&#39;ve also enjoyed the Asian chicken salad, grilled salmon with mashed (ok, it was a carb-splurge day ;) and 3-4 other dishes I can&#39;t recall.<br><br>Their managers are even gracious if there&#39;s ever an issue.<br><br>My &#34;only&#34; humorous-complaint is their menu listing several pages of &#34;specialties&#34;. If everything is &#34;special&#34;, then nothing is. But this is a trivial thing. Their food rocks!

Just plain bs that this is the quality piece of cake you get for 8.00. The size is inconsistent it&#39;s absolutely crazy to me. <br>I understand it can be busy at times however I&#39;d rather wait a few more minutes to get a better cut piece. When the employee was asked why it was so small she said that&#39;s just how it is and shrugged her shoulders. Will not be back.<br><br>Not to mention the piece was half frozen. If I wanted something frozen I would have gone to the grocery store. Unacceptable.
First time to Cheesecake Factory. Food was excellent. Desert even better. Very good service. Great night out.
A great brunch. We had the usual excellent service and quality food at value prices.<br><br>The omelet today was prepared perfectly.<br><br>They help make life a celebration.

Michael our waiter was frickin amazing! From start to finish he gave us 100% wow customer service. He greeted us with such awesome enthusiasm. He was quick with everything we ordered and he made great conversation with us. Table of 6 and handled all of like we are his best friend. 5 stars across the board Michael

Happy hour here is hands down the best Happy Hour during the week!!! My top three appetizers are the Buffalo Blasts which is a best kept secret at this restaurant! Avocado egg rolls are great to share but I&#39;ve been known to keep these all to myself and last but not least the Sweet Corn Tamale Cakes!

My wife and I have noticed the taste of the food deteriorating over the last two times we have visited this location. My wife used to love the shrimp scampi. However, lately the taste has been bland.<br><br>We visited this location a couple days ago.  In order to taste any flavor in our meals we had to heavily salt the food.  This used to be one of my wife&#39;s favorite restaurants.

Honestly, their dining foods are so-so. <br>But all of their cheesecakes are fantastic!<br> My favorite flavor is fresh strawberry cheesecake! <br>It is good to having some date with fiance,family dinner,or brunch with my girlfriends

Worst dining experience ever. After waiting for AN HOUR to get our food we just said forget it and asked for it to go. That process took another 30 minutes. So now we have $125 microwave meals. This was at 2pm on a Wednesday (restaurant empty). Thank you to the manager for reaching out to my wife to mail us a gift card. Hopefully the next visit is better.
Nice place to eat at nice people great restaurants great location and nice area great environment tasty food

5 stars THIS time because Marie C. was the best server we&#39;ve ever had at this location. The food is always great, service always mediocre at best. Marie changed that today and was literally perfect. She gave us the fastest service we&#39;ve ever gotten there. We didn&#39;t have to wait for anything-- drink refills, boxes, the bill, etc. and made sure that we had everything we needed. Will ask for her next time we go. Also, the chicken taquitos on the small plates menu are the best, as well as the buffalo blast appetizer. Both are must-get items. The monte cristo for Sunday brunch never disappoints either.
love the location. very clean,courteous, kind sums it up. We order 3 entrees and 1 appetizer. it is very delicious.

Who isn&#39;t a fan of their cheesecake here ??? Always trying to venture out and trying other flavors but nothing beats the Oreo one at all! Never disappoints! <br><br>I live close by this location and always dine at this location more than any other one. Usually is always steady service, they are usually attentive and get what needs to be done. Only problem is that their staff doesn&#39;t seem too friendly. Although they do get the job done it would be nice to have a few smiles on deck here! Great food! Great atmosphere and great menu variety! At times I get lost in such a big menu but than again it&#39;s nice to come in not knowing what you feel like what you want for dinner or lunch and have the big options they do. Come enjoy the cheesecake it never fails!

Our family loves The Cheesecake Factory. However, this particular location taints their brand. I have come here so many times for family events and despite our hopes the service will get better it never seems to. The knowlege of our server was unacceptable.<br><br>Showed up at 4:15pm on a Wednesday. We were seated within 5 minutes for a party of 6. I went to the Restroom upon arrival and it was a mess. Also there was only 1 stall with toilet paper.<br><br>Drink orders came along and I asked oir server Tara G what they had for tequila. I was told Patron. I asked if there were other silver options and was told no, just Patron. I passed and went to the bar to order instead. Come to find out there was 4 options of silver tequila. Don Julio &amp; Patron being the most expensive naturally. <br><br>We wanted to order appetizer, but after recieving our drinks our waiter took too long to return to our table. We ended up just ordering our entrees.<br><br>I asked if my dish the Diane and Salmon came with asparagas and was told no, so i ordered some on the side. The dish comes out and there is asparagus with it, and a side of asparagas as well [which of course I had to pay extra for]. <br><br>My sister ordered the chinese chicken salad. The salad came dry with no oranges.  I noticed the food runner come out and have a conversation with out waiter where they looked at the food delivered to our table. It seemed as if they realized the wrong salad was delivered, but upon us questioning it we were told no thats what you ordered. At this point we just asked for a side of dressing and oranges.<br><br>For the price and location I honestly would expect better management and training of staff.

I came here 2 days in a row for national cheesecake day and half price cheesecake. I was going to write my review Sunday, but I&#39;m glad I waited because my Sunday experience was HORRIBLE, like 2 star bad, but my Monday experience was great, 5 star great. I averaged them out to give this review. <br><br>Sunday: We came in for cheesecake, but since we had to dine in, we git some breakfast that I didn&#39;t know they served on Sundays. The service we got the whole time was absolutely horrible. There weren&#39;t many people there when we got there so we didn&#39;t wait long to be seated. She brought us water and that was about it. The rest of the time we had to keep flagging her down to get anything from her. It took 15 minutes to get our coffee and actually order our food. Then she never came back. It took 30 minutes before we could flag her down to actually get us some bread that we had to actually ask for when everybody else was just given their bread. She was definitely not off to a good start. She kept going back and forth to the table next to us, giving them stuff and checking on them, but never came to us, unless we actually flagged her down and yelled for her. To me, that&#39;s not acceptable customer service. It almost made us not ever want to come back here. Only reason we came back, was to get more half price cheesecake the next day. We made sure we weren&#39;t going to get her the next day again, by sitting at the bar on Monday.<br><br>Monday: We strictly went to the bar in hopes we&#39;d get better service. We certainly did. We initially came for happy hour drinks and cheesecake, but ended up ordering some appetizers for dinner since the happy hour menu is pretty cheap. Thank god we had good service at the bar or we probably never would&#39;ve went back. Our bartender was always checking on us to see if we needed anything, constantly refilling our drinks, conversating with us, after everybody was taken care of. We even got our bread this time right away and didn&#39;t even have to ask for it. And to top it off, we got great service during happy hour when the whole place was packed and every seat was taken. <br><br>Now, onto the actual food. <br><br>For breakfast, we ordered the fried chicken and waffles Benedict and the chilaquiles carnitas. I really enjoyed the Benedict. It definitely had a unique sweet flavor that I wasn&#39;t expecting, but it was delicious. The carnitas was a bed of tortilla chips with a green chilli pork mix over them. I wasn&#39;t a fan of them, but my boyfriend enjoyed them. We also ordered their new cheesecakes: the celebration cheesecake and the coffee and cream cheesecake. The celebration one wasn&#39;t exactly what I was expecting. It was SUPER sweet. My complaint is that there was very little cheesecake in it. It was almost all cake and a cream mousse stuff. I was hoping it was going to be majority cheesecake, but it wasn&#39;t. I can&#39;t say that is order it again. The coffee and cream one, was very chocolatey with coffee. If you like those two flavors, you&#39;ll like that cheesecake. <br><br>For happy hour, I started off with the JW pink lemonade that was pretty good. We ordered 3 appetizers to share: Vietnamese shrimp summer rolls, factory nachos and the buffalo blasts. They were all great. You won&#39;t be disappointed with any of them. They are pretty big servings so be careful how much you order. We couldn&#39;t even finish the nachos. Then we ordered cheesecake to go because there was no way we had room to eat there. We got the chocolate hazelnut crunch, Chris&#39; outrageous, mango key lime and Reeses peanut butter. I didn&#39;t like Chris&#39; because I don&#39;t like coconut or walnuts, but if you like them and almond joy, you&#39;ll love that one. My boyfriend loved it so much, he ate the whole thing in one sitting. I really enjoyed the other three tho. The hazelnut crunch is really good. The Reeses is really rich, but great if you like chocolate and peanut butter. The mango cheesecake us really tart, but great if you like those flavors.

My first time here and I loved it. They don&#39;t take reservations on Sunday so if you have a big group, get there early. We got there at 1 and at about 2 it really picked up and there was a line. Our food portions were large. Everyone enjoyed their food. The had a veggie burger and a vegan burger and lots of salads, it was the perfect menu! Being plant-based, it was really nice to have so many options for myself. My salad was big enough for two people. A few people ordered cheesecake slices to go. It was our friends birthday and the6 brought her a little treat and sang her a song. It was a lovely experience.
Godiva Chocolate cake. Nuff sed. I eat here a lot and every single time, I MUST HAVE the cake!

I use to work at Boca Park and never ate here, but recently I decided to give it a try... several times. <br><br>The bacon truffle cheese sticks are in my order every single time.<br><br>I&#39;ve tried a couple of different burgers. All were seasoned very well and cooked perfectly.<br><br>Their cheesecake is great, but the best option is the Oreo cheesecake. <br><br>I ordered delivery so I&#39;m not sure what it&#39;s like inside of the restaurant, but I&#39;m sure the food is probably even better without the long ride for delivery.

Ok so this is the first time my wife has ever went to a Cheesecake Factory and I have been many times. I will say this is probably my top 5 worst service place I ever been too. Our server non attentive and some what rude like he was having a bad day or something. Start with my Mojito a regular type. First came out to sweet and seemed like the bartender doesn&#39;t even know how to make a classic mojito. Came back and all he did was put sour mix in it and called it...I&#39;m like are you f***ing kidding me. When I told the server that it&#39;s like all he did is put sour mix he didn&#39;t even muddle the lime and mint leaves with simple syrup and roll the rest of the ice and liquor with soda water...I give a big fat F in Fail! It&#39;s so simple, bartender must be new to bartending. The server didn&#39;t even apologize. I actually told him to taste it and tell me if that taste like a mojito. So I just ordered a beer...the server didn&#39;t even bring us waters when we asked. My wife had to get up find another server to get us water. The food was good I can&#39;t lie about that...then a fly flew into my wife&#39;s drink and we both lost our appetite, looked up and just saw a bunch of flies on the glass that separates the kitchen and dinning room. We pack out food and paid the bill and left...so unhappy and disappointed. I would have given a 0 star if it wasn&#39;t for the other two servers that helped us because our server was no where to be found and the food being good.

Here is my guilty confession, I like Cheesecake Factory! There I said it! <br>I have enjoyed my experiences at everyone that I have gone to.<br>Boston, San Francisco, San Diego and now the one at Boca Park!<br><br>Went in for dinner and was seated right away. <br>After combing through the GIGANTIC menu. and it is! So many tempting options!<br>I decided to go lighter, to save room for the ....you guessed it CHEESECAKE!! Hell YA! Sorry, but here the entree is just an appetizer for desert. <br><br>Ordered the herb crusted salmon, served with fresh mashed potatoes and a few tasteful displayed spears of asparagus. It was really great! Cooked perfectly, light tender and moist. My friend ordered the Louisiana Chicken Pasta (OK, not so light for him, but he loved it!)<br><br>Then we split a Red Velvet cheesecake. OMG...We were in cheesy, frosted, sugary heaven!! SO GOOD! And splitting this giant piece was absolutely the right call!

They reached out to us and made it right. That counts for a lot in my book. We revisited them again and the service wasn&#39;t as hectic and disorganized as before. We were promptly seated and the food was good as usual.<br><br>I only wish they wouldn&#39;t arrange their tables so closely together. People are thrusting butts and crotches in faces everywhere trying to squeeze in. Awkward.

Well! Went to the Cheesecake Factory for my Birthday. As always I have the Chicken Marsala (always is the greatest). Not yesterday. Got one piece of chicken about 2&#34; by 4&#34; and about a pound or more of bow ties. It use to be 3 small pieces of chicken and a nice medium order of bow ties. I was always able to eat the whole meal but yesterday I could not even come close to finishing the bow ties. The chicken went down in 3 fork <br>full. $20.00 Terrible! Wake up!

You can&#39;t go wrong with Cheesecake Factory. This was my first time at this location. We came on a Saturday night and it was packed. We ended up sitting in the bar area to avoid waiting for a table. Although you typically don&#39;t get the best service at the bar tables that was not the case here! Bread was brought out and our orders were taken within minutes of sitting. We ended up ordering 2 glasses of wine, 2 entrees &amp; cheesecake and the total was around 80? which was expected. We specifically came to order the birthday cake cheesecake and were NOT disappointed!! :)
Got the drink &#34;Georgia peach&#34; and I couldn&#39;t be more satisfied on a hot summer day! The food was also amazing, I ordered the steak tacos!

Several weeks ago, our family had dinner at The Cheesecake Factory on Rampart. It is a familiar place that we can go because of the variety of foods. No one in the family can go wrong with the amount of choices they offer, and of course, there is cheesecake for dessert! <br><br>Our waiter took an extraordinarily long time to take our drink order &amp; to bring bread &amp; butter. After we gave him the drink order, we still waited an extraordinarily long time just to get drinks, and still had to remind him of a beer that we ordered. When salad came, there was a toothpick in my son&#39;s salad. Had the toothpick got into his mouth, he could have choked, cut his mouth, or any number of things. One of the side dishes we ordered didn&#39;t come with our order &amp; arrived much later. Overall, it was one of the worst experiences I have had at The Cheesecake Factory. Be forewarned about this location. Very disappointing!

No respect for delivery orders. This would be our second order with this location. Never expect such bad service from a place with such a great reputation. Wilted salad, hard bread and meals missing items. The Cook does not follow orders or special requests so don&#39;t bother adding any. Will send food through delivery that would never be acceptable quality if eating in. Not sure which of the kitchen staff was lazy on our order but thanks for ruining the once good thoughts we had about Cheesecake Factory

On August 6th, at around 6 PM a party of 5 arrived and were immediately seated in a coveted booth set up. They were instantly greeted by a young in-his-30&#39;s male waiter (I can&#39;t remember his name but I can tell you he has private small gym stickers on his ordering book and was wearing a Darth Vader tie.) Bread was delivered. And this is when it started to get interesting...<br>One of the party members was a known picky person. She frequents this establishment and has had no problems ordering her usual request in the past. <br>Fast forward to post ordering meal delivery. Corn tamales gluten free ON POINT! A salad entree arrived and a party member politely stated that the dressing order on the side is not present. Now this is where I need to tell you how Cheesecake operates: Your your food is not delivered by the waiter it is delivered by someone else. And a majority of your service is delivered by some random person. The only time you see your waiter is when they decide to come back and check on you. It took 15 minutes to get that dressing nectar. The picky person&#39;s entrée was completely wrong. She was not happy. After a weird conversation with the waiter - he actually stated out of the 30 page menu that no chicken breast existed in the building...a manager became involved and in 5 minutes the glorious food arrived! Meanwhile a party member still had not received his SPAGHETTI AND MEATBALLS. This member had the easiest order and it came out 10 minutes after everyone including the totally messed up redone entree did. Fast forward to dessert ordering, it was asked to be to go it came back on a plate about 10 minutes later it arrived in a to go container. Whatever that was OK because it took us about 10 minutes to get the bill situated. I forgot to tell you that in the middle of dinner two of the party members asked for extra sauce and we got the bill we noticed that we were charged four dollars for a little gravy boat of sauce (note in the past I have never been charged for extra sauce so this came as a real shock.) My sister was charge for an extra side of potatoes that never was ordered (she asked for double mashed instead of the vegetable.) All of these bogus charges were removed and we all learned a valuable lesson: never to order extra sauce at Cheesecake Factory ever again. Because of the way everything ended out in the end (bill rightfully modified and foods delivered as ordered - btw the side of mashed and two sauces dropped the bill FIFTEEN DOLLARS!) I give this place three stars but overall I am disappointed with what Cheesecake Factory has become. I won&#39;t be returning anytime soon. Shout out to management for making it all happen ON MY BIRTHDAY!

Restaurants are literally run by humans and humans are well... human. The food is always pretty consistent, what I don&#39;t understand is how there is no manager presence on the floor. Our ticket time for our entree was clearly in the 45 min zone and no manager in site. Problems can be mitigated by addressing them head on and seeking resolution. Maybe our server forgot to put in our order, but why not a manger touching tables and being visible? You know it&#39;s a problem when our server asked us if we would like dessert and we said not if it takes as long as our entree, and she replied &#34; I have no control of the kitchen, but I can control dessert better&#34; ya.... no thank you. Again, a manager presence or a table touch could have made all the difference. Please use this as a teaching moment for staff. Our bill was Sunday around 230p. We had a traditional burger, avocado rolls, and a spicy ceaser salad, and an ice tea. Check the ticket times.

I came here to try the celebration cheesecake! I&#39;ve had my eye on it for a while and it exceeded my expectations and beyond! The cheesecake tasted like ice cream that never melted. I hope this cheesecake stays on the menu and will be back for more.

I haven&#39;t been to a Cheesecake Factory in like three years, so my roommate and I decided to break the three-year-long hiatus and try it out for dinner once again.<br><br>We were seated fairly quickly despite it being a busy weekend night and having no call-ahead for a table.<br><br>They had a fancy interior, the dining room was dimly lit (just like all Cheesecake Factories), and the noise level was a little louder than average (it can get quite noisy). <br><br>As for the food, we started off with the avocado egg rolls. It may sound weird, but they&#39;re actually SO GOOD. Who would&#39;ve ever thought that this unique twist on egg rolls could be so delicious? It&#39;s fried in an egg roll wrap stuffed with avocados, sun-dried tomatoes, onions, and cilantro.  A must-try for avocado aficionados (or for those who are tired of the standard guacamole)! The sauce it came with was sweet; it was the perfect pairing with the egg rolls. Let this appetizer satisfy your tastebuds with its Avocado-ey goodness!<br><br>My main entree was the Louisiana chicken pasta. It had Parmesan crusted chicken (the breading was crunchy and the chicken was juicy!) over farfalle pasta with a sauce that has a bit of a spicy kick to it. This is seriously some good pasta. If you want something that&#39;s super filling, I&#39;d go the pasta route.<br><br>Presentation of the food could&#39;ve been a little bit better, but the food was great nonetheless. <br><br>Overall, I was pleasantly surprised at how good everything was from what I remember. The Cheesecake Factory is probably the best option if you don&#39;t want to go anywhere super fancy for dinner.

The Cheesecake Factory has always been a staple in my wife and I&#39;s dining out habits. However, the last time we went to dinner we had a really disappointing experience. We brought her family that were in town from Germany so that they could finally experience this Cheesecake Factory place we tell them about somewhat frequently.<br><br>To start, our waiter was the definition of a tool. I hate to be mean, but his name might as well have been Tony tough nuts. He tried to be nice, but the vibe from him just was not good. What&#39;s worse is he forgot drinks for 15 minutes at a time, and would remember when I asked about them. He took FOREVER to take our initial order, despite me asking and him walking past quite a few times. Just in general, bad vibe.<br><br>Then comes the food. Service is forgivable when the food is amazing. This time, it was not. We decided to get the Guacamole since we recently had some at El Dorado and we were craving some again. They brought it to the table, and we quickly realized that it was HUGE chunks of Avocado, and not ripe avocado at that. It was hard and stringy. So I asked the waiter to send it back since, ya know, we couldn&#39;t even dip chips in it because it was like half an avocado at a time.<br><br>He brings it back, and says...yeah just so you know that&#39;s how we do the guacamole now, so if you want it more mashed up you have to specify. REALLY?! It&#39;s a DIP, not pieces of apple you&#39;re eating. The thing is, with this guy, he could have been making it up since he was that type of person. he also tried to blame the bar on the drinks, then clearly went and put it in the computer since he forgot (we could see the bar and the computer right next to us).<br><br>Anyway, my four cheese pasta came out luke warm and cold on the outsides, but by this point I said screw it, I ate some of it and too the rest home to heat up the next day. <br><br>Overall it was a bad experience, and I doubt we&#39;ll be back anytime soon. Gordon Biersch is always consistent for us, as is Brio, so we&#39;ll probably just go there.

It seems like the people working here hate their jobs and are not very interested in doing them.  Every time I come I have to wait for them to get the only apparent person in the restaurant that is capable of working the to go register.  I am always shocked that no one else can take payment for a to go order - and then shocked again this person who can is always missing for 10-15 min somehow.  Annnnnnd when they have to go see if my food is done I get told how it just came up and when I check it - it seems like it&#39;s been sitting for at least the 15 min I had to wait for them to find her.   Good luck with this! The food is fine - the place is fine - but I feel like the cost should warrant something a little better than fine.

I really like this place. I have found the food to be consistently good.  Some of my favorites are the Caesar Salad, BBQ Ranch Chicken Salad and Chicken Piccata . I get takeout here often and sometimes my husband and I go here for lunch or dinner (he loves the Chicken Bellagio). I gave it four stars because some times the takeout can take a while if they are super busy and the service can really depend on your server if your dining in. It would be great if they opened another one in the area. I think part of their challenge is they get so slammed - open one in the Lone Mountain area!!! But seriously, I have found them to have good food and not be outrageously over priced there is a lot to be said for that.

I&#39;ve been coming to this location for years and stopped in today for lunch. We had the best service with Danielle! She was amazing! The habachi steak and carne Asada steaks were wonderful. Such a great lunch spot.
Usually very good! My steak was over cooked, and they put the wrong sauce on it. I ordered a brownie sundae and just got 2 scoops of ice cream and some nuts! What? Lol

Do not waste your time on curbside to go unless you have an hour to spare. It is difficult to order as it appears only one person in the restaurant can take curbside delivery orders.  Then all food is not ready at appointed time and another 20 minutes later the wrong beverage is delivered and in 2 small containers as out of regular sized containers.  By now the food is cold.  <br>A manager is suppose to come over and yet no one is here. <br>What has happened to Cheesecake Factory?  It use to be top notch.

Been here 3 more times after my last review. I swear this place is perfect! Food has been amazing and the service is always outstanding. Keep up the greatness y&#39;all! This is my favorite location ever. Parking lot is still crowded but for good reason. A++

We like to come to Cheese Cake Factory on our cheat days. Nothing better than enjoying a large portion entree and a sweet cheesecake for dinner.  <br>Today we came in and were served by Isaiah. What an amazing server! He was very energetic and paid attention to small details that separate good servers from superior servers. The service staff here at the Boca Park location is 90% great but today was extraordinary. Even after our server got sat another table after us and a party of 10 at the same time, our experience was never sacrificed. Our drinks were never empty, our order came out prompt and we were never in need of anything. <br>Tonight we ordered iced green tea with mint, the chicken marsala and chipotle chicken pasta but we substituted the pasta for mashed potatoes. And for dessert we shared a lemon, strawberry cheesecake. <br>Chicken marsala is 2 thin pieces of chicken in a homemade marsala sauce with a generous portion of mushrooms. This is served on a bed of bow tie pasta. The chipotle chicken pasta is a flavorful dish with asparagus, peas and chicken in a warm chipotle sauce. It&#39;s not spicy and does not lack in flavor. The portion of chicken is on the lighter side though. All entrees are served with both sourdough and wheat bread with butter at the beginning of your meal too.<br>There are so many desserts to choose from but tonight we went with one on the fruity side. It wasn&#39;t too sweet or too tart. I was actually surprised how balanced the flavors were.

We went for lunch yesterday and it was truly a disappointing experience. <br><br>I had a lunch portion of one of the pastas. There was three small pieces of chicken over powered by the mushrooms which tasted a little burnt.  The lunch portion appears to be around half the size for almost the full price. The portion size wasn&#39;t an issue since the food was not palatable. It wasn&#39;t a good value at all. <br><br>My wife got a salad off the new light menu and it was basically just lots of lettuce. <br><br>Service was slow. We had to ask for refills many times and were never offered a refill unless we asked.

It&#39;s hard to believe that a company as large &amp; well known as Cheesecake Factory would allow their restaurants to be Deceitful, Dishonest and Cheat their loyal customers! <br><br>See my posted photo of receipt from my last visit to Cheesecake Factory, Boca Park location.<br><br>Though it&#39;s only a suggested gratuity, they Deceitfully suggest you tip on the taxed amount.<br><br>Almost every other restaurants I visit only suggest tip on actual food &amp; beverages as it&#39;s supposed to be.<br><br>I usually tip 22 - 25% of amount &amp; sometimes glance at these numbers to help determine my tipping amount.<br><br>I noticed this before but now have to speak out because of continued use of this misleading practice.<br><br>If this happens to you Yelpers at other Cheesecake locations, please post a review to warn others of the Dishonest Billing practice being used by Cheesecake Factory!<br><br>5 Stars for Food<br>4.5 Stars for Service<br>&#34;0&#34; Stars for Billing Practice

I came with a group and everything was perfect! Drinks, food, bread and service! Jamie helped us secondarily and she was outstanding! Very attentive, alert and energetic, as most servers at this location are! Way to go team!!

What a wonderful experience! Clean, warm, energetic atmosphere with a feel of privacy. Not overcrowded at all. The hospitality is warm, inviting and pleasant. <br><br>I ordered the Vietnamese summer rolls as an appetizer and garlic noodles for an entree closing it out with chocolate tuxedo cream cheesecake. The bread alone was great, but every morsel my fork touched was like an upgrade from the last bite!! Extremely well seasoned with perfect temperature to dive right in!<br><br>Worth every penny then some
The food is always fantastic but tonight the service was even better. Carolyn C is a fantastic server. She even gave us a tip on how to reheat French fries. Loved her!

Strictly talking food, this Cheesecake Factory gets four stars. On the weekend, parking is hard to find, but it&#39;s a pretty awesome location with other new shops and family activities. The experience though, knocked it a star, otherwise it would have been one of my favorite restaurants we checked out this weekend.<br><br>I ordered a Flying Gorilla beverage to start and it was pretty much my favorite part of a very, very late lunch. Still, we all were able to order from the lunch menu. I had the Avocado Rolls to start, followed by the Chinese Chicken Salad. Everything tasted great, though I&#39;m not a huge fan of the thin, white crispy noodles. I should have asked for them to go easy on that, because there was literally a mountain of it (hence no photo). <br><br>Appetizers came out fast, but everything else was weird, honestly. My sister ordered a Piña Colada to start and then a Pepperoni Pizza. I don&#39;t think she was a huge fan of the drink, but she said the pizza was pretty much what she hoped for. Even at lunch, the portion was rather large. Leftovers, yo! Only problem is she got her food way before our friend and I. She was almost done by the time I got our food.<br><br>Our friend ordered Calamari to start, which I would recommend to everyone, because their Calamari is always so good! Lightly fried, crispy bits of octopus makes for a great appetizer and big enough to share! She ordered a grilled chicken sandwich and seemed to enjoy that as well.<br><br>So what happened to our bread? You know that thing they usually bring out at the very beginning at every Cheesecake Factory? Apparently they were running behind on a lot of our order, which was surprising for a weekend. Tina our server was as helpful as she could be, despite not being able to get everything out at the same time. The bread didn&#39;t even come out until we were ready for the check, so that was kind of annoying. <br><br>I would only recommend they staff the kitchen properly on a Saturday, no exceptions.
