Other than that, I genuinely had a nice time at Cheesecake Factory and am curious to explore more of Summerlin in the future.

To start off the macaroni balls were scrumptious! It all went down hill when I chose the chicken &amp; biscuits, what in the world was I thinking. When the food arrived the smell already threw me off, then I poked at the biscuits and they were harder. They felt like they were made days ago. I continued to poke around and really enjoyed the mashed potatoes but the chicken. Let me tell you. It felt like it had been microwaved and had a really rubber texture to it. No word on when I will be back but definitely not going to recommend this entree.

The food was delicious. I loved the atmosphere, but what I loved most was our server! She was so sweet and courteous. Made sure we had everything we needed and checked on us regularly, not overbearing.

I&#39;ve been here a dozen times since it&#39;s opened and almost always had a nice experience. I&#39;ve enjoyed about 75% of the meals I&#39;ve eaten here and almost always had great customer service. The entrees are bigger portioned which is nice.

Let me tell you. I use to ignore this place cause if the long lines in Waikiki. But, this has changed after this visit here in Vegas. The Food was exquisite and fresh. Tasty, moist and tender. I had the Carne Asada Beef steak with Mash potato. It was a bit over spicy for me but it was flavored well. Annnnnnnnd the Cheese Cake me u list is about a mile long. So we tried a whole bunch of it and got comatose of sugar galore but it was worth it.

While it is a chain restaurant, the extensive menu with gluten free and skinny options make it a good choice for even the pickiest of eaters. Tonight on New Years Eve, we had ordered calamari to enjoy prior to our entrees, however it never came out. Despite this little hiccup, not only did the assistant manager come out to discuss the issue with us, so did the head manager Marco (?) and our server Douglas apologized genuinely as they had ran out and were working hard to remedy the situation. While mishaps happen when dining out, we were extremely impressed by this service recovery. Douglas is a fantastic server and the management staff were incredibly kind. At no point did we ask for a manager, they took it upon themselves to communicate the issue and we were very impressed with how the issue was handled. It made our New Year&#39;s Eve dinner even more pleasant.

I always liked Cheese Cake Factory, but never loved it.  The food is good and reasonably priced, and service usually very good.  But for some reason I don&#39;t comprehend why it&#39;s always busy... esp on a Sunday night like last night with over 20 people waiting while all the tables were still full as we left.  I had the BBQ pork sandwich with sweet potato fries.  There was a bit too much sauce, but the cole slaw helped tame the OD of sassy richness.  Overall, I give my meal last night &#34;thumbs up&#34;.  Any cheesecake for dessert is a must with a multitude of selections to choose from.  Peace!

Most people have gone to The Cheesecake Factory and will rave about their food and desserts. One tip, please try the combination Chicken Madeira and Steak Diane. You owe it to yourself, and you will not be disappointed.

I am no stranger to this place, and this is my favorite Cheesecake Factory location to come to in Las Vegas. The service is always exceptional and my most recent visit was even better. I went with my family to celebrate a special occasion and our waiter Sidney was great! He was very personable and prompt with checking up on us to ensure our food was great. <br><br>Beverages: My mother and sister each ordered Red Sangrias and I decided to go with the Pineapple Mojito. Delicious! <br><br>Appetizer: We usually never get appetizers but this time we decided to switch things up and tried the Crispy Crab Bites, and they were to die for! The dish only comes with three crab bites which may not seem like enough but they were decent in size, and just enough to hold you over until the main course. <br><br>Entrees: As a spicy food fan, I almost always go for the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta and it never fails! My sister got the Chicken &amp; Biscuits and my mother enjoyed the Southern Fried Catfish. Her catfish was so tender that it fell apart as soon as you cut into it (major key!) and the dressing on the side was yummy too.<br><br>Desserts: My mother and I decided to split the Fresh Strawberry Shortcake and let me just say I was pleasantly surprised! Rather then the dish being served as a traditional cake, the dish is actually comprised of three sugar biscuits and the vanilla ice cream &amp; strawberries mixed in. With both of us splitting the dessert, we still had some leftover to take home. <br><br>My sister got &#39;Linda&#39;s Fudge Cake&#39; and she also enjoyed it! The serving slice was huge and the cake was very rich. 10&#39;s across the board!

This review is strictly in regards to the service I received from the manager on duty during our most recent visit. Came here for dinner with my husband and our son around 9pm and was seated outside (as I had asked if outdoor seating was still available). Waited for 15+ mins and was not greeted whatsoever or even brought water. Since we were starved already, we opted to go inside and order our food to go, however, I wanted to be sure the manager was aware of what had happened. Jason came out to meet me and as soon as I explained the situation, he heartily apologized. I had no expectations at all in trying to gain anything but being heard, yet he def took care of us. I truly appreciate Jason for doing his best at turning our negative situation into a better one and respectfully listening to what I had to say.

Hey Everyone,<br><br>Just ordered take out from this location using post mates, I&#39;m a regular patron and I am shocked at the poor quality version of what is normally a great meal when you dine in. I called the TCF and spoke with a manager to let them know the food was subpar and the first manager Angela was a complete waste of time she kept saying that the issue must be resolved with the delivery carrier.<br><br>I then spoke to a different manager, however all they seemed to do is apologize for the poor quality food but did nothing or made any attempt to offer any remedy or solution for the poorly prepared food. <br><br>So I drove the food back to the restaurant the manager Jason refused to replace it or offer any sort of resolution. They keep apologizing but couldn&#39;t offer any solution. I left the take out food on the counter and left. Zero effort or capacity to wear the title as management at the cheese cake factory. <br><br>~~~ Mind Blowing how poor the customer service or lack of responsibility this location has.<br><br>I would never give my business to these people what so ever. <br><br>Stay away from this location.

This place was the definition of mediocrity. The waiters and hostess were good and the environment is honestly pleasant. But I guess that&#39;s what you pay for cause the food I had today was average or subpar. I got the herb crusted salmon with mashed potatoes. The salmon was very wet and seemed not cooked well enough. Mashed potatoes were clumpy because they were not fully mashed. So in a nutshell it seemed that I overpaid for sub par food

Very bad service!! Half of the place was empty but we still need to wait 20 min! And the girls on the front desk very rode and not think out of the box!!! Give answer like they just don&#39;t care of you! The food was ok.. but something that we eat was bad because all of us got sick 1 our after... with Abdominal pain!!!!

This location sucks.<br>Made reservations the day before and was seated 15 mins after the reservation time. Our server sucked completely. He was given way too many tables and barely checked on us. <br><br>The food was okay, the pasta was still hard and forgot a few of our items and still charged us. The Jamaican shrimp were awesome, avocado toast was perfect, shrimp sausage pasta was horrible, alfredo was bad, kids meal was fine (I had to take a bite of my brothers food) After 20 minutes, the manager came by and took it off. <br><br>Definitely going to the other locations cause their food is bombbbbb.

I went to the cheesecake counter &amp; the male cashier must be either on training or new as he asked his co-workers questions like every minute.<br><br>I inquired if they can slice a whole cheesecake into more segments than how they regularly do it &amp; I was informed that they can&#39;t because the cheesecake comes already sliced. Weird! Then I was told that they can&#39;t cut the cheesecake when it&#39;s frozen. So I paid for a to go whole cheesecake &amp; was asked to wait. When the cheesecake was handed to me, I was told that they&#39;re out of bags except smaller ones.<br><br>Before leaving the counter, I asked for what&#39;s the best way of cutting the cheesecake without having it sticking on the knife. I was instructed to put the knife in hot water before slicing. Now here&#39;s the worst part of it...I was told by a female employee (I think she was in-charged of the cheesecake counter at that time) that if I ordered the cheesecake in advance that they can slice it in several segments than they regularly do because it&#39;s been thawed already. So, I said that I can pickup my cheesecake after 2 hours after it thawed &amp; I&#39;ll have them cut it for me in several segments. The response I got was &#34;No, we can&#39;t do it because you&#39;ve already paid for it.&#34;<br><br>I need someone from a Customer Service to contact me ASAP!!!

One of the reasons why I love eating at Cheesecake Factory is because the menu has such a wide variety to choose from. It&#39;s perfect for when your with a group of people who all want different types of food or if you just don&#39;t know what you&#39;re hungry for. Everything on their menu is absolutely delicious. <br><br>This particular location is interesting because it&#39;s in Boca Park where a lot of the Summerlin snobs hang out. <br><br>Today was a beautiful sunny day so we opted to sit in the patio. Being that there was only 2 of us, and they weren&#39;t busy, we were seated right away. However I could tell, almost immediately, that this visit was going to be not a good as previous experiences. Our server, Shawn M, came over to us right away and said &#34;is everything okay over here?&#34; This was a very odd way to greet a couple who had literally just been seated. We replied yes. He asked if we were ready to order. We&#39;d been there less than 5 min so we said no. We placed our drink orders and asked for a few more min to review the menu. This was a mistake! Almost 15 min went by before our waiter came back to take our order. We had even closed our menus hoping he&#39;d see we were ready to order. He was attending to other tables right near us. He finally took our order. Another several min went by before someone brought bread to our table. As we ate the yummy bread and waited for our food, we caught wind of an unsatisfied couple right next to us. They seemed to be making quite a fit about some cucumbers and arugula being left off. The manager was at their table trying to smooth it over. Perhaps this is why the waiter in my area seemed off... Our food arrived finally. I ordered the mushroom burger with a salad. My bf ordered the chicken avocado club. Our food was very good. I got a side of ranch to dip my burger in and it was tasty. As we ate, the snobby couple next to us continued to be a pain. The manager ended up re-making their food to-go for them to make up for the mistake. The couple continued to sit at their table even after checking out. Awkward!! I was about half way through my food when they finally got up to leave. As they left I hear the girl say &#34;this is hysterical that they re-made our food!&#34; The Summerlin snobs left and mood quickly went from tense to peaceful. <br><br>In conclusion, my experience today was just alright. My server was inattentive and overall a bit off. The Summerlin snobs complaining only made it worse. I&#39;ve been to this particular Cheesecake Factory before and have had great service. This time not so much. If you choose to eat at this location, just beware of the Summerlin snobs. I warned you. If you have an issue with your order, please tell the waiter/waitress quietly otherwise it is unnecessarily disruptive to those around you. Don&#39;t be a Summerlin snob!

So I assumed since I had a such a bad experience about one month ago I wrote a review. However, i must not of.  Let&#39;s start with my little brother&#39;s girlfriends graduation dinner from UNLV. A party of 8, service was good, the server was attentive and had everything going for her when it came to her tables. <br>The food, well, how can you mess up a burger medium? It can be done, and I was done this night.  As they were swamped, I knew better than to ask for a remake, it would have taken them one hour for a burger.  No worries the dessert made up for the crappy food. <br><br>Now today, 6/18, as it was not my choice to go, I went back because my brother&#39;s girlfriend loves it there. Issac was our server, really good server, but the length of time to get two basic meals was not good. I did not order as I got there late, and my brother was waiting 1 hour for tacos and some other quick making food. <br>The patrons to the side of us, who came in after him and right before I,  received their food beforehand. As both my brother and I come from a hospitality owned establishment, this is not what we excepted. <br>This is not the normal Cheesecake Factory expectations, at least from the east coast. I know I will not be returning to this one ever again. Furthermore, I will make sure no one visits this one when they come to visit.

The Cheesecake Factory is much more than cheesecake. The Cheesecake Factory is a chain restaurant that specializes in burgers, sandwiches, pasta, and pizza. <br><br>  Yesterday after hanging out in Sabalatte in the Boca Park Fashion Village, my brother and I were up for dinner. We decided on The Cheesecake Factory. The menu offers a diverse selection of food at competitive prices inside an upscale dining room. We couldn&#39;t go wrong with the Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>  Although I have only been to this location once before way back in February of 2005 when I picked up my new Saturn Ion (sure was a long time ago), and celebrated with a delicious pasta dinner, I am no stranger to the Cheesecake Factory. I have been to the Caesar&#39;s Palace location quite a few times. <br><br>  When my brother and I stepped inside the dimly lit and elegant restaurant, it was understandably busy. The friendly hostess took our name and kindly let us know that there would be a five minute wait. The Cheesecake Factory has yet to implement the text messaging system that some restaurants have incorporated. The wait was less than five minutes. <br><br>  Tina was our waitress. She was friendly, never rushed us, and constantly checked up on us. I am giving a shout out for Tina on account of the fact that my brother left his sunglasses at the table. As we approached the Valley parking area (on the way to the upper deck), Tina comes running after us with his sunglasses. With that said, the service here rounded up Cheesecake Factory to four stars. <br><br>  The food is also delicious. Everytime that I have dined in a Cheesecake Factory, the large portions had filled me up leaving me with no room for cheesecake. In my opinion, Cheesecake Factory is a restaurant for either dinner or coffee and dessert. We just had coffee at Sabalatte, so tonight I ordered their chicken parmesan sandwich which included fries and a Coke. The chicken parmesan sandwich is unique. I don&#39;t know of many restaurants that make it. Plus, it is delicious. Between the time of ordering and Tina delivering the sandwich, she delivered the customary dinner rolls. In past visits to the Caesar&#39;s Palace Cheesecake Factory, the pasta sauce was included.  Here, there is a separate bowl of the sauce where you pour it on to your liking. I enjoyed every bite of the chicken parmesan sandwich. It is something that I do not enjoy very often. I also enjoyed the small bowl of French fries that accompanied the sandwich. And the Coke did not have a hint of flatness. It was just as sparkling as Tina&#39;s attitude. <br><br>  Cheesecake Factory was $20 well spent. The dining area is not Tiffany elegance but an elegance similar to dining in a Caesar&#39;s Palace, Venetian Hotel, or upscale resort Cafe. It is a dining environment that isolates the outside world and is simply relaxing. The food was delicious and filling. Service was outstanding. I could see another well spent $20 at Cheesecake Factory in the future. Or $30 if I am hungry and want to reward myself with their signature cheesecake and coffee.

Server&#39;s name Jessica performed a bad service on us. We have been waiting for a long time for the wheat bread to be serve. However, after seeing wheat bread delivered to the customer that came after us, we have a little concern of her work performance. We do not want to judge the first time therefore we asked the server for the bread again, but she only replied &#34;they are in the oven&#34;. Our table can see exactly the kitchen area, therefore we know once the bread is done. The main reason it cause us mad in her service, is that even the bread is cooked and are ready to serve, she is with her guests chatting. She have little awareness of her wait and her attitude while taking order is not polite also. Therefore we want to rate her here and let others realized her performance.

We went by last night to give this location another try and it was not a good experience, in fact it was worse. I handed our waiter, David N., the letter which still had the gift card attached to it (you guys sent us a $45 gift card to give you another try). In the letter it states that the manager would like to know we are there and they could make sure our experience was a better one and would like to meet us. This did not happen, the waiter stood there and read the letter so I don&#39;t know if it was waiter who did not inform management or they just didn&#39;t want to come out, but we were never approached by any manager.<br>  We ordered the eggroll sampler and it was just put in front of us with no explanation of the sauces (never have we ordered any of the eggrolls). We had to go back through the menu to read the individual eggroll descriptions to try and figure this out the sauces but I still don&#39;t think we got it right. Now, of course this isn&#39;t the biggest deal so we just let it go.<br> My friend ordered the grilled fish tacos with no marinated onions and instead cooked onions with no chipotle sauce (she&#39;s very sensitive to heat) and to have that replaced with your creama (from the &#34;slim&#34; menu). She received her dinner and there was no creama, just chipIotle sauce, a very minimal amount of grilled onions (a taco had ONE small strip) ZERO avocado (as it states on the menu its served with it)  and somehow there was a pickled cabbage?? (it&#39;s not stated thats on the tacos on the menu) We asked the server if they could remake it and at this point we are getting very frustrated with the service and food. I had to ask for my coke and her water to be refilled MANY times despite the waiter always walking around. I was genuinely flabbergasted I had to ask for refills with how much he was walking by.<br> So, by now, after already a long wait to receive our food to begin with (the restaurant was not busy by any means from what we could tell) we had to wait another 15 minutes for her food to be remade, so my boyfriend and I stopped eating out of courtesy.  45 mins after we ordered our food, we FINALLY got to eat together and of course my boyfriends and I&#39;s dinner was cold. My friend STILL then had a problem with her order (the tortillas were not cooked) but by then we were so hungry we didnt say anything.<br> Now, here comes the time to pay. After the waiter took the $45 gift card off the total, the remaining balance of the bill was $42 and change. I only had twenties and my friend had her debit card. So, we told the waiter for $20.00 on the card and I put down two twenty dollar bills. David, our waiter, brought back the receipts with no change! Never EVER had I had a waiter just assume the remaining change was theirs and pocket my cash. He never asked if we needed change to verify it was his, he just took it! I asked for it back and he mumbled an apology about be busy or whatnot (which none of us believed, he was making excuses all night and the place WASN&#39;T busy). <br>For this trying to be a make-up from last time for the burnt food and bad food, you guys SERIOUSLY missed again. I don&#39;t know if it&#39;s this location or whatever but we are very unsatisfied with the service and food and that the manager wasn&#39;t around to make sure our dining experience was better than the last. I really enjoyed you guys, but at this rate my friend says she NEVER wants to come back and I don&#39;t blame her!!!

Great place to have dinner with family or friends.  Staff were friendly.  Food was delish. They come in big portions and the ambience was great.  The only thing I don&#39;t like about the place is the lighting.  It&#39;s too dim and a bit loud.  Pam, our waitress, was very friendly and checked on us frequently.  Will definitely dine here again.

I&#39;m not one to complain too much. Tonight was the WORST Cheesecake Factory experience I have ever had! Keep in mind, we got to the restaurant at 9:00, and left at 10:45. We sat and waited for a table for 5 minutes, normal. And then we sat down and met our waitress Nicole. She was fairly friendly, seemed like tonight was going to be a great way to close off the night. She took our drink order and brought it out in about 5 minutes. No biggie. Took our food order and the food did not come out for a good 50 minutes. All we ordered was a kids mac, avocado egg rolls (pre-made), some chicken pineapple thing (to-go), and some chicken lettuce wraps. Literally all the kitchen had to cook was chicken and put pre-made egg rolls in the deep fryer for the food at our table. It took almost an hour to cook chicken. AN HOUR! How does that happen? Whoever the manager is on May 28, 2019, for the closing shift. You HAVE to talk it over with your team. Nicole would look at our table, clearly see we finished the bread (after waiting 30 minutes, we obviously had to eat something) and would see that my glass of water was empty. She did not offer ONCE a refill on neither my water or bread. Not cool. I love the Cheesecake Factory, but tonight is what I would call an epic fail.
Love the food and the service ... everyone is friendly and on point.... I personally can eat a piece of cheesecake everyday... but the food is good as well

The Cheesecake factory has two extensive menu&#39;s. The regular and the skinny which has smaller portions and lower calories. We were seated after only a few minute wait which was great for a Friday night without reservations. I suggest a booth over a table which provides a buffer for the surrounding noise. The large room can be conversation challenging when filled with diners. Our server was friendly and attentive. <br>The food ordering and preparation were timely.<br>The Crispy Chicken Costoletta consists of 3 breaded breasts sauteed and served with a lemon sauce, mashed potatoes and fresh asparagus. The 3 large breasts were tender and juicy with a crispy panko style breading. This was 1 meal for 2 people or 2 meals.<br><br>The Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp was sauteed with a spicy pepper sauce.  The entree is served with a choice of white or brown rice, along with black beans, plantains, and a cool mango sauce. The plantains were crispy outside and soft on the inside. The generous portion of shrimps were moderately spicy but not overwhelming. The cool mango was a nice contrast to the spicy shrimp.<br>The restaurant has a Happy Hour but be advised it is only in the bar area which at our arrival was at full capacity. The bar area is wide open and will be on the loud side.
Giant portions of classic American style food and great desserts. That about sums this place up. Nuff said.
Amazing staff, they&#39;re always so nice here and the food is unbelievable!! They usually seat pretty quickly and it&#39;s always very clean.

Once my favorite local restaurant, this location now specializes in disappointment.  My last three to go orders have been wrong, lost, very late, and often a combination of all three.   Managers refuse to credit your card - even for food you don&#39;t get - which has caused me to contest charges with my AMEX company.  Instead they offer issue you a credit for the wronged item and ship it to your house.  Sometimes it comes....Most times, it does not.  <br><br>Is the food good?  Sure....if you can get it. Overall there are too many other options in Summerlin...We don&#39;t need to be subjected to poor service and execution.

Just a horrendous experience all around.  I will never go back to a Cheesecake property ever again.  My husband called twice a few days before to ask for a reservation (we had a party of 13).  They said they don&#39;t take reservations not even for larger parties or if you leave a credit card.  He called the day of (9/14) to see if they could do anything as well as a couple hours before.  They just said &#34;we can accommodate&#34;.  We got there a little earlier than we said we would (we told them 7 but we arrived around 6:45) and would take whatever we could get inside/outside, first avail.  The manager told us it would be an hour to an hour and 15.  We waited OVER an hour and 45min. (Almost 2 hours) and still didn&#39;t have anything, we finally gave up and went to Grimaldi&#39;s which was a FAR BETTER experience.  There were tables of 8 and 9 people getting seated over us regularly and those aren&#39;t small parties.  Finally the manager tells us she can seat us but separated which would have been fine as long as we were near each other however we still didn&#39;t have a guaranteed table(s) anywhere.  Apparently she was waiting for one party to leave so she could seat us, made absolutely no sense!!!  I mean could they not move tables together, it&#39;s a huge venue why wait on ONE party.  They were there over 3ish hours and I understand she didn&#39;t want them to leave, we didn&#39;t want her to kick them out but this restaurant seats a lot of people, how could you not coordinate at least two tables of 6 or whatever the arrangement could be.  We also had a toddler with us who we had to order food (and eat in the busy lobby on her mom&#39;s lap) because she was starving and understandably acting out.  The manager was nice enough to Comp that.  We ordered multiple drinks at the bar throughout the evening and finally left after 2 hours (2hours!!). Beware if you have a big group.  The only reason why we went there in the first place was because my husband and I had 2 gift cards we wanted to get rid of.  We will be giving them away because we refuse to use them, so awful!

Waited 50 min minutes for food they were not even that busy. The manager said they were training cooks. They had to bring me three Place settings to get a clean one. The manager did not offer to make it right.

So my wife and I went to the Cheesecake factory in Summerlin again to give this place another try. Last time i got hit on the head by people in the walkway. This time the server was having a bad night and FAILED to check the orders.  Nancy&#39;s plate had no sauce and nor did the salid but the crime was in the Woman&#39;s restroom,  just take a look at this mess my wife found? Im starting to look elsewhere to go for cheesecake.

I&#39;ve always been hesitant on coming back here. I&#39;ve had too many terrible experiences here in the past. My usual spot was too busy for lunch so we (me and the hubby) figured we would give this a try. All I can say is WOW! Our waiter, James, was phenomenal! Very polite and on top of everything. My food was outstandingly amazing! We started out with he Ghirardelli cherry cheesecake that was superb!! I ordered the Renee lunch special and it was nothing short of amazing. I literally got a half of a large tomato with my salad, I love tomatoes! My hubby got the club sandwich that was actually seasoned (no places I&#39;ve been to season them) with a generous portion of fries that were still very warm and perfectly cooked. We will definitely be going back in the near future (probably even tomorrow ). Thank you for the exceptional service!

New year eve me and my wife went to eat something and enjoy the early night.<br>The hamburger was a well-done but burn and didn&#39;t taste so good and through them about 45 minutes to serve us the food.<br>Maybe because it was a New Year&#39;s Eve but still took them so long and the food didn&#39;t text so good this time.

Service was good and they finally had the artichokes in stock today. My only problem is that they ran out of Chris&#39; Outrageous cheesecake, and they&#39;re also taking it off the menu. I&#39;m writing this review for a friend because this is the second cheesecake with coconut that they have taken off, and he&#39;s pretty pissed lol.
I always eat here for my birthday and the food is fantastic the waiters are friendly and the restaurant is so clean

This seems to be the go to place when I can&#39;t make up my mind. I always attempt to convince myself that I&#39;m going to order something different but I can&#39;t seem to get away from the Chinese chicken salad &amp; chicken Madeira. <br>They have a huge menu with a wide variety of choices &amp; I love the tropical ice tea. I also need to mention the mood lighting in this place, love that touch :)<br>We can never seem to make it to dessert but the times we&#39;ve had it it&#39;s always fresh &amp; delicious. If you can&#39;t decide on which type of cheesecake to order you can&#39;t go wrong with the original slice with strawberries :)<br>The warm bread is also a nice touch to start getting full before your food arrives.

Stopped by for a takeout order of three slices of cheesecake. Cost me about $28. I&#39;m okay with that, except the blackout which is usually pretty awesome was DRY. Tasted like it had sat for a few days. Yuck. These guys are always busy so I feel like expecting a fresh slice that&#39;s not stale is reasonable if I&#39;m paying $9 each slice. Come on guys, pull yourselves together.

Food here is always delicious. I got two different types of cakes and the red velvet cheesecake. It was delicious. However, servers behind the counter ignored me while they were gossiping on the other side of the counter. I almost left had it not been for my parents. It was very rude that they kept me waiting while there were three servers on the other side just talking their heads off. With this hopefully they would be more attentive to customers!

I love Cheesecake Factory!!  The atmosphere ,<br>The ambiance, the food. The dessert , the service etc.<br>I always order <br>The mojitio  or the Asian pear martini to start off then get the Asian salad or the pepperoni pizza and for dessert the nice and warm apple cobbler.<br><br>I like Cheesecake Factory off of rampart/ Boca Park and sit outside at night to feel the breeze and watch the traffics go by.

Went on sunday 12/14/14 at 11am. We had our hearts set on the elvis waffle but it was no longer on the menu. They made it for us anyway! That was nice of them. The elvis waffle is a crispy belgian waffle with banana slices, peanut butter, bacon, and warm syrup. It&#39;s amazeballs. BRING BACK THE ELVIS WAFFLE, Y&#39;ALL!

Not sure why this place is always crowded. It&#39;s diner food at strip prices. We get the shrimp pasta and it was 5 shrimp with a pile of linguini. I usually don&#39;t get the dessert because it&#39;s overpriced but we went for it this time. They all look great but don&#39;t taste great. I had the Celebration cheesecake (I.e. birthday cake ) and there was no taste. Tasted like sugar free cake with no cheesecake in it. My friend got the lemon meringue and it was so tart you couldn&#39;t even eat it. After a couple bites we gave up and left it. $20 down the drain... (they have the gull to charge $9/slice plus tax and tip). $75 total for 2 people for basic food. Servers try hard but they are always overworked and stressed and became so busy takes forever to get your food...I&#39;ve been to the one near downtown (at the the outlets)several times and same thing. I go because they have a lot on menu but it&#39;s overwhelming to try and read it all.

Food was pretty good but wait time was longer than normal. We felt rushed through like cattle. Waiter was very dry and asked us if we needed a box about 12 min into meal. <br>  I said yes. When the wife said no he just swooped up her plate and walked off half way through her meal!   The people that were seated after us were served first. I rarely give a negative review but this deserved it! Won&#39;t be back.

This place drops in my book each time we go there. 90% of the time the floors are so slippery to walk on. 9 out of 10 times my pasta is always dry from sitting before they serve.  <br>Service is off big time <br><br>Never fails. Why order a salad or appetizer when you never get it.  Halfway through the main course it shows up.  No thanks.   Once or twice maybe I get the mistake. This is every darn time.

6/22. We came here at 4pm, seemed to be the very end of lunch but before they got busy for dinner. We were able to be seated right away, and our waiter was very nice throughout our meal. My problem mainly lies with the kitchen. They brought us our bread, which definitely was hard and stale, as if it had just been sitting for awhile. For an appetizer we ordered the chicken dumplings, which were okay but we&#39;re definitely quite dry on the inside. For our entrees, I ordered the chicken Marsala(like I always do) and my husband got a bacon burger. His burger was just fine, but my Marsala was swimming in oil, and my chicken was covered in pepper. It was just a very underwhelming experience, to say the least!

If you have any type of food allergy or celiac disease be Very careful when you eat here!! I let the waitress know I have a gluten allergy and ordered a gluten free pasta. I immediately became ill from this &#34;gluten free&#34; meal! I was too sick to say anything at the time so I called the next day and spoke with a manager. His response was very unconcerned and told me nobody else called to report getting sick. It sounded like he felt this was a food poisoning phone call not someone his staff got very sick. There was no type of compensation offered for their horrible mistake. He also told me how hundreds of people a day order gluten free food and some are for allergies and some are preference. This shouldn&#39;t be a reason why my order was not given the proper care! I will not be back!
Great dinner. Portion was so big I&#39;m struggling with dessert but there could be worse things in my life:-)

Second time returning to the infamous cheese cake factory. This location is pretty settle, atmosphere and ambience 10/10. Stopped by for the cheesecakes today. Got three huge slices of cake. There are way to many to choose from. Ordered 3 slices for $26. Well worth the price. Dug right into the cakes, super sweet= HAPPINESS. Always a pleasure !!

The family went to this restaurant on Monday, February 23rd.<br><br>If I was just rating this restaurant on food, I would give them a 5 star, but upon sitting down I noticed that my spoon had dried food on it and the divider between the seat cushions had a load of food debris.<br><br>That said, I want to say it didn&#39;t have an impact on the food or the service.  Antonio was our server and he was excellent.  We started out with an appetizer of lettuce wraps, these with chicken and quite tasty.  The main course followed soon, my wife ordered a Mushroom Burger, mmmm delicious.  My daughter ordered the 4 Cheese Pasta and she loved it.  And finally I ordered a Macaroni and Cheese Burger, enticed by the idea of macaroni and cheese on a hamburger.  The macaroni was a ball, breaded and deep fried on top of the hamburger which was charbroiled and served with all the extras including fries.  What a surprise, this was a very good combination, especially if you like macaroni and cheese anyway.<br><br>The restaurant was very busy but that didn&#39;t affect service.  Antonio took great care of us and our drinks never got empty.  The downside here is that they do not have Raspberry Iced Tea, my favorite, but only had regular and a couple of bottled teas.  I settled for regular tea but didn&#39;t enjoy it or finish it.<br><br>And what would  a trip to the Cheesecake Factory be without some cheesecake?  While mom and I were stuffed from the burgers, our daughter had no trouble ordering a piece of Hershey Bar Cheesecake to go.<br><br>Overall, this was a very pleasant lunch and we will be sure to return.

I never thought there would be a day I would be writing a 3 star review on one of my favorite restaurants of all time. We came during the day at around 2:30 to 3 on a Monday. I was surprised that there was a wait time of about 15 minutes. We were seated with our party of 3 at that time. <br><br>The bread was delicious and the waitress seemed nice. I got what I always got the chicken fettuccine Alfredo , my 5 year old got the corn dogs and my cousin has ordered the Philly cheesesteak. Everything was going good until waiting for the food. It was literally a good 36 minute wait time for the food and we didn&#39;t see the waitress at all during this time. The waiter at the table next to us told his frustrated customers that the kitchen was backed up. <br><br>We eventually got our food. It was delicious but I never got my Parmesan cheese. This is one of my favorite parts, it had crossed my mind the maybe they did not do this anymore but the person at the table next to us had been asked and received some. We didn&#39;t see our waitress again for a very long time. It was very frustrating because of the time it had taken to receive our food my 5 year old was already restless and I was already ready to order dessert and get the check but took forever for her to arrive.  We had even asked eachother if it would even be worth it to order enough thing because of how much time it was taking for the simple things like asking for a refill or anything it was another 15 minutes <br><br>The cheesecake I always receive... The original was drenched with sour cream topping ... It was gross. Normally they have just enough to taste with the whip cream but this thing was covered in it. We took a few bites and left it . <br><br>I&#39;m so disappointed because as I did this is my favorite place. One of the best things being the service and food and both things were a disappointment this time .

The past two times I have come here, Jessica B has been our server and she was amazing both times! She&#39;s super nice and a great conversationalist and we always get our food, drinks, and everything out so quickly. We definitely will be asking for a table with her next time we are here! Thank you Jessica!

This location rocks! There was no line,  we simply walked right in and were seated right away. Our waitress was personable, attentive &amp; funny.  Food came out shortly after we ordered.  Restaurant was clean. Staff was friendly. A great dining experience overall.

My husband and I came here this evening, we both ordered our dinners and they came out very quickly. There was a minor mishap with one of the sauce bottles. Our server Jessica and the manager Raven were quick to remedy the situation and ensure our dinner was great. We thoroughly enjoyed our food, and the service was absolutely amazing!

Had the mushroom glamburger and it was outrageously good 14 bucks is a little much to spend for a burger but you get what you  pay, I may order  bun on the side next time  , it was a little  wet and messy, just deconstructed  it and enjoyed  anyway

This location is too busy. I was on hold for 17 minutes trying to place a takeout order (I stayed on the phone just to see how long I would be kept on hold). Don&#39;t patronize this restaurant, it&#39;s always overcrowded and calling them to place an order isn&#39;t any better. There are better restaurants with better food. I can&#39;t seem to do a zero stars rating here, otherwise, I would give them a minus zero stars.

Why does this place have mediocre ratings?  I love cheesecake. It is one of my favorite restaurants. I will say service is hit or miss, especially depending on how busy it is. BUT majority of the time my food comes in time, my drink doesn&#39;t run too low, and my check is closed without too much waiting. Food is consistent. I love their chicken Caesar,  has a nice kick. Their kobe beef burger is so good. 4 cheese or Louisiana pasta. Chicken Madeira, or bang bang chicken is always good. Avocado egg rolls are a good app. And the cheesecake .... love the red velvet, Tiramisu and Chris outrageous. Get the godiva sundae. My husband and I come here once a week. Michael is by far the best server my hubby and I have had!

I&#39;ve been to this cheesecake factory like a dozen times and it use to be great back in the day, but my recent visit was kinda blah.<br><br>I came with a friend last week to chat over dinner and we must have waited about a good solid 10 minutes before our waiter came to take our order.<br><br>Our waiter was friendly, but seemed to have way too many tables to tend to making hard on him to please everyone he was serving.<br><br>The poor guy was stretched thin and it was a bit hard trying to find him so we could get condiments to our table that he or his food runner had forgot to get.<br><br>My friend ordered the beef medallion with mash potatoes, which she liked very much. I ordered the lean burger with side salad and it didn&#39;t turn out the way I requested.<br><br>I wanted my burger well done and it was not and unfortunately my salad was not very fresh, but I ate my food anyway, because I was like starving already.<br><br>Overall I didn&#39;t really enjoy my food, but I&#39;m more than willing to give this place another try and taste something else on the menu next time I eat here.

It was our last goodbye dinner with our wonderful friends who are leaving to San Diego.  It was crazy since we had all the kids with us but since the restaurant is so noisy no one seemed to mind.  <br><br>I have a few items that are my go-to favorites and tonight I had the crusted salmon with mashed potatoes and asparagus-ohhh delicioso. Pumpkin cheesecake when in season is my favorite!  Cant wait for fall!<br><br>The red sangria is a must here too, they add fresh strawberries. We shared a mango and key lime slice of cheesecake and since I just like classic cheesecake, this wasn&#39;t a favorite. Kids shared a pepperoni pizza portions are huge!<br><br>Service was friendly and prompt.  Free valet which I recommend since the parking lot gets busy and nice convenient Summerlin Location in Boca Park next to Kona Grill. Check it out there&#39;s something on the menu for everyone!
Loved lunch!! Flatbread pizza awesome!! Tex mex egg rolls the best!!! Topped off with vanilla bean cheesecake!! Yeah! Sitting outside was great! Go today! U won&#39;t be disappointed!

Ordered a well done classic burger  made it clear when I ordered I wanted it well done. I said actually very well done. Server said no problem.  Not even close to well done. Told her about. No refund no offer to redo it. Very poor experience will not return
It was a good meal, the service is a hit or miss here, its either you get good service, or you get ignored the whole time u are there

Came here a few days ago with my boyfriend, he got the tuna salad and said it was fantastic! I had to factory burrito, the bread they served while we were waiting was delicious! Fast service and great food!! We will be back :)
The Srvice so poor!!! So sad place like cheese cake factory didn&#39;t know what&#39;s Costmer service it&#39;s mean?!?! Our server Tyler need more training .<br>Me and my family very disappointed.

Always a go to restaurant that is never disappointing! My husband and I eat here all the time and the food is always fresh and good! The customer service is always amazing, all the waiters are friendly and attentive. Everything on the menu is pretty much good!

5 star service tonight! Thank you Isaiah! What a crazy Christmas Eve night. Tired from shopping, wrapping (thinking about all the wrapping to go), and hangry. After waiting for 30 min on this crazy busy night at CF, Isaiah was there to impress. Table touched endlessly. Drinks always full. Bread and butter never without. Kids needs of napkins and extras met. Thank you kind sir, especially on Christmas Eve when you could be home serving your family, your serving hours like Momma would. Thank you, thank you. Made a new fan for life. Food was fresh, all that. But great service makes all food taste better. Cheers!

Awesome Mother&#39;s Day Brunch. Love the menu. Our server was very attentive and made sure we were taken care of especially the Moms. Had the eggs Benedict with the chicken and waffles. First time having it and the portion was huge. When you go ask for John. He will make sure you are taken care of. Great job guys on a very busy day.

My sister and I celebrated our 20th birthday day with our friends last night it just so happened to be mother days weekend so to say they were busy is an understatement.Naturally our wait time was prolonged but it was well worth it. We were luck enough to have been served by Jessica (aka Sally). She was very welcoming and friendly. She took the time to engage in conversation with our table and always had a smile on her face.  Best experience I had at this Cheesecake Factory, we will definitely be back!

My husband and I love to stop here and get the cheesecake for a special treat. Today, as usual, we stopped, chose our favorites, paid, then headed home to enjoy our special treats. Today something was noticeably different. It seems Cheesecake Factory has caved to cheapness and convenience and switched to compressed air whipped cream. After all, isn&#39;t the real, heavy, whipped cream all part of the decadence of purchasing a $7.95 piece of cheesecake?! I am giving the cheesecake dessert and restaurant three stars because I want you to know the importance of REAL WHIPPED CREAM! After all, isn&#39;t the dessert the main reason people come here? This is the Rampart location in Summerlin, Las Vegas, Nevada. <br>My husband and I are so disappointed, that, unless, this &#34;mistake&#34; is corrected we will no longer frequent Cheesecake Factory.

Picked up salads after a long day of tourist activity at Hoover Dam and Fire Canyon only to have one of the orders missing a key ingredient. Michelle the manager was awesome and made up for it later in the evening with a complimentary cheesecake and personal attention.
Forget the cheesecakes, the burgers are amazing! But seriously, The 30th Anniversary cake is the best

Went for lunch today and Jessica took care of us in a most pleasant and friendly manner.  I had the calamari (shocker) so good, Ultimate Margarita always amazing.  Lunch size pizza and salad which was good, the pizza crust could have been a little more crisp.  The hot fudge sundae is sure to please, smiles from ear to ear.  I believe they even sell the hot fudge at the bakery counter.<br><br>My only concern was for some reason we had a swarm of flies around our table in the section we were sitting (indoors.)  We wanted to dine outdoors but they said it was too windy.   Still left satisfied and content.  Thanks Jessica :)

Went here the other night they were on a wait for a table so I sat at the bar.. I had the Korean cauliflower and it was so good I wish the bowl never ended ! I had the miso salmon and wow sooo GOOD! The bartender was so helpful gave me the best options of what to eat I forgot his name but I will be back
Favorite restaurant in Summerlin.  Good variety.   Great brunch menu.  Great service at the bar.  <br><br>Continues to get better with time.

Ordered a cheeseburger, medium, on a gluten free bun for my kid that has a wheat allergy. Arrived on a regular bun. Came out for a second time and he bit into a raw burger. Came out a third time and it was slightly more done but still pretty red. Poor kid stuck to the mashed potatoes. Service has really gone downhill there (I haven&#39;t been in about a year). No wonder the wait was close to nil.

Have been here plenty of times but that was before smart phones and Yelp. I&#39;ve always enjoyed the food and especially the desserts. <br><br>This time around i&#34;m with my wife and 4 year old son. After we ordered our drinks we received our complimentary bread. Our server brought out my son his own small bread plate with sliced bananas. Thought that was excellent, never seen that before!<br><br>We both had separate chicken dishes. They wete ordered and in no time, on a Friday night they were at our table. I&#39;d say they were faster than Jimmy John&#39;s. We split with our son and he gobbled it all up. She had the chicken picata an I had the chicken marsala. Both were fantastic. <br><br>Now time for dessert. Cheesecake Factory is famous for what? Their Cheesecake!!! Oh my, decision, decision, decision! There is just so much how can 1 person plus a 4 yeat old decide? Seems I&#39;m sharing with my son so he&#39;ll decide. <br><br>So it&#39;s decided, the Chocolate Tower Truffle Cake. The cake was enormous so we split it amongst us. The only thing i didn&#39;t really care for was the whipped cream. It had a blan taste but overall it was fantastic. <br><br>Our server was great. He was busy however he went above my expectations. Food was great and served quickly. Our drinks were refreshed even when we didn&#39;t ask. <br><br>I think 1 thing they could improve on is the lighting. We sat in a part of the restaurant that the overhead lights were high in the ceiling which made it hard to read the menu. <br><br>Overall we&#39;re beyond satisfied. Especially when we were visited by a cricket

I&#39;m not sure how to review this place.  The service my friend and I got was excellent.  The appetizer we had (I can&#39;t remember what it was called - veggies breaded with various dipping sauces) was delicious, but they didn&#39;t have any eggplant parmesan left (that was the dish I really wanted).  So, I ordered a garlicky pasta dish.  It was tasty, but unfortunately I felt sick all night.  I know it wasn&#39;t the appetizer because the friend I dined with had no problems whatsoever.  Perhaps if I&#39;d gotten the meal I wanted, I wouldn&#39;t have been sleepless until 5:30 am because I felt like I was going to throw up.  I&#39;ve never had a bad experience at TCF before, so I&#39;m going to view this as a fluke happenstance.  All the same, I don&#39;t intend to dine at this particular locale again.
We came in for national cheesecake day. Though it was busy, Dan O took great care of us. Excellent visit!

Called for an order for pick up. Ordered buffalo wings no blue cheese with extra ranch, luau salad DRY with extra dressing/sauces on the side (because I know they put additional sauces on the wontons) extra wontons, and Thai lettuce wraps no bean sprouts with extra cucumber. Buffalo wings are super well done/borderline burnt and dry, extra ranch means two small half empty containers of ranch, my luau salad came with sauces on the wonton unlike being dry like I ordered so of course they were soggy by the time we got home, the Thai wraps had 3 shredded/broken lettuce cups which were also drenched in water in the container they were in so they were super wilted... all this for an incredible $50! Money far from being well spent. Super disappointed and I don&#39;t know what&#39;s happened to cheesecake Factory standards buy they need to get it together.

I&#39;ve eaten at the Cheesecake Factory in many cities and never had any problems. We always eat when we assume it won&#39;t be busy because we have two small kids and need to be in and out. Went in at 2:30 pm on a Tuesday and it was pretty dead. Only problem is, they only seemed to have one waitress taking care of all six tables at once. She was sweet and trying her best. Booth behind us had issues with their lettuce and booth in front of us sent back their steak. By the time our food came out, a good 35 mins into being there. my baby&#39;s mashed potatoes were very cold and my husband&#39;s chicken and mashed potatoes were also cold. Obviously none of that was the waitress job but the kitchen obviously was making her life hard. We felt bad for her so I didn&#39;t complain but needless to say, nearly an hour and a half we finally got out of there (luckily before a toddler melt down) on a dead Tuesday afternoon. I would hate to see this location during peak times. But seriously, if you are going to have prices in this range and super slow service please serve me warm food!

GREAT TIMES!<br><br>Kids were able to talk &amp; make noise aa kids do. The atmosphere was very relaxing. Tge waitress, actually sat with my 3 yr old daughter to get her to eat. It was awesome. <br><br>The food was great. I ordered the catfish &amp; planned on taking a picture but .... That did not happen. Sorry...I ate it all. <br><br>Sidenote: my 3yr old only wanted meatballs...not spagetti and meat balls. This was not on menu, but the waitress made it happen!<br><br>Great times!

Food is good but inconsistent on portion sizes. Club sandwich usually has alot of turkey on it, and this time had barely any. And especially for desert. Have gotten the truffle tower chocolate cake on 3 different occasions and each time it was a different size, getting progressively smaller. 1st time it was a nice big slice of cake like it should be, 2nd time I got it to go and it was shoved in a small to-go box, broken in half and looks like the bottom was gone. So I told a manager, and all they did was put the broken cake in a larger box, ignoring the fact it didn&#39;t look all there. 3rd time was worst of all, I got it to go and the piece was small. Both in length and width of the cake! Definitely not a tower. Not happy at all and I would suggest keeping an eye on the portions they give you and complaining if you feel you were skimped on. Not that it helped for me.
This place has outstanding food drinks n the service was wonderful.... my family n I always dine here n we love it

I love this restaurant...yet another great meal and excellent service...I did take off a star for the price as I do feel as though they are a little to pricey for what they offer...if was $108 for two people for a small steak and steamed vegetables and desert...<br>Also, they were not packed, no waiting and they crammed us in a small two person table right next to another table full of people. I feel like they could have spread us out a bit...<br>But overall very pleased and will definitely return next time I am in town.

LOVE THIS PLACE! Great food, really clean, and really awesome. You may have to wait but it&#39;s worth it. And I&#39;m only talking about the food! Now let me talk about the cheesecake. ITS THE BEST. I recommend the Oreo cheesecake and all the other cheesecakes. Also there&#39;s a location on the strip if your staying there!

We had a family lunch on Thursday and it has been a pleasant experience. We were three of us, and asked to be seated on a booth. They promptly escorted us to a booth of six, without knowing that we intended spending a lot of money there.<br>We ordered avocado egg rolls, two Tuscan Asparagus chicken from skinny DELICIOUS menu, Americana Cheeseburger, strawberry smoothie, Mojito Pineapple, and ultimately the Tiramisu Cake!<br>I don&#39;t know which meal was better than the other!<br>Definitely, the Tuscan chicken was succulent and tasty, my mojito was amazing, strawberry smoothie very well done, and tiramisu like I was in Italy.<br>Definitely we will come back next week!<br>Thanks for your service and strongly recommended!

Cheesecake has always been a safe choice for my household. We all have a favorite dish here or some kind of comfort food. I use to go to the Green Valley location and we never had less than average service. However this location really needs to step it up. Reading through reviews and based on my past couple visits it&#39;s safe to say they always fall short in the service department. I mean the annoyance of the Cheesecake Factory at the forum shop is practically worth it compared to here. <br><br>Last night we order a couple appetizers and entrees and everything was &#34;half assd&#34;. I checked into Yelp when we were seated and I had to refer back to my check in to notice it took over 15 minutes for someone to greet us. That was after I asked the busboy to get our server that was cleaning the table next to us. Then when the server came he asked us if we were ready to order our drinks as we stated yes he said h would be right back with our bread? Of the 2 appetizers we ordered we only had one brought to the table. Btw, don&#39;t ever order the Chicken Potstickers from here. They were too salty and nearly burnt. Stick to their firecracker salmon or avocado egg rolls. Someone at the table order the Steak Diane and Shrimp  Scampi (medium) and he was served well done. It was just careless acts after careless acts. Our drinks needed a refill we had to call on the busboy again. He took our drinks and brought them back without the straw. If we wanted Applebee&#39;s service and quality we would&#39;ve went there.  We&#39;re definitely going to take our money elsewhere until they can do better!
I like their food,but they always forget condiments when it comes to pick up..always forget to put in the bag the butter, ketchup, ranch or other condiments I ask for

I love the Cheesecake Factory they&#39;re great every time I go. I love that they have such a large and versatile menu so you multiple choices. They literally have everything from Chinese to burgers. I&#39;ve tried multiple things off their menu and everything has been amazing. The orange chicken is some of the best I&#39;ve had. Of course the cheesecake is amazing as well. They also have a pretty large selection of cheesecake to choose from. Last time we tried the new Reese&#39;s cheesecake and omg it was amazing. We usually get the Adams peanut butter which is very similar but the Reese&#39;s was very good. I highly recommend this place especially if you&#39;re with a large group because the menu has so many different options it can please everyone. The wait can just get kind of long but it usually goes by pretty fast and it is more on the pricey side (average $40-$50 for two)  but still not a bad price for how good the food is.

Always great food and good service<br>Waiters are all very well trained and food is always up to top standards so you know what to expect<br>Prices are reasonable and that damn cheesecake at the end is fantastic
Love this restaurant, always delivers!! Atmosphere excellent and prices are good, and best of all is  the food food quality!!

Our waitress was great &amp; the food was typical Cheesecake Factory. I appreciate the consistency, no matter which location we have been to. Their new Celebration Cheesecake was a hit with my little one and the pork sliders were my dad&#39;s favorite.

My boyfriend took me here for Valentine&#39;s day on Valentine&#39;s day. you can only imagine how busy they would be on Valentine&#39;s day but we chose to sit outside and there was no wait. micheal was our server and helped us decide what to order with his great recommendations. even though the reaturant was extremely busy Michael was very attentive. we were in and out of the reaturant in an hour. I was so shocked and happy.

Customer service was very average for a fine dining restaurant. The receptionist completely forgot about us. We waited around 45min-1 hour when there were more than plenty tables available. There were people who came in after us and were seated before and we were all parties of two. The food was also very average as well. We ordered the Pasta da Vinci and it was over cooked and a bit bland. Not our usual experience at a Cheesecake Factory.

So my fieancee and i decided to grab a quick bite here at cheese cake and our feelings were very mixed.  Our first server seemed nice at first,  but was forgetful about our drinks.  I guess there was a shift change because a new woman introduced herself as our new waiter.  She was not much better.  She seemed very attentive to her four top to our &#34;miesly&#34; 2 top.  Then a waitress by the name of Amanda noticed that we were trying to get our servers attention. She was quick, helpful and attentive to our needs. Getting us our 20 min waters in seconds and sharing her story of her new life in vegas and being employed at cheesecake only a month(and killing it). She dramatically changed our moods in a very positive way.  We will be back and will only sit with Amanda!

My girlfriend and I walked into The Cheesecake Factory at 10:25, while they close at 11:00. Emmanuel was extremely helpful, and made sure we were ensured that we could sit down and enjoy our meal, as we were hesitant because closing was soon. The veggie burger was AMAZING, exactly as he described. He was extremely attentive and made sure we knew our food would be right out. He checked on us multiple times, making sure our cups were full at all times! He was most definitely the most attentive, assuring &amp; helpful waiter we have ever encountered!

The food here is good however EVERY single time I order take out they butcher the order.  Just got home with a chicken salad that has no chicken in it.  I guess it&#39;s my fault for not checking the order but we did curbside and it was dark out and it hard to open everything in the car.  We also tipped $8.  It&#39;s so aggravating.

Excellent service from Matthew J. wait, ask for him he&#39;s excellent! We had the carbonara, penne shrimp and sausage, lunch portions were huge and delicious. Be sure and order the spring loaded Caesar salad, hee hee it jumps out  of the bowl it&#39;s so full. Having strawberry shortcake for desert. Isagenix cleanse here we come. Lol

I wanted to take a second to say thank you to the manager working right now. I come here relatively often and even though I didn&#39;t have a great experience this time I would still come back. I order the herb lemon chicken and when it arrived the potatoes were cold and the sauce was very clearly not right. I&#39;ve had this before and it&#39;s usually so good. This time it was very sour and weird. The manager not only took off the item from our bill but gave us a gift card to come back next time as an apology. That is so amazing and he knows how to take care of customers. Mistakes always happen at restaurants but it&#39;s how you treat your customers that make the experience. Thank you!! Not necessary but very much appreciated.

Went there for a slice of cheesecake with my daughter. The place was packed on an early Sunday afternoon. Had to wait for around 20 min to be seated. Our server was Tiffany and she was very attentive and helpful. I had cappuccino and that was excellent. My actual Tiramisu Cake was really good and big enough to share. My daughter Oreo milkshake was good but oh, sooo sweet, she couldn&#39;t finish it. She had Dulce De Leche Cheesecake, and that for us tasted ok, but not really impressive. A little overpriced.

I loved Cheesecake Factory when I lived in LA and this one is close to my house. At this one we were seated at a table where one person sits on a booth and the other pulls up a chair. The person next to us had a seafood entree that had such a strong odor that we couldn&#39;t enjoy our food. We like seafood but we were glad we did not order whatever this man&#39;s dinner was because it was overpowering. We did not have an enjoyable time because of that.

Got there approximately 140p. Very few people in the restaurant. Hostess said it would be 10 minutes with a restaurant that was empty. Finally seated. Food was their usual bland fare. I&#39;ve given them multiple opportunities over the years but they only get worse. Won&#39;t be back. Its overpriced marginal food.
Andrea is the best hostess at Cheesecake Factory!!!<br>You have to come and meet her!!! She is awesome!!!

I love this place but today was really off we sat at the bar for a late lunch and it felt as if we were a burden to the bartender. Order a couple burgers and  appetizers that took more than 40 minutes to  make it to our table. I&#39;m really hoping this is just an off day for this venue being there is such close competition in the area tacos, sushi, pizza, the list goes on forever.  <br><br>FYI the sushi place on the opposite end of the shopping center has never let us down maybe thinking twice about coming back here.

&#34;Tall Shawn&#34; is the man! I work in restaurants &amp; he&#39;s one of the best servers I&#39;ve ever had the pleasure of meeting. Very kind, attentive, &amp; full of good energy. :) I will definitely be back

Cheesecake Factory is usually a dependable place to eat. I figured I&#39;d try them again after the fiasco at the Green Valley one, where I felt bias from our server, which was evident from the poor service and lack of water refills and bread, compared to the tables surrounding us. A bit of a slap on the face to see them patronizing the ladies sitting next to you with the attentive service. Kind of overt if you ask me. Normally my dad tips really well too but he had it with this kind of service. I tip 15-20% but he tips 30-40%, sometimes 100%. So back to this location. I ordered spaghetti.<br><br>Sorry, nothing exciting here. Just had a craving for plain old spaghetti and giant meatballs. Which is what I got, fat meatballs and spaghetti that was cooked right. The sauce is salty enough and you get a heaping plate of noodles that can feed two. And the server treated us like everyone else, as in didn&#39;t tell us that they didn&#39;t have any rolls and then bring it out to the next table 3 minutes later, or the table across from them a few minutes later. Yeah, we got the point. You won&#39;t catch me going to Green Valley Cheesecake Factory again. Generally, I always liked CF, from Caesars to Boca Park to GV, to every other one I tried in LA and Seattle. But certain experiences ruin a place for you. CF is good, but in this town, there&#39;s a ton of places you can go to get pretty much the same thing.

It&#39;s been a few weeks since I brought he kids to our go to place Cheescake factory and I was deeply disappointed with the service that we received. I had asked for bread numerous times and 15 mins later there is no bread. Our appetizers came and ordered a second batch of appetizers and yet still no bread. I know that it&#39;s busy but at least have someone come to our table and explain why there is no bread coming. We&#39;ll see how this will end tonight.
Love love love this place... Mike Lopez is the best waiter. We come at least once a day

Food is good. Waiting service is grand. Did the egg roll sampler today along with the tuna tar tar nice taste small portion. Also had the lettuce wraps which have some proper chicken. <br><br>Now the harsh reality about this particular cheesecake compared to outlets or forum, it&#39;s too dam busy I mean WTH. The hostess staff is the wildest group of ppl I would definitely manage peoples expectations better if I were in their shoes. If your going to eat here your only options are half an hour before they close or at 2 or 3 pm at any other time of day it&#39;s a mess people all over the place just pandamonium

Good service. Tyler was good. 1 water refill, but other than that we were taken care of. Food is subpar. No bread basket at all, but I guess that&#39;s ok. We brought the kids for the first time &amp; they loved the cheesecake, but their meals were just &#34;alright&#34;. Honey had the soup, sandwich &amp; salad. Sandwich was piled high, but lacked flavor. Salad was standard Caesar. The soup was good, but we didn&#39;t find any of the artichoke that was supposedly in there. Cobb salad had way too much egg &amp; not enough lettuce. I hate that they let people dining in park in the spaces designated for take out...that&#39;s a pet peeve of mine. Overall for the price it wasn&#39;t great.

Went here for lunch, waiter was was nice, food was okay until my husband took a bite of mushroom and found cardboard. How the heck did cardboard get into his food? The manager apologized, offered a new plate, and took off the charge for the cheesecakes.

We had a gift card to use, so we arrived around 6pm on a Wednesday for dinner and they were packed! I was so surprised, but we waited patiently for our table and it wasn&#39;t too bad of a wait, about 10 minutes. <br><br>We were seated and service was friendly and attentive considering how busy the restaurant was. Refills were plentiful and food was ok. I ordered the bang bang chicken and shrimp and although I was a little disappointed with my food choice, everyone else seemed to enjoy their food and portions were more than sufficient. There was so much food, we had plenty of leftovers to take home with us. <br><br>I always remember the limoncello cake from previous visits, so we ordered that to share as well. Not as great as I remembered, but still solid and everyone was happy with the meal. Great service and pretty ok food for a chain restaurant. I&#39;d definitely come back with a gift card or for happy hour in the future.

Love Cheesecake Factory! Aside from the food the cheesecake is perfection! I got OREO, which was to die for!<br><br>I usually go to the one in Henderson but we went to this location after my cousins graduation with my family &amp; our server Katrina C. Or Katarina (sorry! If I spelled it wrong) was ON POINT TO THE TEE, with checking on us &amp; refills on drinks without even us asking! That definitely made it a better experience thank you!<br><br>Anyways all of our food was great I got the four cheese pasta with chicken which was so good, my sisters boyfriend got the chicken bellagio, my sister got the miso salmon &amp; my cousin got the chicken marsala. All great dishes &amp; a wonderful night!

Came back for dinner because we&#39;re big fans of the small plate menu, which allows us to try lots of different things.<br><br>On this visit, we grubbed on our usual Vietnamese Tacos(AKA Bao), Samosas, Beet Salad, Pear and Blue Cheese Flatbread, and tried a new item, Roasted Shishito Peppers, which was a VERY generous serving. How generous? 45 peppers! (Ichiza gives you even less per order) As always, everything was great and very filling. <br><br>Stop in and try their small plates, you don&#39;t know what you&#39;re missing out on!....ALOHA!!!!<br><br>YELP 365 CHALLENGE-(82/365) &#34;Tapas at the Factory&#34;

Located in Boca Park, we had a late dinner here on a Friday night.  Main reason for us coming here...I was hungry and wanted something that I was low on calories, higher on protein, and close to where we were currently at.  Plus, the food at Cheesecake Factory is as consistent as it gets. Yes, I said lower on calories and The Cheesecake Factory has a special menu for this.  Drumroll...their SkinnyLicious menu. In the last 4 months, I&#39;ve been to a Cheesecake Factory about 5 times.  Every single time, my meal of choice comes from their healthier options.  This menu has a range from chicken breast, steak, tacos, some fish, and turkey.  Of course, there&#39;s a bunch of salad options, but I don&#39;t do salads. I tried their White Chicken Chili with Brown Rice.  I was surprised that my meal was less than 500 calories.  It was damn good.  It&#39;s basically a lighter chili sauce, some brown rice mixed in, and a whole lot of chicken breast pieces.  Loved it!<br><br>As for the service, it didn&#39;t start off too well.  It was a Friday night and we got seated right away.  But it took forever for our server to come and take our order. I had to give the eye to one of the employees walking by just to get service.  Within 5 minutes, service is what we got.  By the way, service was great from then on. <br><br>Overall, I&#39;m still giving Cheesecake Factory 4 stars because of their SkinnyLicious Menu and familiar dishes. <br><br>PS:  Hard to say no to the bread basket.  Their brown bread is phenomenal.<br><br>YELP PERSONAL CHALLENGE 2013 - (474/500)

The menu here is like a JC Penney catalog. It has so many options on it that I always have a hard time deciding what to order. Even though this place is big and offers plenty of seating inside and outdoors, it is always packed. Parking can be a pain but I have never had to wait that long for a table. Our server (name escapes me sorry dude) was always checking on us and friendly. <br><br>Started out with Stuffed Mushrooms. I have had these with clam or sausage before...but these had a blend of cheese, garlic and herbs in a wine sauce. We got 6 with the order and they did not last long. I used some of the bread that was brought to the table to soak up the last bit of the wine sauce. <br><br>For dinner I had a Macaroni &amp; Cheese Burger. This was a risky choice...I knew I would either love it or hate it. The burger had fried macaroni balls and cheese sauce on it. I asked them to leave the veggies off my burger this time because I did not know if fried mac &amp; cheese and tomatoes, onion or lettuce go good together or not. The burger was very cheesy and I enjoyed it. The fries it came with were hot and good. The side of ranch I requested was nasty though. It does not even taste like ranch but something bitter and gross and the color was more clear than white. My wife had half of a chicken salad sandwich and cup of tortilla soup. She enjoyed her sandwich and loved the soup but didn&#39;t like her salad due to the same nasty ranch being on it. I had half of her soup and liked it as well. We both left fulfilled and happy and had no room for cheesecake.

I ordered the Bristo shrimp pasta tonight and a fresh lemonade. The pasta and the sauce was on-point, but I was disappointed to find most of my shrimp was burnt black. The waiter was kind enough, when he noticed me picking out the shrimp to get me new shrimp... However at this point I was already done eating and boxing up my left-overs. The fresh lemonade was very sweet-- fair warning if you are hoping for tart lemonade. <br>Overall, the service was great and the atmosphere is always nice; it just depends what you decide to order from the extensive menu if you will really enjoy the while experience. <br>BUT- I am disowning The Cheesecake Factory yet... I have had some really great meals with them. ( Like the beet &amp; goat cheese salad and their non-alcoholic piña colada) B

This place is beautiful and tonight my husband and I wanted to celebrate our birthdays. I asked the host if she can give us a nice table because we were celebrating and I&#39;m a big woman ok. When we walk to the table they gave us this dinky itty bitty table when I asked for a nice table not a child&#39;s table. Anyway she rolled her eyes at me and I walked out. You want super rude service go here

My wife and I love the cheesecake factory. Whenever we want to treat ourselves, we go here. Now there has been an on going problem that we face every time we come here. When it is just the wife and I, they will ALWAYS sit us at the two person, tiny a$$ table. In between two other people.  We make it a point to come when it&#39;s slow so we can get better seating. Normally we don&#39;t say anything and just sit down, but today we just got tired of it.  We finally asked for a booth, and of course they had open booths to sit us in. <br><br>Besides the seating issues we have every time we go to a cheesecake factory, we love the food and will not stop coming for the food. Unless, the seating issue gets so bad.

I&#39;mI legit LOVE the Cheesecake Factory! that being said my 20 something dollar steak i just got delivered is sort of a joke. 3 tiny bites?? I&#39;m confused is this an 20 dollar appetizer or???? i can say iy is at least warm
Really disappointed with the food today, so looking forward to that cheesecake to finish a good meal. Needless to say no one from the table ordered dessert

Normally when me and my boyfriend come here, we just sit at the bar, and now I know why. We came here with a group of 7 for a birthday, and the service was horrible. If it was this bad for a Wednesday, I hate to imagine what it&#39;s like on a weekend. Our server, Daniel, meant well (and kept mentioning how hard he was working and how fast he was walking), but a meal should only take 2 hours when the guest wants it to. We waited for bread, we waited for water and were only refilled once, we waited for boxes, we waited for cake, we waited for boxes for the cake, we waited for the check, it was a lot of waiting. We basically had to bus our own table numerous times, meanwhile noticing many servers and bussers standing around chatting with one another.  I could understand if everyone was busy, but it seemed like Daniel was the only one running ragged. Other tables around us were bussed and other servers were walking leisurely and checking on their tables regularly. Not sure if it&#39;s a Daniel issue (he did apologize, but too little too late) or a CF issue, but something is off here.

Absolutely terrible. It took 45 mins to get our entrees and they all came to the table separately. My entree was cold from probably sitting in the window too long. Just an awful experience. I never write reviews but I felt compelled to have to vent.

I came in here for dinner with my husband last night as we are avid Cheesecake Factory lovers and diners. I ordered my normal, chicken piccata with no dairy since i have an allergy  (but oil is fine) and the server kept telling me it couldn&#39;t be done. I told her i always order it and it can be and to please check with the kitchen (i was just asking for them to use oil rather than butter and cream.) she told me it wouldn&#39;t taste good and i should order the chicken bellagio instead since that&#39;s easier to do dairy free. I should have stuck to my guns since i know it can be done and it seemed like she was trying to be helpful so i said ok that&#39;s fine I&#39;ll try the new dish. 20 minutes go by and no bread i see another server walk by and ask them if they can grab it for us as we hadn&#39;t seen our server since then. The other server brings us bread and our server walks up and is semi snippy and said the wheat bread was in the oven that&#39;s why we didn&#39;t get bread (still she could have offered us white or at least communicated with us.) then another 30 minutes go by at this point I&#39;m like where is our food this is ridiculous it was 10:30 pm so not dinner rush hour. Our server let me know they made my dish but they realized at the end there was cheese in the basil pasta they make the chicken bellagio with and were remaking it. I was happy they caught that but annoyed af this point because i really wanted my normal order. She brings us the food. I eat the two thinly sliced grilled chicken breasts with the dish but the pasta is disgusting so i wait and i wait to let her know i don&#39;t like it and she never comes back.
