I flag the hostess down (at this point it&#39;s been 15 min since the food was dropped) she gets the server and i could tell the server was just annoyed and ready to go hone and she said no problem I&#39;ll twke the pasta off but I&#39;ll just charge you for the chicken. At this point i was ready to leave as we had now been in the restaurant two hours and i was tired and a manager never came up to our table to inquire about the long wait on the food or why i sent it back so we just left but now that it&#39;s a new day I&#39;m really thinking about what a bad experience we had. I&#39;m not at all worried about the $5 chicken charge but i really feel since the waitress wouldn&#39;t check with the kitchen on if chicken picatta could be made the way i always get it, and the long wait on the food, she was just being catty with me to charge for the chicken. Will I return to Cheesecake in the future? Sure this was the only bad experience I&#39;ve ever had here in my dozens of times being here but i probably won&#39;t be back for awhile. In today&#39;s world where a ton of people have different food allergies, you should train your staff better on how to deal with them rather than acting annoyed and inconvenieneced by them. For some of us, our food allergies are deadly.

We were staying in Las Vegas strip but went out to Red Rock Canyon for the day and used YELP to find this location away from the busy strip before heading back to our hotel. <br>We were at this restaurant on 11-23-2015 at about 5:30pm. <br>We had decent service with one issue that was poorly addressed by our server. My little one ordered grilled chicken from the kids menu . It came with grilled chicken mashed potatoes and steamed carrots.  I reached over to try one of his carrots and it tasted funny to me. I thought it was my imagination but I noticed he left them all on his plate at the end of our meal. He said they  were not good. <br>I reached over and tasted one again and indeed they were rancid. I smelled the pile on his plate and yes they were rancid indeed. <br>I am not one to complain about things and my main concern was that the restaurant would serve them to other patrons. My wife let the waitress know in a non defensive manner about the carrots and she rudely  offered to replace them with another vegetable but we were not asking for carrot replacement, we were all done with our meals. <br>She was very nonchalant about issue and mumbled she would take them to the chef????? Then came back and dropped off our bill and never apologized or let her superiors know or chef or whoever she reports to. Never said a word and that was it. Picked up credit card and dropped it off hastily after she charged it. <br>We noticed they outline tip suggestion, our bill was 92 dollars and suggested tip was 16 dollars. My wife and I decided to leave without tipping. We have never in 15 years being married not left a tip. I worked for auto customer service for a long time and I appreciate tips and good service. <br>The decent thing to do would be to apologize and say that she has let the chef or her manager know and kindly apologized and removed charge. <br>The non tipping was far more than 6.50, kids meal price, the restaurant would have been out of. <br>Poor customer service.

Wow! I never anticipated having a bad meal at the Cheesecake Factory! But it happened today. There were three of us and we each ordered salads. My sister ordered a vegetable salad and myself and our other companion both ordered a Cobb salad. Each of the salads looked like something from the bottom of a night worth of kitchen lettuce scraps. Drenched in oil and vinegar dressing with no seasoning . The chicken were tiny scraps as well and few of them. I found myself searching the salad I am so accustomed to CFs sumptuous and flavorful Cesar salad. The egg had been pulverized into crumbs. You may wonder why we did not send these salads back! I actually got the wrong dressing as I had requested honey and mustard though it was delivered as such. The waiter was excellent. And I am sure he would have addressed the situation but honestly I was so surprised by this meal.. I was home before I was honest with myself that this was unacceptable. Was this unexpected outcome.. a new chef in the kitchen.. or simply salads on a budget. None of us ordered dessert.. that alone was a first! I ate a delicious meal here just weeks ago for my birthday.

I came here with my friends and it didn&#39;t take long to get seated. I love their extensive menu. I ordered a flatbread off the Skinnylicious menu and it was delicious! Dessert was great as well. Our server was fantastic. Great service and great food - I highly recommend this location.

Cheesecake!!!!! But they are not just doing desserts. They have a full menu. First time I ate here was couple weeks ago since my boss(thanks boss) gave me a gift card. I have had their cheesecake from friends who picked up dessert for birthdays and such.<br><br>It&#39;s perfect for families and for those date nights. It can be noisy but when me and my girlfriend arrived the waitress sat us in the corner and we felt all alone. <br><br>My girlfriend went with some basic chicken fingers but I did the Shepard&#39;s pie and boy was it sooo good. It was full of flavor and perfect for a cold day. The serving was soooo big which is not a bad thing. I ate all of it and when it came to dessert time the slice of cheesecake was huge!! I got the Reese&#39;s peanut butter cheesecake and it was a perfect for a sweet tooth! My girlfriend couldn&#39;t finish hers but I ate all of mine ha ha.<br><br>Edit: I can&#39;t believe I forgot that we started with mini crab cakes. They were good and this is from someone who doesn&#39;t eat much crab except for sushi.<br><br>The food and service was good. The prices were not bad for the amount of food you get. Definitely returning!

My partner and I eat here at least 2-3 times a month and absolutely love it every time. We typically start with the crispy crab wontons. They are amazing, filled with crab, green onions and of course, cream cheese. Although they are deep fried, the sweet chili sauce on the side makes them irresistible. Bread service is always great. We usually only ask for the wheat bread with butter, but we were introduced to the white bread with olive oil. AMAZING. The fiancé had a flat bread with dollops of ricotta, and I had a Caesar salad with my favorite carbonara pasta!<br>Desert was missed because we were so stuffed but our waiter Sean was absolutely amazing. Our drinks were never refilled but his personality was excellent. He remembered everything we told him without having to write it all down in a book like most people do.<br>That was pretty impressive because we are pretty picky.

Food was great but I have to give 2 stars for the service.  The server Had to be the worst server me and my husband have ever encountered.  I&#39;d like to start off by saying I found a hair in my drink. The server, Dina E. Saw me pulling it out and said &#34;is that yours or mine ?&#34; I told her it was not mine and she then said &#34;it was probably mine, would you like another drink?&#34;  Of course I would like another drink! I mean, who would want to continue drinking it with a hair in it?! She never apologized , nothing. I felt very disrespected at the fact that she asked me if I would like another drink. I don&#39;t mind paying for what I ordered , I just feel like any other server would have at least apologized for the hair if not give me the drink on the house. Just the fact that she just casually said &#34;it must have been mine&#34; and never apologized was not okay.  If I was any other customer, I could have made a scene. Then, we ordered an appetizer.  We waited about 30 minutes for it .  8 minutes after , our food came out after a 45 minute wait total. It defeated the purpose of even ordering an appetizer.  The experience with her was just terrible. Being a frequent Cheesecake Factory visitor , I don&#39;t think I will ever come to this location again. Everyone else was great but Dina E. Made our experience horrible. Never in my life have I left such a bad tip.  I feel like she didn&#39;t even deserve one to begin with. Being in the customer service field myself , I didn&#39;t argue with her , nor say anything. I just left it as is.  Being in the position that she is in, she should work on her customer service. After all, that&#39;s what a food server is about SERVING a customer not just food but an experience and honestly I am not a happy customer.

This is probably my favorite place. Always busy in lunch time on weekends, but I never wait more than 15 minutes. The service is excellent and always fast even in busy days. Don&#39;t forget to try chicken bellagio, it&#39;s the best.

Worst Restaurant service I&#39;ve ever dealt with, I would implore anyone to never dine at this Cheesecake Factory. Our waitress was absolutely horrible, we order the Southwest Grilled chicken sandwich to share, it was suppose to have avocado, after waiting 10 mins for her to return we asked for avocado, it took her another 6 mins to bring the avocado. After taking a bite I no longer wanted the sandwich, it was cold and hard from sitting for 15 mins. She never offered for us to speak to the manager or compensation, her excuse was I&#39;m sorry the kitchen is still recovering from Mother&#39;s Day. I will never dine at Cheesecake Factory again

I went on September 12, 2017 @ 7:00. After using the free valet service I walked into the restaurant and asked about sitting outside for 1. The lady up front said it would be a 10 minute wait. I said ok I&#39;ll wait. Once I was called and seated outside. The waitress kept walking by 15 times with only 2 other parties outside at the time. At this point I was getting pissed. But I continued to wait till a lady finally Came (can&#39;t remember her name) and took my food &amp; drink order. Once my food came out she never came by to check on me and by this time there was only 1 other party seated outside. I kept waving her down but she never stopped to see what I needed. After a haft hour I finally was able to get her and asked about getting a Togo box and the dessert menu. 20 minutes went by no Togo box or dessert menu. Another 20 minutes went by finally she brings me the menu and Togo box. Then another 20 minutes she finally came back and took my dessert order for Togo. She immediately brought me my bill and told me the order for the cheesecake is in it will be about 5 minutes. Well 5 minutes turned into a 50 minute dessert for Togo. Finally left the restaurant at 9:30. <br><br>I did come into contact with a manger (heavy guy) that could care less. He pretty much said here&#39;s the corporate number have a great day. <br><br>Come on 2 hours of just sitting and receiving bad service? NEVER AGAIN. CORPORATE WILL BE CONTRACTED.

My husband and I drove over 30 minutes to eat at this restaurant. We were seated fairly quickly. The Potstickers we good. My husband entree, Steak Diane was delicious. However, my Chicken Marsala was so dry...very dry! I couldn&#39;t taste the Marsala at all. It seemed to not have any seasoning whatsoever. The butterfly noodles used for this entree was a horrible choice. As it dried all of the seasoning. Just gross! Will never order that entree again!!!

My family and I go to Cheesecake factory often and we always go to this location. I am very surprised this location only has a 3 and a half stars.<br><br>I just finished brunch with my family. We had Matt as our server and he was fantastic! He was prompt with our requests and he had a positive attitude. Thank you!

My husband and I stopped on Valentine&#39;s Day to pick up a slice of cheese cake for our dessert. I got Adam&#39;s peanut butter .  So disappointed in the size ! It looked nothing like the one displayed in the case !  About half the size! My husband&#39;s slice was small also .This is horrible! They must cut pieces from another cake in another case. Think twice about ordering a slice to go from this restaurant !

I&#39;ve gone here twice in the last two weeks to grab some food to-go, and both times I was screwed on the portions. Last time they gave me a chicken-tender-sized &#34;salmon filet&#34; with my $15 salad (photo attached) and this time they forgot to add the salad to the Mexican Tortilla salad (no photo attached, because hungry). Granted it&#39;s my responsibility to double check my food before I pay and leave but I really shouldn&#39;t have to do that, ESPECIALLY when the cashier checked it right in front of me. There&#39;s supposed to be a certain level of trust there but hey, silly me right? I thought someone would be paying enough attention to my order to at the very least give me what I paid for. How do you forget the salad in a salad dish? I&#39;m not convinced that it&#39;s an honest mistake when this sort of thing has happened to me twice in one month at this location. Not only did you screw me out of $30ish, you broke my heart Cheesecake. That&#39;s so not tight.

Worst &#34;take-out&#34; service EVER!  Hold times on weekends (especially Fridays) are over 10 minutes!  As I write this, I&#39;ve officially been on hold for 19 minutes and 10 seconds. I wrote this review because this is the 3rd time it has happened. Regretfully there isn&#39;t another Cheesecake Factory in the area, that&#39;s why we have to go to this location. Should just drive to the Strip! It&#39;ll be quicker than dealing with this horrendous service. Could we go somewhere else for dinner? Yes, but that&#39;s not the point of this review and I&#39;m craving Portobello Fries...<br><br>Sure, we&#39;re calling during the &#34;peak&#34; hours, but isn&#39;t that all restaurants on weekends? No other restaurant in Summerlin has this problem in our experience. Since this is happening EVERY weekend, isn&#39;t that an indicator that perhaps they need more staffing? Every time I call, they always say: &#34;Let me get the manager to help take orders.&#34;  Duh! Shouldn&#39;t they already be involved? <br><br>Finally got Cesar on the phone (total of 21 minutes and some wait). The 2nd star was for his great attitude and exemplary service (thanks Cesar).  Extremely apologetic although not his fault.  He&#39;s the only reason I proceeded with the order and was comped a cheesecake. If they keep it up, there&#39;s only so much cheesecake to give away before they run out with their subpar service. <br><br>I&#39;ll be forwarding this to corporate.

The Cheesecake Factory has something for almost everyone, which I suppose is its appeal. It&#39;s like a &#34;fancy&#34; Applebee&#39;s or Chili&#39;s, except it doesn&#39;t have junk cluttering the walls and the menu options sound appetizing. <br><br>I dined here on a Thursday evening around dinner time. Unsurprisingly, there were plenty of people ahead of us waiting to be seated, because Cheesecake Factory is just too cool to take reservations -- first come, first serve, peasants. <br><br>Once seated, we ordered the avocado egg rolls as a starter. Always a solid appetizer; though the sweet tamarind sauce might be an acquired taste for some. For my entree I ordered the grilled chicken tostada salad. When it arrived, I noticed it was missing the side of vinaigrette dressing, as well as the avocado cream and sour cream. It was unfortunate that our waitress had to make two visits to retrieve the missing items. The salad was quite huge and could easily be shared between two people. Can&#39;t say this was one of the best salads that I&#39;ve ordered from here. To top off dinner, I got the kahlua cocoa chocolate cheesecake, which hit the spot and made up for the salad mishap. <br><br>Off-peak hours are always the best time to visit, if you don&#39;t mind waiting. And if you do mind, fortunately there many quality restaurants in the area that you could go to instead.

Excellent service! The selection is overwhelming and I couldn&#39;t decide which cheesecake I wanted. I ended up ordering 2 slices for me and 2 slices for my husband. We had our dog out in the car and I asked the folks at the counter if they had anything dog friendly and they put whipped cream in a plastic cup for him! (Our order was to go.) Shoutout to Jelani B. (Jay) and Luz H. For your pawsome service!

I am giving this review a 4 star based on over all experience. We showed up around 8 and didn&#39;t get a seat for at least 35 min after they told us 20. That&#39;s fine because the place was packed and there was hardly any room to stand. When I got to my booth it looked nice at a glance but then I found left over lettuce and crumbs on my table not a big deal either except my clean silverware was left for me on this table uncovered. Anyways I&#39;ve been here before so it&#39;s not a big deal to me anyways. Our server was this character named Sean. And he was extremely entertaining and did his job well. We were rly here for dessert so what we did was ordered 3 appetizers and then two wonderful cheesecakes. Yum love both of them. Anyways I&#39;ll be back hopefully when it&#39;s not too busy

It was prom night and bridal party night so fairly busy, yet our server was ver accommodating, seating us (just me &amp; my husband on a quiet night out) in a fairly secluded booth for privacy.  The bread was mostly great.  The pumpernickel was absolutely delicious but the sourdough (was that what it was) was too hard and dry to bite into. No points lost there however, as some people enjoy crusty bread like that.<br><br>His kobe burger was cooked perfectly (he asked for rare) and my luau salad was consistently delicious, as it is whenever I get it. Always plenty to take home.<br><br>We ordered banana cream cheesecake and chocolate tuxedo cheesecake to go so I won&#39;t know how they are until later.<br><br>All in all a good experience. Friendly, accommodating staff (they happily brought us more bread when asked) and a comfortable environment. The music was a touch loud but I guess that&#39;s how most restsurants have it these days. It privides a bit of an auditory veil between us &amp; other diners.

Yelp 100 Challenge 2013- 31/100<br><br>Yes, in a city full of amazing bars, local eats, and world famous restaurants--- I chose the Cheesecake Factory as our spot to enjoy a Saturday night dinner.  Why??? Well, I know exactly what to expect when I come here.  And that&#39;s EXACTLY why the Cheesecake Factory hit the spot.<br><br>This restaurant was very similar to every other Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve visited in the past. It was tastefully decorated, extremely busy, and very noisy.  Our server was on top of her game and was extremely attentive and friendly. The food was tasty and the portions were HUGE! We ordered a slice of cheesecake to go, which was fantastic.<br><br>As chain restaurants go, I think Cheesecake Factory is pretty good. As long as I still eat cheesecake, I will be returning (especially for their Pineapple Upside-Down Cheesecake).
The food was good. Service a a little slow. Mashed potatoes were cold when they came out. The cheesecake were good as always. Salted Carmel, lemon raspberry, white chocolate raspberry.

We went to have a nice family dinner and I ordered the Skinnylicious chicken pasta and it wasn&#39;t so skinny, it seemed oily, my husband got the shrimp pasta and had way too much tomatoes, my nephew got the Mac and cheese burger and it was dry and didn&#39;t have any cheese , the calamari appetizer was way over cooked, my daughter&#39;s bistro shrimp pasta was different than when we&#39;ve had in the past , seems as though the the entries are way overpriced for the quality of food, pretty disappointed as this was one of our fave restaurants, will most likely not come back for a long time.

I was here only for dessert but i&#39;m really upset to miss dinner. Everything was amazing but i wanted to try their main courses because they looked amazing. Our server Daniel is the one of the best (no doubt!) he took care of my table perfectly. Thanks for everything...

Love coming here for dinner. When we first walked in the wait was 15 minutes. Went to the bar and had a drink while we waited. Had a margarita which was good. For dinner we ordered the chicken enchiladas which you can never go wrong with... And my fiancé had a vegan salad. Food came out with no delay and the server was very attentive. If you can&#39;t decide what to eat for lunch or dinner this is the place to go with plenty of variety of foods and drinks to choose from!

The food was excellent, however the service was not. The waitress came over to our table once and didn&#39;t return for another 30 minutes or so to see if we needed anything such as refills on drinks. When it was time to pay the check, we paid in cash and the waitress never returned with our change. She assumed that the rest of that change was for her tip which it wasn&#39;t. We asked to speak to a manager about this issue but the manager never came to us. We will not be returning. Highly disappointed in the service we received today from here.

In response to the individual that responded to my comment. If you didn&#39;t notice, the picture I posted along with my comment was that of a drink napkin that had been given to us that was, in fact used prior to our receiving it. Specifically, the napkin had notes of some s1ort written on it. We expect that the cheesecake factory uses a laundering service for their napkins because they are quality linen. Thanks for the response though!

In the past I have always enjoyed Cheesecake Factory.  Good food and portion size.  This particular location has really lowered my opioon.  In the last several visits I have had to send food back.  The food is just not up to what I typically get from Cheesecake Factory.  The bread is overcooked, pizza is raw and has very little ingredients, stuffed mushrooms are small and over cooked, no croutons on the Cesar salad,  chicken on lettuce wraps were rubbery and gamey tasting, things are left off what is stated on the menu, etc.  While they are nice to try and give you another dish, by that time you are put off by the quality and really do not want anything else.  It&#39;s too bad, as most location are pretty good for a &#34;chain restaurant&#34;, however this location really has some issue in the kitchen.  To end on a good note...Cheesecake is always good, but probably due to the fact it is made elsewhere and frozen and brought it.  Sorry about the negative review, however after so many attempt to try and get something good, that has just not been the case at this particular location. :(

The negative reviews here are pretty accurate. I&#39;m glad my gf was open to eating somewhere else and just coming here for dessert.  As many have stated, slow service. What frustrated me and really killed the moment for us both was that we ordered some nice coffees to go along with our cheesecake, and they were served in regular pint cups.  Wtf is that about? I&#39;ve never felt so snobby in my life, but you will see, every where you go you will get coffee in a mug, and now I know from this experience that the cup makes such a difference.  You either burned your mouth drinking from the straw, or drink only foam drinking from the cup. A pint glass JUST DOESN&#39;T WORK.

Sorry for picking a chain restaurant as my favorite...but the sheer selection and consistency at every location is what keeps me coming back.  The food is good large and priced right.  The cocktails are a tad expensive but good!

Cheesecake is in the name, so you know it will be good!<br><br>This is a great restaurant chain.  This location is huge with seating both inside and out.  They have the usual 30 page menu, so you will definitely find at least 1 thing, if not 10 that you want to try for lunch/dinner.  <br><br>The food tastes great as well.  My favorites are all appetizers.  I usually get 2 apps and enjoy a small feast.  My absolute favorites are the Tex Mex Eggrolls, Sweet Corn Tamale Cakes, and the Buffalo Wontons.   All are winners and I recommend these to everyone who loves yumminess on a plate.<br><br>If you are in need of more food than some appetizers, you are in luck! They have everything from tasty pizzas, yummy sandwiches, and delicious entrees that could feed a small village.  If you can name it, Cheesecake Factory probably has it on their menu.<br><br>The desserts are fantastic here too!  I mean cheesecake is in the name of the place, so you know the cheesecake will be great!  The also have other desserts like cake and pie, but I have never tried them because I always go for cheesecake! DUH!  My favorite choices are the Chocolate Tuxedo, Dulce de Leche, and Key Lime cheesecake.  The Pumpkin cheesecake is fabulous, but you can only get that one in the fall.<br><br>The service is usually great and you can usually be sat pretty quickly, due to the massive amount of tables available.  It is a very consistent restaurant.  It seems no matter when you go, the food will always be the same.  They run this place like a well oiled machine and it is a great place to eat.

Went here with my bf after the Halloweentown pumpkin patch since it was within walking distance. I really loved the ambience of this place, exterior and interior. We came on a Monday night and were seated right away although there were larger parties ahead of us. I got the spicy cashew chicken and my bf got the carne asada steak medallions. Both were very good, especially the first bite of my spicy cashew chicken. It had strong flavorings but wasn&#39;t as spicy as the name. My server knew so he brought out chili peppers for me, which kinda helped! It was good but got kind of salty after a while so I decided to take it home for lunch the next day. We also wanted dessert and since the place is called Cheesecake Factory we opted for a slice of regular cheesecake. It was pretty sweet but eating it with the whipped cream given definitely complemented the taste! Overall, I would come back and maybe try the other dishes!

Wow... My best experiences ever at a Cheesecake Factory... <br><br>It was a wonderful night &amp; a great experience, thanks to our server... I have to call the restaurant &amp; get her name as that is something I many times fall short about... Names:( <br><br>So I called her &#34;Blue Eyes&#34; during our dinner experience as she is a brown haired girl with brilliant blue eyes. She was very good natured... She smiled and laughed when I called her that and seemed to be ok with my nickname.  &#34;Blue Eyes&#34; arrived at our table immediately after we were seated &amp; she took our beverage order... She was very welcoming &amp; understanding as we explained that we were waiting for one more person who was joining us for dinner. So many times, servers can be put off by this... &#34;Blue Eyes&#34; was not having any issue with us having a late addition to our table.  <br><br>After we enjoyed our first adult beverage, which was delivered to us exactly as ordered... I decided that for my next beverage, I would prefer mine without ice.  &#34;Blue Eyes&#34; was so pleasant and non-resistant.  She brought my drink out exactly as I had requested it. She was helpful &amp; conversational, while respecting our privacy.  She made great suggestions and was so encouraging about several fished which we asked about.  <br><br>The kale salad was scrumptious!!! We also ordered the Thai lettuce chicken platter. It is a Taste Blast and we actually ordered a second portion.  Bang Bang Shrimp/Chicken is always sensational here, but we were stuffed and did not have any room for more food! <br><br>An ahi tuna carpaccio was another delightful, tasty treat.  Whatever sauce they used was lavished on top with some beautiful slices of avocado &amp; cucumber thinly sliced on the side. <br><br>Desert was of course cheesecake... I know the many flavors of cheesecake are supposed to delight me... This was chocolate &amp; not my taste, although everyone else loved it.  Me... I Love their plain New York type cheesecake with some cherries or strawberries on top.  Yum classically delicious. <br><br>We had a Lovely time and I will post this as soon as I find out the name of our server who we will ask for when we return to this great local restaurant. <br><br>Ahhhhhh.... Her name is a Mystery... I called there &amp; the hostess who answered the phone was zero help.  My bad for not getting her name:(

The Avocado Appetizer if phenomenal! The reason for the 3 star review is due to the wait time when we came in with the family at 7PM. We were told it was 20mim wait, however after the 40min wait we decided to go up to the hostess and were seated upon complaining. Upon going to our table, we saw so many tables that were empty and ready to serve hungry customers.<br><br>The food was great, however like most places the pasta dishes are served with about 2lbs of pasta and 5 pieces of chicken. The best part of the meal were the appetizers, the dessert, and the service.

I&#39;ve been meaning to try this place for years and when National Cheesecake Day with half priced cheesecake came up, that was as good a time as any!  I went on a Friday afternoon and the the dining area had a lot of people, almost packed.  I wasn&#39;t too fond of the way seating is done here (as I felt I was in the couple&#39;s food next table over), the waitress was really attentive and friendly.  I ordered the Chicken Bellagio and it is delicious!  It&#39;s well seasoned, creamy and the meat is tender, not chewy.  For dessert I had the chocolate chip cookie dough cheesecake, which is served with a generous side of whipped topping and chocolate chips.  I can&#39;t wait to come back again for another meal!

Always a great dinning experience, but I don&#39;t frequent as much since they discontinued the CHICKEN THAI PASTA! Food was good, especially the new Cheesecake, Salted Caramel, great call Jessica N.! YOU were awesome!
We absolutely love this place! We usually stop by for Happy hour because we like to sit at the bar. Service, food and ambience is 5 stars

This place is so yummy to not give it a good rating. Well not only that, but Cheesecake Factory&#39;s menu is just perfect. Literally has so many variety of items.<br>Want a burger? They got it.<br>Chinese? Got that too.<br>Pasta? You bet so.<br><br>Not only that, but they have AVOCADO ROLLS. One of the only places I know that has this. Just the best. Then to top it off, you get cheesecake for dessert! Just to finish some of the best dinner options ever, you get TWO pages of types of cheesecakes. LIKE,... WHAT? I think yes!

The worst Cheesecake Factory location I have ever been to. Food was distasteful. Staff was rude, also, when I first walked inside, it wasn&#39;t very busy, however it took about 5 mins for someone to come to the hostess booth to seat us. Bathrooms were filthy. There was poo and period stains on the toilet, a dirty diaper on the floor, no toilet seat covers, no toilet paper, and the pad/tampon trash was full, you can see the bloody applicators. Granted customers left the restroom dirty, but it didn&#39;t seem as if they were checking up on the restrooms at all. I was literally trying not to throw up my food while I was in the restroom as I was already gagging in disgust. I didn&#39;t even use the restroom. We went here for my friends birthday and I felt as if they thought we were lying about it being his birthday.

Excellent! <br>The menu is extensive, we had a hard time deciding what we wanted because so much of it looked delicious. <br>The kids pizza is huge! We got one kids pizza and our three kids split it with some left over. <br>Service was average. <br>And, of course, the cheesecake was amazing, we had the Hershey cheesecake.

The food and service was great as usual. The wait wasn&#39;t long at all. It was a nice night we chose to sit outside on the patio since it doesn&#39;t happen much. My big issue is they have a smoking bench right outside the patio (which was less than 10 ft from my table), so while trying to enjoy my dinner I had cigarette smoke blowing right in mine and my toddlers face. It totally ruined my dinner and I left feeling like I needed a breathing treatment.

We snuck out for some apps and, of course, to share a slice of cheesecake. I tried the new Cuban Roll app and it was amazing. <br><br>The service (Issac F) was just plain BAD. Waited forever for our food and then, the flatbread was cold, as was the chicken in our lettuce wrap. <br><br>After we ate, we stared at our dirty dishes for another 15 or 20 minutes. I was so pissed, I left without getting my cheesecake. <br><br>I&#39;m in a bad mood now. The front of the house definitely dropped the ball.

Called when they opened requesting reservation for 6...informed that they do not make reservations after 5. Which is fine. Except after 45 mins of waiting we saw a group who came after us be seated with the same amount of people as us. Numerical error I&#39;m sure, but considering it was a birthday celebration they made it less than pleasant. We even asked if they could allow us to sit on the patio, that was a no. Eventually we realized that our business was not appreciated or wanted. Thanks for the waste of time.
Pathetic &#34;specialty&#34; Fish &amp; Chips to go order on 1/12/17! $18 WASTED! Not even a busy night or weekend. I&#39;ll cook next time or go to BJ&#39;s!

I&#39;ve been coming to this restaurant for 15 years now (the one at boca park) and now for the past two years the servers seem like they don&#39;t give two craps about their customers. I&#39;ve had bad service for such a long time that I needed to get this off my chest. Because I have an accent as I am from a foreign countries, the servers act like they don&#39;t understand a WORD that I said and they also hav ether nerve to not come back to my table unless they&#39;re suggesting desserts. Y&#39;all should have a conference about this. What kind of people are you putting out to serve at your restaurants. Trash! Especially this red head that served me, she&#39;s the one that influenced me into righting this. :) I hope you guys see this. I swear, I&#39;m not a bad person, it&#39;s you guys that got on my nerves and your bad trained servers. Like MJ said, stop, get some help!

We came here for dinner tonight with family there were eight of us and on a Sunday night I knew there&#39;d be a little wait, they were busy so the hostess gave us a pager and told us they&#39;d have a table in 20 minutes. We waited, 20 minutes came and gone then it was 30 and 40 by this time my kids 7,6, and 16 months were growing tired, hangry and bored. It was a full hour of waiting and asking twice about our table. We were seeing people who walked in when we did and even after leaving having finished their dinner Very Disappointing! We get to our table and sit the silverware felt grainy almost dirty they took a while to take our order and even let ne&#39;er to get it a whole hour to be exact. By this time the restaurant wasn&#39;t busy at all so no excuses. All the food came out except my sons pizza which we had to ask for after it seemed like she was busy attending another table. Food was okay except my meatloaf had aluminum foil still on it!! I told the server she takes it to her boss then she offers me another their meal which is nice but I&#39;m not about to sit there another hour to get it. My daughters pasta was tasteless. I don&#39;t get it we go through the one at Caesars palace all the time and Never Ever had a problem there. I&#39;m sorry to say I won&#39;t be back to this location. This wasn&#39;t the first complaint from here which made it easier for me not to come back.

If I could give zero stars it would be fine with me.  I had never been to The Cheesecake Factory before so my son took me while I am visiting in Las Vegas.  What a HUGE disappointment overall.  Why do people rave about this place?  <br><br>Here are some examples:  Our table was 14&#34; away from the next person and the waitress had to crane her arm to serve each table stuffing her elbow in my son&#39;s face more than once.  Next I ordered the Fish N&#39; Chips, on the recommendation of the waitress, only to be served breaded cardboard over soggy chips.  I was hard pressed to find the dry fish anywhere on that plate.  The coleslaw was a jumble of minced vegetables with some kind of light dressing which did not resemble anything I&#39;ve ever known called coleslaw.  My son ordered a hamburger and out came this smallish, overcooked (even though he asked for mid-rare) dry burger, again with soggy fries. I could go on about the line-up of people waiting for a table while the staff were all talking and giggling and paying no attention to the patrons. Etc.<br><br>The whole experience was terrible and nothing like we expected.  We paid the bill and left, never to return to this or any location.  However, when I talked to my other son and told him of our ordeal he was shocked and said that it must be the location because he has had delicious food in the Denver location.  Just our luck!

First, we arrived at the restaurant and had to wait because the whole middle section of the restaurant wasn&#39;t &#34;open&#34;.  We were on our lunch hour so ended up sitting in the bar.  Tons of empty tables, just not &#34;open&#34; during lunch rush?  Didn&#39;t make sense to me.<br><br>Second, I ordered the Thai chicken tacos (letttuce wrapped) and bit into something that I thought was a bone.  I spit it out and it was a piece of wood.  The manager said &#34;Oh, that&#39;s the skewer that we use to hold the chicken together while it&#39;s cooking&#34;.  Nothing else, no apology, nothing.  <br><br>Then, when my friend paid - the waitress rounded off the bill and brought the change back but it was rounded off in the server&#39;s favor, not the customer&#39;s. <br><br>Love this restaurant.  Have been there tons and tons through the years, but I think service is going downhill.

Ahh Lets See.. The Cheesecake Factory Summerlin which is located in Boca Park was pretty decent! I usually have crazy dining experiences with this place however I started to learn what exactly to come for. If you are a Cheesecake Factory fan you know that the menu is insanely overwhelming so it really takes patience to figure out what you want. I was introduced to there short window happy hour (4pm-6pm) a few months ago and fell in love! The prices are so doable and you really can get a bang for your buck when it comes to both the food and the drinks! I went in to this location hoping it would be just as good as the other one that&#39;s in the Premium Outlets! It was! Not only is this one closer to home, but it&#39;s more fancy and the service was great! Our server was very friendly and attentive! She was even able to get me to try some new appetizers that I&#39;ve never tried before which was the nachos! That&#39;s always a good way to win me over as a customer when you can have great conversation, make suggestions and extremely attentive! Can you say Great Tip &#39;-) For these nachos to be just an appetizer you can easily share with another person. If you&#39;re like me and want to take advantage of the entire happy hour menu grab some friends and order everything on the menu. Ball out! My suggestion would be to go not right at 4PM which is the start of happy hour because finding a table top or even a table in the bar area is competitive. You literally have people preying on these tables waiting for people to get up so they can swoop on in like a hawk haha. I arrived around 5:15 PM which is when the first greedy crowd is about ready to wrap it on up!. After about 3 long island ice tea&#39;s in and pigging out on the spinach dip, crab dip, wontons, sliders, and nachos it was my time to GO! Thanks to the Summerlin team I now can add another happy hour spot to my list! Their runner up (Kona Grill) is walking distance and has a fantastic happy hour as well!

We went twice in 2 days for half off cheesecake for National Cheesecake Day.  They were located on Rampart Blvd in the Boca Park shopping center in Las Vegas.<br><br>The first day was with a Facebook email.  The second day was with no coupon.  We tried the Dulce de Leche, White Chocolate Caramel Macadamia Nut, Key Lime, and Kahlua® Cocoa Coffee Cheesecakes.  We took an Original cheesecake and a Red Velvet cake home.  i liked those two the best and would order them again.

We enjoy coming to Cheesecake Factory for there menu. There&#39;s something for everyone! Big wide variety of food. Food came out at a timely matter. Our server was friendly. We sat in the bar and ordered drinks while we waited for our table. We will be back!

This is second time to this cheesecake location and the family and I love it!!!  Appetizers were fantastic. Bacon grilled cheese so yum!!! Wife got the pineapple chicken shrimp and wouldn&#39;t stop gloating how good it is! Nephew ate all his pancake. I had the bacon bacon burger and barely could eat cheesecake!
The bread is to die for!! I love everything about this place. Highly recommend going here. I have tried so many different things on this menu and I have liked everything. I will definitely be back.

The food is very good but it is always busy and there is always a wait. <br>It does get rather loud in there too. <br>The staff is very pleasant and quick to help. <br>They have a ton of choice. Something for everyone!

A few weeks ago, I came here for the first time and thought it was amazing. Most places give you a tiny personal pizza and you end up still hungry. Because of this, I ordered a personal pizza and chicken tenders. I was wrong and a big, still warm pizza came with large chicken tenders and fries. I ended up having to take most of it home. The wait for our food was a bit long but we had delicious bread at our table along with butter. 10/10 would go there again.
Long wait for mediocre food and subpar service a huge menu and when the waitress takes your order they are out of what you want! I will never return to many choices in vegas

Let me start off by saying i am pregnant &amp; can eat very limited things. My pregnancy by far has been hard due to the fact that my baby does not like much food. So when i have to order from different restaurants every day due to an actual craving, i expect to get what i pay for &amp; ordered. I ordered a cuban sandwich specifically bc there are pickles in it. I go pick up my order, drive all the way back home bc i am not down the street, to find not only did they put no pickles but also didn&#39;t put mustard. This doesn&#39;t taste like a cuban sandwich at all now, it tastes like a panini from panera bread, plain.

Wowwww I&#39;ve been to cheesecake since I was 18 in la. <br>We go to Boca bout 1x a month. <br>Place to-Go&#39;s OFTEN <br>THEY MUST HAVE A NEW PERSON ON PHONES.!!!<br>Asked questions she didn&#39;t know answers to.  I was stuck.  I just settled for regular order. Chick couldn&#39;t explain items or food!!! Really bad phone service. I called <br>Sunday January 10 @2:10pm

Yummy food and rich cheesecake :) I have eaten at Cheesecake Factory numerous times over the years. <br><br>I wanted to take a moment to yelp the help. In this case, I am giving a shot out to Even. We were sitting on the patio and he had a pretty decent table load, yet he was attentive and prompt.

I come here twice a year...mother&#39;s day and mom&#39;s birthday...I feel like there&#39;s a pattern here.<br><br>With one of the largest menu&#39;s around you&#39;d think you could please everyone?...well maybe if everything they made was great....instead I am let-down more than I am delighted.  Most of their items aren&#39;t bad, but seldom does anything stand out to me.  I pity the servers here, and the corporate demands they seem to have to deal with...if it is obvious to the customer then it isn&#39;t working.<br><br>My go-to classic is the Chicken Madeira.  It is one of the better chicken dishes from a chain-restaurant.  I&#39;m not really into desserts, but I can share the Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake any time I&#39;m here!<br><br>Needless to say I love my mom, and am more excited to see her than I am to come to The Cheesecake Factory...and being that we have a large family, The Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t really all that bad of a choice...we cold do a lot worse!

I&#39;ve been enjoying the Cheesecake Factory with my family for many years, mostly in California. We tried this one today since we now live in Summerlin Las Vegas and were quite disappointed. Service was very slow. Waitress was very unpleasant, snappy, and unfriendly .  Is it so difficult to smile?  At the end she just threw the bill on the table and then grabbed my credit card out of my hand instead of using the small black folder that every other waitress was using, then came back with that black folder in one hand- empty!- and my credit card in her other hand...it was weird

My sister and I took her boyfriend for his birthday dinner, the appetizer quesadilla were amazing. I ordered the Sheila salad I believe it&#39;s called, it said chicken, avocado, tortilla chips and peanuts. Yum. When I got it, no avocado or tortilla chips. I picked through, looked, told my server, she then looked puzzled and came back with tiny bowls of avocado and chips. I tried to make it work, maybe took two bites, told her I wasn&#39;t happy with it, still on the bill and still paid the $15.<br><br>Birthday time. I had told a manager about the birthday, server handed him the menu, he selected which slice, the sang happy birthday, then charged for the cake.<br><br>I&#39;m a server, it&#39;s hard to even write a bad review for me, but that service was just not how guest should be treated. I shouldn&#39;t have had to remake my salad when there was an error. And I&#39;ve never been to a place where they charge for birthday desserts.

Chicken Madeira &amp; Steak Diane combo<br>Yummy. Subbed the mash potatoes for asparagus. A minor faux pas- The beef medallions weren&#39;t cooked evenly: 2 pieces were medium rare and one medium.  3.5 stars<br><br>Lemon raspberry cheesecake my fave. It has lady fingers at the bottom. 4 stars<br><br>The service was good and then went into the toilet when the server got another table of diners. 3 stars

As a person that is constantly eating out Cheesecake Factory never seems to stop satisfying me. This is one of my favorite places to eat. The portions of the food is an absolute perfect size. The prize for food is perfect as well. They always over succeed my expectations no matter what location I go to. The Cheese Cake staff actually understands and cares for the clients needs. I will always be coming back!

The food was great but the service was really slow.... and it was not busy.<br>lots a waitors walking around. horseplaying. <br>only saw our waitress twice. <br>one to take our order and the other to take our money. lol<br><br>ordered the lunch special: pizza and salad<br>both big portions.<br>could not finish<br>both really good.

I am a regular customer there,and I always get the same thing.which is the luau chicken salad.I realized that they had added pineapple to it,and it didn&#39;t have a flavor to it.plus I use to love the dressing ,but i realize that the dressing was too vinegry....and I realized that they put the complimentary bread in the microwave........<br><br>I honestly didn&#39;t want to make a scene,but I realize that ,something changed in that place,even though the food came out very quick,but I just felt ,who ever made that salad,did a sloppy <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fjob.by&amp;s=05c8e2d0f3fc8aca114fac897b9f0c68fbba21348503f5c0f14ed56c67a0f20e" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">job.by</a> the way,it have been more then a week since i ate there.I honestly love the cheese cake factory,I will always come back,cause,they have stuff on their menu,that you can&#39;t find any where,but i just wish,the luau salad, didn&#39;t have the pineapple.plus it wasn&#39;t too appetiting.

This was my first experience at this location. I have been to the other locations in Vegas and I wanted to try this one in Summerlin.    <br><br>We arrived and were promptly seated after  a few minutes. <br>We were there during a shift change and had two servers. Both were attentive, friendly, and professional. They made our visit enjoyable.<br><br>The food was awesome! After I decided what to order. The menu selection is huge.<br>My wife had the chicken taquitos, which were very authentic and dang good!<br>I had the Steak Diane and herb crusted Salmon combo. The Steak with the sauce and mushrooms was very flavorful. But the star of the meal for me was the Salmon. I normally don&#39;t order Salmon at restaurants but the description sounded good and our server indicated that it was wild caught, which was the selling point for me.<br>I&#39;m just going to say that it&#39;s the best Salmon I&#39;ve ever had at a restaurant!  Nough said!<br><br>Overall this is the best experience I&#39;ve ever had at a Cheesecake Factory. I highly recommend a visit to this location.

2 star dinner with 5 star service with 2 star facilities.  Philly cheese steak sandwich was quite average.  Too much bell pepper and steak a little too thick to be great.  The steak was seasoned well, as were the sweet potato fries.  Breakfast is served all day.  The omelet was huge (easily enough for 2 hungry people) but nothing special.  Needed a little salt.  It was served with potatoes fried with onions.  Didn&#39;t look all that appetizing because the onions were in a big clump instead of being more evenly dispersed.  The restaurant floor was not wet but slippery.  It felt to me like someone spilled something oily and it got tracked around.  The men&#39;s restroom was very disappointing.  Had a long puddle of water under the sinks.  Granted, it was after 9:00 with a 10:00 closing time but I still expect better from a sit-down restaurant.
I thought id try something different from my favorite spot so went for the &#34;thai salmon &#34;was super good well seasoned an worth every penny

I&#39;ve had good meals here before, but today was not one of those days.  We ordered over $100 of food to go and the food was terrible.  The California cheesesteak was terrible!  The meat was disgusting, tough and just plain terrible.  The chicken enchiladas were horribly bland and the rice literally tasted like cardboard.  I&#39;ve never been this disappointed in this location.

It seems like every time I go to Cheesecake Factory my fork and knife in the roll up is caked with old food.... Seriously are you guys doing roll ups in the dark or do you just not care that when I unroll my utensils that I see other peoples left over food all over my fork and knife and you think it&#39;s ok to give that to me? I wonder how clean everything else is if repeatedly this issue happens and no one cares to resolve it. Disappointing and disgusting.
One of the best locations thus far in this part of town ! Came into lunch with my boyfriend , had Kimberly serve us and she was amazing ! The mac and cheese burger is a must try :).

Their Godiva Chocolate cheesecake is to die for. Get it. You won&#39;t regret it if you&#39;re a dark chocolate fan. $8 a slice. Cheaper to buy the whole cake but I wasn&#39;t about to eat an entire cake.

We had a gift card from Christmas that we finally used. The service at this location is the best of any Cheesecake Factory I have ever been into. It was so great that we raved about our server to the General Manager, Lin. <br><br>I had the usual-- cajun jambalaya pasta. It&#39;s amazing every time, and my go to when I order from Cheesecake.<br><br>We ordered a bottle of wine, had a fantastic time, and will be back as soon as we can for the service alone.

our favourite restaurant in general and our favourite cheesecake factory in town!! we used to live 10 minutes away but now we prefer the 30 minute drive than going to the one closer to us. the food is great, the service is great, everything is fantastic!!

I am giving it high reviews because I love going there.... I love the small plates and the big plates too.... Few suggestions.... Make a cheesecake sampler dessert plate (for those that are arguing what to get)..... Make a vegan cheesecake... Make one with ricotta cheese, call it a cannoli cheesecake.... (I want royalties for that one!!!) Make cheesecake mini bites (for someone who just want a bite!!!)..... <br>I ordered an Asian steak dish forget what it was called and it was amazing!!!

This Cheesecake Factory is absolutely terrible. Not just once or twice have we had a problem. Every time we come to this location the staff is disrespectful and inconsiderate. <br>I am giving them two stars just for the taste of the food.<br>The other three stars are being subtracted for the service this location gives. Today&#39;s experience consisted of me walking in to order one slice of cake to go. It was the truffle cake. Usually the thing is pretty big. But not today, it was half the size it usually is. When I asked the worker her response was I was wrong that it&#39;s smaller than usual. She told me I Must of got the last slice the other 25 times I&#39;ve bought the same cake. <br>She had terrible customer service. I waited for a few minutes then asked for a manager. When I told the manager it was smaller she said it did look smaller and she would get another slice. She came back and told me they measured it and it was the right size but they would give me a different slice. They came back with it and it was bigger than the first one but the same as the others I&#39;ve gotten over the years. <br><br>It may sound so petty to complain about a slice of cake being half the size of what they usually serve but when I get told I am wrong about what I have received before, it rubs me the wrong way.

wait for a table an hour for a gfupo of 8 because they can not join tables is ridiculous and then build another 30 for drinks and the waitress was wrong in the order but forgot an order  pay attention is ridiculous

My son gave us a gift certificate and we could not have been more pleased. We&#39;ve been to other Cheesecake Factories but not this location. FABULOUS! Service was good but the Kale &amp; Quinoa salad was off the charts. We also had the Portofino Pizza which could be as good a pie I&#39;ve had in a long time.

Horrible experience waited 45 min for food waitress comes over and says the plates bribe in kitchen and glass got in our food waited another 10 min salad was thrown together pasta four cheese cold mgr went and remade out of the mood hot cheese cake to go went to pay bill has a gift card from a prior incident in Henderson in Dec waitress says there&#39;s nothing on card than mgr comes says sorry bal 0 so I pay $45 after they charged for 2 pasta took off cheesecake I was very embarrassed disappointed in mgr and waitress waitress told us she would bring bread they were cooking never happed asked for lemon twice we are leaving and waitress goes to check in stand and proceeded to tell another person about myself and 17 yr old grand daughter very unprofessional I come home call about gift card has $50 so now I&#39;m really mad called back the mgr gave him card # and issues was waitress wrote down last digit wrong I asked the mgr you want to see says no maybe if he would of looked at it checked the number but didn&#39;t want to be bothered he says sorry we will have a talk with waitress I am customer service rep and never never rude or disrespect them as I would not want that done to me. This was the last time I step foot in Cheesecake Factory rude and embarrassing

The ahi salad was the best I ever had. Sadly my husband&#39;s Cobb salad looked like they scraped other people&#39;s leftovers in the to go box. We did not dine in. If I realized what a mess that salad was before I got home I would not have took it. This was my husband&#39;s first time eating Cheesecake Factory food. I won&#39;t be able to get him to go back.

I&#39;ve been to this location several times and I&#39;ve always received excellent service but the last time I was here I was seriously impressed!<br>Let me start by saying my lovely husband thought it would be a good idea to take the whole family out for lunch on sunday, mother&#39;s day, noon time .... let&#39;s just say my expectations for an amazing experience were not very high.  I was definitely proven wrong on my trip here! The waiting area was obviously ridiculously packed so I expected the wait to be nothing less then an hour. Thirty minutes later we were sat and promptly offered bread and had our drink order taken . Our food arrived within 15/20 min after we ordered and let me say it was delicious! Our server Dan was was super great. He checked on us several times , refilled our drinks and asked how our food was . I joked with my husband that this was the day all the cheesecake factory employees had been training for because it doesn&#39;t get crazier than mother&#39;s day and they nailed it! Thanks again for a great experience!
This place is always good, but really pricey. I really don&#39;t think a slice of cheesecake should be that expensive.

Alfredo fettuccine plus a cheesecake? Is that even legal? Haha well I had both! Always a great time there fast and friendly and the food is always great.  Just thinking about it makes me hungry! Customer service is top notch. And the place a warm and inviting setting. I&#39;ll be there back. Thank you!

I used to love this place.  The quality of the food has gone down.  They probably keep the place lit so dimly so that you can&#39;t see what you&#39;re eating.  The menu is ridiculously long like a novel.  They should focus on quality instead of variety.  The prices are ridiculously high for bar type food.  I suggest if you come order a cocktail and cheesecake.  The service is always good though...just not the food.

I went for happy hour with a friend and we ordered two appetizers: the Parmesan garlic bread and the fried macaroni and cheese, and one entree of Chicken di Panna. The bread was really delicious and we enjoyed the fresh garlic and olive oil. The marinara(?) sauce was very out of the jar tasting. The fried mac and cheese breading was heavier than we remembered. Of course by the time the entree arrived, which we were splitting, we were pretty full! But we were sat almost immediately, our server was very attentive with wine knowledge, and our glasses were never empty.

You can never go wrong with whatever you order at any Cheesecake Factory across the country.   The food is always consistently delicious and it&#39;s a great place to bring a group of people who may be in the mood for vastly different dishes.  My personal favorites are the mint green tea with simple syrup on the side, the Asian chicken lettuce wraps from the Light Menu, and the Ghirardelli chocolate brownie sundae!
My favorite appetizers are Avocado Eggrolls and Stuffed Mushrooms. <br>My favorite dishes are Shrimp and Chicken Gumbo and Chicken Bellagio.

Food that came out properly the first time was good. Had to make my steak go back, didn&#39;t bring it out as I asked for it. We were dehydrated the whole meal. I didn&#39;t get lemons until my food came out for my water and asked for them three times and never got them. The menu had cherry cheesecake on it, which they didn&#39;t serve anymore. Change the menu. Other than that my wife&#39;s pasta was good.

Always a crowd pleaser..... Who does not like cheesecake???  Big menu has plenty of choices for everyone.... Service is consistently very good too!  It&#39;s a big hit for the very young and seniors because of the various portion sizes and styles of food....

I had an amazing time here. Yes it was short and simple but everything I expected!  When my friend and I came it was only a 15 min wait. When we sat down our server Nate, didn&#39;t rush to take our order. No, he didn&#39;t suggest anything but I knew that he just started his shift. I had a Carmel Royale macchiato which was on point! The calamari,  was crispy, little to salty but very good with the garlic sauce. And ofcoarse what we originally came for was the cheesecake! My friend,  order the pecan turtle cheesecake breath taking! And I order the warm apple crisp, delightful!  Everything came on a timely manner! I enjoyed eating here! Thank you Nate!

Service here is always good from the hostess to the waiter, not to mention the large selection of food. I have yet to try everything because of their expanding menu. So far all items I tried is delicious.  Being on vacation, we splurged a little on the entrees, good thing they have lunch portions. Of course we have to have dessert here, so ate only 1/2 the entrees to be able to share their scrumptious Godiva chocolate brownie sundae. Hmmm...food coma. Definitely one of favorite places to do, consistent in all locations I have visited.

Extremely disappointing. Went in around 8pm for brothers graduation dinner. Restaurant was pretty dead, but our server was very slow. Took 25 minutes for our party of 5 to get a round of sodas. Upon ordering a pizza, I was informed 10 minutes later that the kitchen burned all of the pizza and flatbread dough so they couldn&#39;t make any more pizzas for the night.. great. Cheeseburger egg rolls were served without ketchup. When we were all done for the evening and asked for a to go box we patiently waited for ten minutes and finally took it upon ourselves to get up and get one. Like I said the restaurant was dead. There&#39;s no reason for the service to have been as slow as it was. Cheesecake Factory  was disappointing on a night of celebration for our family.

I always love this place no matter what city I am in. I frequent Vegas as my in laws live there and having two kids under 3, it is difficult to dine out with them sometimes. I loved the speed in which our server, James, got our food out to us. He also understood to get our kids meals out faster so that a mutiny didn&#39;t erupt. Our meals came out hot and delicious and fast!<br><br>My only slight and very minor complaint was the kids meals came out PIPING HOT. I understand they were busy but it did mean we had food the kids couldnt eat for a minute or two but they were looking at it and couldnt understand why they couldnt eat it. Yes we know to blow on the food to help out but still the cheese sauce for the Mac n Cheese was lava hot. <br><br>STILL will be going back!
Place is ok. It&#39;s to be expected. I never did like this place since I was living in NY.  Food is ok deserts suck and so does the service.<br>Don&#39;t think I will be returning.

HORRIBLE!  The service is horrible, the food is mediocre and now three of us have food poisoning!!  Do NOT eat here!  We ordered curbside, waited an hour for our food.  I paid with &#34;cake pay&#34;. The server argued with me stating I hadn&#39;t paid, had to wait another 15 minutes for her to figure it out.  Now my 7 year old and 13 year old have vomited multiple times all over their beds, carpet and respective bathrooms and I have had diarrhea for an hour!  Either the incompetent staff intentionally did something to make us sick (because I complained about the excessive wait) or it&#39;s a terrible coincidence because we all ordered different items.  We are big fans of the Cheesecake Factory but this particular location has failed multiple times with us, this final time being the worst and the last!

This location is nice, but our service today was mediocre at best. They seem to be too busy to care to provide quality. I had the chicken salad sandwich which was more mayonnaise, than anything else. They even put heavy mayo on the bread when the chicken salad was already oozing with mayo. The salad was poor quality, and the server was not knowledgeable of the menu. There was four of us, so overall the food was delivered properly. The server did not offer to correct the matter, but asked if I wanted to talk to a manager. She should ave just taken the food and had it served properly.

Wasn&#39;t very busy when we went in,  still took them 15mins after we where seated to take our order and that was only because we said we wanted to order when we could get hold of them. Ordered 2basic meals (pasta and burger)  waited more than 30mins and even then order was brought out incomplete. <br><br>Food was bad, pasta was mainly sauce with a few pieces of pasta swimming around, burger was subpar and well below most places even with the higher price.  Went in with getting cheesecake in mind and left without getting since everything we asked for took so long to appear. <br><br>Will not be going back here

great customer service in the bar area from our waiter michael! he greeted us promptly, drinks were filled, table touch was awesome and his honesty with our entree  selection made us feel like he cared. thank you
Service was really good.  Food was a little bland to my taste but every one else in my party enjoyed their own orders.  Seated quickly and was pleased with the cleanliness.

Worst experience I&#39;ve ever had. It took an hour and a half for us to get seated (granted it was Friday night and we chose to wait so that&#39;s not even the worst part). Once seated we figured things would go quickly, but we were very wrong, about 30 minutes before we could order then another hour waiting for food at our table. After waiting an hour one dish was over cooked and caught by the manager before being delivered, we were told it&#39;d be comped because the person had to wait even longer for food, it wasn&#39;t. So, we spent a total of three and a half hours here with &#34;ok&#34; food and were over charged. Not worth it at all.

Boca park store was good a little disappointing as we ordered spinach dip and the salsa that came with it was frozen!! As our entree was served there was a hair on the inside of the sandwich!  Remember the lighting in there in dim! It was replaced with another dish but took longer than expected .  Pet peeve is having dirty dishes sit on the end of the table and no one picks them up, which happened a few times!!  For the money that was spent this was disappointing.  On a up note the food was very good.

We decided to come to this location instead of the one in Henderson since it was closer and we thought we would have a nice experience. <br>Little did I know that we would have a really bad table.  <br>We had about 1 1/2 feet or room from the table to the left and when the gentleman on that table decided to step away for a moment his rear end ended up on my boyfriends food plate. <br>I had to move quickly to avoid the waiter hitting my face with his elbow when he brought the food to the other table and to make things worst as I used my spoon to try the salsa for my tacos there was a dried up piece of food on it, didn&#39;t see it since its a bit dark inside. <br>We had to laugh since the food was great <br>But had to yell at each other since the table to my left was so loud and to make things even more interesting, the gentleman on the left started to pick his nose. <br>What a great way to have a date night.

Great service, fun atmosphere, and such an expansive menu you will easily find something for everyone no matter what you are craving! And somehow they are able to nail every dish, I haven&#39;t been disappointed.

Waited over an hour for a table while people were being seated that came in after us. I saw two other party&#39;s leave because they had to wait. The hostess was bitchy, never once smiled nor did she have any type of customer service skills. Be on the lookout for Alexis the rude hostess. The manager; Caesar, had no idea how to handle customer service either. When he told us the hostess made a mistake he never apologized and just simply said you will have to wait. WOW. We have been going to this restaurant for many years. People don&#39;t return because of the poor service and treatment and you can count us out. We won&#39;t be back.

Went to The Cheesecake Factory for lunch yesterday, with my Mommy in law. Oh my goodness!!! We ordered an appetizer called Dynamite Shrimp it was sooooo good the sauce it came with was half part of the yummy factor! On to the bread they serve while you order, it was really good. For my actual lunch I ordered the Parmesan Chicken.. very tasty. I looked at the other items and found why order and burger and fries when I can get a dinner for three $$ more and take it home for lunch the next day! My Mommy in law got a noodle dish and she said it was delicious. We both had left over food to take home. So yes I&#39;ll be going there again..even just for that Dynamite Shrimp! I&#39;m craving it now lol. Mmmm<br>Server was Mike, he was very good and checked on us plus bagged our food to go. Very nice gentleman he was!
Service is awesome. Food is splendid, much better quality than the other cheesecake factory I&#39;ve been in. Love it!

Never been in this location but ordered to-go.  It was so nice to get home with everything we ordered with plastic ware. All warm food was warm and the cheesecake was cold.  Much appreciated for $90 in to-go food.  Love their lettuce wraps.

Love love love this place! I never have a bad meal and the service is excellent. This location is located in the Boca Park shopping center. For customers they offer free valet parking. If you don&#39;t feel like valet, they have a private lot for parking or there is a parking garage.<br><br>I love to start with the &#34;Avocado Eggrolls&#34; and if you have never tried them you must! They were priced at $10.50 and can easily be shared.  My favorite thing to order for my meal is the &#34;Carlton Salad&#34;. It is huge but I manage to polish off every last bite because the awesome flavor keeps my fork going back for more. The salad was priced at $13.95 which is fair for the size and amount of fresh fruits &amp; veggies in it.<br><br>The only problem is I never have room for one of their many choices of fabulous cheesecake for dessert so I pick one to-go. This last visit it was a hard choice but they are all so good I new I couldn&#39;t go wrong with the &#34;Reese&#39;s Peanut Butter Cheesecake&#34;.  If you don&#39;t feel like eating inside or outside on the patio, you can phone in your order for pick up. They say to wait in your car and they will bring out your order but if I phone in a order I usually just go inside and pick it up because they are always so doggone busy.  I noticed on the menu they offer catering.

Great location, beautiful atmosphere and wonderful service. The parking was congested at 5:00, but there is free valet. The only complaint is that the food wasn&#39;t quite as good as the location I usually frequent, but to be fair, I was only here once.

Love the steak of Diane. Plenty of dishes to like and choose from. Most of the items are delicious. You can&#39;t go wrong with any of the cheesecakes but the prices for a single cheesecake is ridiculous. <br><br>The menu has so many options that it makes it hard to choose. I also hate all the ads in the menu!! Isn&#39;t this place big enough not to have ads. There always seems to be a wait even though there are plenty of open tables. Guess they just want us to think they are super busy. <br><br>Definitely will come back for the cheesecake. Pumpkin is my families favorite.

Had a family style lunch to celebrate a birthday on a busy Saturday.  They were very accommodating for a large party of 8.  We waited 15 minutes for a table.  Our waiter was very nice and attended to all our needs.  We enjoyed all the food and the cheesecake is always amazing!  I ordered the Bang-Bang Chicken and Shrimp with brown rice.  Portion was delicious, but  super huge could only finish half.  At end of meal, a kalua cocoa coffee cheesecake was served for birthday celebrant.  That cheesecake was awesome, it was gone before a photo could be taken!
This Cheesecake Factory needs to work on their Curbside To Go! EVERY time I order pick up they MESS UP! EVERY TIME! I don&#39;t recommend it. Yummy food but bad service!
Despite being extremely packed we were sat down in a clean and ready booth. The food came out surprisingly fast. Way to have a solid team on point! Food was delicious and service was solid.

I normally would go to the Cheesecake Factory in green valley, where I&#39;ve never had an issue, but since I was in the area with friends we came to this location. <br><br>I really was blown away by the level of horrible service we received, I barely even know where to start. First it took probably 20-30 minutes for our drinks to come (iced tea!). Even longer for the bread. When ordering, my mother was making sure her meal came with chicken and the waiter, in a disrespectful and condescending tone said, &#34;of course it comes with chicken, it&#39;s in the name.&#34; When my mother pointed out it does not say chicken in the name he continued to argue with her. I can&#39;t even tell you how long it took for our actual meals to come out and when they did my friends order was wrong and mine, being the last one out, finally came when everyone in my party was done eating!! Before my sandwich finally came one of the managers came to sort of apologize and quickly left our table before we could even express our unhappiness. The final straw was when our waiter was clearly trying to be rid of us, moving too quickly to hand us boxes and our boxed up cheesecake, he knocked over my half drunk (overly expensive) drink all over my phone and all down the front of me. He barely apologized for this and rushed off. <br><br>I really never complain let alone post anything like this but the service we received today was totally unacceptable and I will not be returning to this location. If I could I would have given this location zero stars.

Home away from home! Cheesecake factory of Las Vegas vs Cheesecake Factory of San Francisco! All I can say is, you can&#39;t go wrong w/Cheesecake Factory ppl! If I had a tail, it would have been wagging! LOL Ok although the room temp was on the chilly side, MAYBE that&#39;s why the bread was on the hard side. But I MUST say yuuumy on all that was ordered today! Along w/the sweet, warm &amp; very professional service from our server ( &amp; I HUMBLY appologize on somewhat forgetting his name, probably due to the fact of the well made 3 Flying Gorilla&#39;s &amp; 1 Pineapple Mojito we ordered for starters) Marvin/Marty/Mark/Mario? Bravo! Because of your welcoming service, well worth of a return visit!!

I&#39;ve been going to the Cheesecake Factory for years (25+) and it never disappoints.  Ever.  I have found my favorites and typically stick to those: Cajun Chicken Littles, Herb Crusted Salmon, Chicken Costoletta, Avocado Eggrolls. The menu is massive and has just about everything.  I also want to mention the sauces and sides are amazing.   The corn succotash, creamy lemon sauce and that Tamarind cashew dipping sauce for the eggrolls are perfection.  The redskin mashed potatoes are so delicious as well.  I want to try everything on the menu but always seem to stick to what I crave.  And let&#39;s not forget their cheesecake.  The best.  One of my favorite restaurants for sure!

TLDR: expansive menu + kids&#39;, long waits, standard service, inside/outside seating<br><br>This California-based company prides itself on continuing Oscar&#39;s and Evelyn&#39;s dream of providing excellent cheesecakes and desserts in a bakery setting. I&#39;m not so sure that this is reflected in today&#39;s restaurants, started by their son, David. <br><br>My family decided that we would venture into the not-so-upscale Fashion Village at Boca Park. Because Cheesecake Factory boasts an expansive menu, even for the kiddos, I guess I wouldn&#39;t mind holding our spot in line for our large party. A promised 45-minute wait, although expected at peak dining hours on a Saturday night, was cut down to about 25 minutes: an unexpected, but welcome, plus! The host stand seemed filled with unnerving hostesses as well as the hustle and bustle of seating all the walk-up guests. They probably needed a break and a reminder that every new customer deserves a positive experience. <br><br>Upon seating, I was immediately greeted my by waitress. Her smile appeared genuine and her customer service rhetoric was unwavering excellent. I was impressed. A secondary server/busser provided bread and waters for all the guests without question. It was fantastic. Our waitress was very accommodating, making suggestions, attentively listening to our requests/restrictions, and tending to the needs of the young children at the table. Upon everyone&#39;s food delivery, a manager approached my table to discuss the reason as to why my salmon salad wasn&#39;t delivered yet. He stated a vague, yet wordsmithed response in which he basically stalled for an additional 7 minutes. The &#34;fish just wasn&#39;t right&#34; probably meant that it wasn&#39;t cooked yet, it fell on the floor, they forgot, or any combination of two. A specific, yet honest answer would have been more appreciated. Isn&#39;t honesty the best policy?<br><br>Although the selected dishes varied, I will comment on what I tasted during my experience. My salmon salad for $17.95 was delicious. An herb-crusted salmon topped field greens, cut tomatoes, endive, and asparagus paired nicely with my glass of iced green tea (suggest simple syrup from the bar to accompany the drink). The salmon looked at least 8oz and did not overpower the dish. I recommend the ranch in lieu of the vinaigrette. The children&#39;s pepperoni pizza can be a little spicy for children, so be wary of your picky eaters. The tostada salad is a mouth-watering heaping mound of greens atop chicken and a tostada. The lettuce wasn&#39;t dried/spun prior to plating and, therefore, left an unnecessary pool of water on the plate and tostada (which transformed into a soft taco shell). The meatloaf is average: nothing special and nothing exciting. Save yourself and select an alternative dish. For dessert, the limoncello cream torte was to die for. Layers of vanilla cake christened with lemon marscopone allows for a sweet dish worthy in lieu of any dessert wine. <br><br>As we received the check, our desserts were double charged, a strike two for our experience. With the tardiness in food delivery, accuracy of order, and initial experience, I rate it 3/3.5 stars.

Sunday brunch was a hit. Of course I started with the carott cake cheesecake.  The mac and cheese cheeseburger was good. Service was not as good as usual, but it was quite busy. Overall very nice way to spend a Sunday afternoon.

Went to Cheesecake Factory for the first time in a long time. Boy was it mediocre! My wife and I walked in at about 3:30PM and it was almost entirely empty. My wife is currently walking with a cane as she is recovering from knee replacement surgery. The hostess greeted us and promptly told us it would be about a five minute wait - please have a seat. WHAT??? five minute wait in an empty restaurant??? Did she see the cane? Does she know that 95% of the tables are wide open? I am not exaggerating, it was 95% EMPTY!!!! <br><br>OK, let it go... she was stupid. We were seated in about three minutes - just long enough for my wife to uncomfortably sit down and stand back up again. <br><br>Food took a LONG time to come out - especially considering how busy the kitchen was (sarcasm). I ordered the herb crusted salmon salad from their new &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menu. My wife had the Steak Diane/Chicken Madiera combo. Hers was what you&#39;d expect - typical Cheesecake Factory OK meal. Mine on the other hand was UNDERWHELMING. Our server informed me that the salmon on this salad usually comes cold, unless I would like it heated. I opted for warmed. Big mistake.
